loans.name: Josefina Yolanda

texts.es:
Josefina Yolanda D. Muñoz tiene 54 anos. Es casada vive con el compañero y un hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 
 
 Josefina es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Josefina  trabaja en el comercio de venta de ropa, zapatos y cosmeticos, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es ponerse un  local, tener casa propia y viajar el Estados Unidos.
Le gusta viajar a visitar a las nietas.
texts.en:
Josefina Yolanda D. Muñoz is 54-years-old. She's married and lives with her partner and son. She lives in El Cantón de Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has 3 children. 

Josefina is a member of the rural fund La Esperanza, which is located 25 kilometers from Cantón de Ventanas. It's a community that participates primarily in commerce. The group meets each month in the neighborhood of San Vicente.

Josefina sells clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil and sells it in a shop in her home. She's requesting the credit to buy more merchandise to expand her business. With the support of the loan she'll be able to cover her necessities. Her dream is to open a shop, own her own home, and travel to the United States. She would like to visit her granddaughters.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Ruben vive en alquiler en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, está casado y tiene dos niños de 4 y 2 años de edad; la actividad que realiza es la confección de neceseres (pequeñas carteras para guardar cosméticos), carteras, bolsones, porta celulares, etc. los cuales los comercializa en un puesto de venta que tiene en su mismo domicilio.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela de mejor calidad y poder mantener el negocio estable ya que tiene varios pedidos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, a través de Kiva. Por la actividad que desarrolla, Ruben puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Ruben lives in rented housing in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children, ages 4 and 2. The business which he carries out is the manufacture of “neceseres” (small purses for keeping cosmetics), purses, satchels, cell phone carriers, etc., which he sells from a stand that he has in his home.

The loan he is applying for is for the purchase of better quality fabric which will allow him to maintain a stable business, since he has a number of orders. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Impro through Kiva. Because the business is expanding Ruben can meet the terms of a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of better quality fabrics in order to continue with his business of making purses, satchels, cell phone carriers, etc.

loans.name: Geomar Leonor

texts.es:
Geomar Leonor  C. P. tiene 43 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 
 
Geomar es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Geomar trabaja en el comercio de venta de bloques para la construcción de viviendas,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para hacer su casa y viajar a España donde están sus familiares.
Le gusta levantarse temprano para empezar a trabajar.
texts.en:
Geomar Leonor C. P. is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

Geomar is a member of the La Esperanza communal bank, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated primarily to commerce. The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Geomar works selling blocks for housing construction. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and then sells them from a business in her house. She likes to get up early to start working.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand her business. The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have money to make her house and to travel to Spain where her relatives are.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groundnuts, palm oil and firewood.

loans.name: Carolina Anabel

texts.es:
Carolina Anabel E. C. tiene 23 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.
  
Carolina  una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Carolina trabaja en el comercio vende accesorio por catalogo como aretes, perfumes,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para terminar la carrera y comprar un carro y ampliar la casa.
Le gusta escuchar música y estudiar.
texts.en:
Carolina Anabel E. C. is 23 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

Carolina is a member of the La Esperanza communal bank, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated primarily to commerce. The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Carolina works selling accessories by catalog such as earrings and perfume. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells them from a business in her house, and door-to-door.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand her business. The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have money to finish her degree and to buy a car and expand her house. She likes to listen to music and to study.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Hasta El Ultimo Rinconº Group

texts.es:
HASTA EL ÚLTIMO RINCON:
Luisa Esperanza Tiene 42 años D. edad es casada con Toribio P.  Esperanza  se dedica a la  venta D. trajes Y tejidos típicos ella los venD. ambulantemente se caracteriza por ser una persona amable solidaria capaz D. desempeñar cualquier cargo por eso la han elegido como presidenta el resto del grupo se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos y pollo algunas D. ellas a la artesanía y venta D. güipiles este grupo es llamado  hasta el último rincón y es formado por catorce socias
texts.en:
HASTA EL ÚLTIMO RINCON: Luisa Esperanza is 42 years old and married to Toribio P. Esperanza. She works selling traditional dresses and fabrics on foot. She is characterized for being a very and supportive person that is capable of holding any position. This is why they have chosen her as president.

The rest of the group works raising pigs and chickens and some work in handicrafts and selling huipils. The name of the group is Hasta el ultimo rincón and it is comprised of fourteen members.

loans.use: Traditional dresses and fabrics

loans.name: Motema Mpiko Plus Group

texts.en: Osé is a leader of a Community bank named “Motema Mpiko Plus”, which is composed of 17 microentrepreneurs.  Osé, aged 35, is married with two children and sells pairs of shoes in the north western area of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 2003. He has acquired solid experience and his business has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. He is a loyal client and has already made 4 MFI HOPE DRC loans and repaid them properly. He intends with the next loan to purchase 25 pairs of shoes to increase the inventory of his business in order to increase the business income. Currently, he earns a profit of $70 every week.

loans.use: to purchase 25 pairs of shoes for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cecibel Alexandra

texts.es:
Cecibel Alexandra Ragundi M. tiene 31 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.  

Cecibel es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Cecibel trabaja en el comercio vende ropa y perfumes,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para comprar carro y casa y dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Cecibel Alexandra Ragundi M. is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

Cecibel is a member of the La Esperanza communal bank, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated primarily to commerce. The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Cecibel works selling clothing and perfumes. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells them from a business in her house, and door-to-door.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand her business. The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have money to buy a car and house, and to educate her children. She likes to walk with her family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “AMAUTA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen;  La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, La socia tiene un negocio de lavado de autos y cambio de aceite, La socia también tiene una tienda abarrotes y lo atienden toda la familia, La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y le gusta administrar y atender ella misma sus propios negocios; La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería en el caso de su tienda abarrotes y también comprar aceites para implementar su lavado de autos y engrase. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus dos negocios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Amauta communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac, part of the province and department of Cusco.

Carmen is 65 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a car washing and oil change business, as well as a grocery store to which all of the family attends.  She is a very hardworking woman and she likes to manage and attend to her own businesses.  Carmen is requesting the loan to be able to buy merchandise for her grocery store and also to buy oils for her car wash and lube business.  She is requesting the loan to invest in the two businesses.

Carmen appreciates and values the loan provided and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in her two businesses.

loans.name: Mila

texts.es: Mila tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Tiene su tienda desde hace 6 años, en un inicio vendía útiles de escritorio, con el tiempo implementó su negocio con productos alimenticios que hasta el día de hoy vende con mayor intensidad. Desde entonces atiende todos los días incluidos los fines de semana; con el tiempo la demanda de productos ha aumentado, asimismo sus clientes le piden comida para animales, ya sea de aves o reses. En tanto, se dedica también a la agricultura, en donde siembra papa y maíz principalmente; esto es un punto a su favor para mejorar su economía. En adelante Mila desea seguir vendiendo  productos de acuerdo a la necesidad de sus clientes. Es su séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, por ser una persona responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para incrementar su negocio con variados productos, asimismo continuará con la siembra de maíz, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en: Mila, 31, lives with her husband and their 2 children in her parents' house.  She has had her store for 6 years.  She initially sold stationary, and later began selling foodstuffs, which now sell more frequently.  Since selling food, she works in the store every day including weekends.  With time, demand for products has increased, with her customers asking for animal feed, be it for birds or cattle.  In addition, she works as a farmer, principally growing potato and corn, another way she tries to improve her income.  Going forward, Mila wants to continue selling products as her customers need.  This is her seventh loan from MFP.  She is very happy in knowing she has financial support, because of being a responsible person in paying back, and she also likes being part of her community bank because all the members support one another.  She thanks those who will be donors for the loan she is asking for, since it will be very useful in the progress of her business.  She will use the loan she is asking for to increase her business with various products, as well as continue planting corn, for which she will buy fertilizer.

loans.use: Supply her store with various products.

loans.name: Sheyla Yolanda

texts.es: Sheyla Yolanda tiene 23 años su actividad es la venta de pollo hace mas de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito para su actividad, ella tiene 1 hijo de 3 años menor de edad y que está a su cargo inicio esta actividad para ayudar en los gastos del hogar quien le enseño este medio de vida fue su Mama ya que anteriormente ella tenía una pulpería así fue que Sheyla aprendió a ganarse la vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de pollo en pieza para ofertárselo a sus clientes.
texts.en: Sheyla Yolanda is 23 years old, and her work is selling chicken, which she has done for more than 5 years.  This is the first time she has asked for a loan for her work.  She has a 3-year-old son, and it is because he is in her care that she started her business in order to help with the household expenses.  Her mother, who earlier ran a store, was the one who taught her this means of making a living.  The loan is to buy chicken parts in order to sell them to her customers.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Sara Felicita

texts.es:
Sara Felicita E. M. tiene 63 años. Es viuda vive con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 
 
Sara es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Sara trabaja en el comercio vende ropa y perfumes, en las revistas de Yambal y Avon, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para comprar carro y tener un local propio.

Le gusta asistir a la iglesia y arreglar la casa tener muy limpia.
texts.en:
Sara Felicita E. M. is 63 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her only son in Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

Sara is a member of the Esperanza solidarity group, which is located 25 kilometers from central Ventanas canton.  It's a community that for the most part works in business, and it meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.
 
Sara has a business selling clothing and perfumes.  She buys things from the catalogs of Yanbal and Avon in Guyaquil and sells them either from her house or door-to-door.

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise to grow her business.  The loan will help her economically to acquire her necessities.  Her dream is to have enough money to buy a car and be able to have her own store.

She likes to help her church and keep her house clean.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to grow her business

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 64 years old and married with Patrocinia who is a retired teacher. They have two grown up daughters who have their own income, and live in a very well known neighborhood in the town of Ita. They have owned and operated a convenience store out of their house for 30 years. Their neighbors and passers-by can buy milk, soft drinks, sugar, rice, yerba (local drink), meat, salt, bread, charcoal, and other products for everyday consumption. In addition, he sells school items.

Cirilo says this activity has helped support his daughters through their studies; now one is a teacher and the other a professional masseuse but still helps with the house. The loan Cirilo is asking for will go towards buying more merchandise and maintain a better stock in his store.

loans.use: To buy supplies of milk, sugar, rice, meat

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es: Yitza Margarita tiene 60 años no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos con Fundación, pues ha demostrado ser una muy buena cliente. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, pues ha sido un gran apoyo para mantener a su familia. Yitza se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos  pues ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como sabanas, calzado, ropa interior y ropa en general, cosméticos y otras cosas. Ella sabe que si compra al mayor le resulta mucho más favorable pues así paga menos por los productos que compre. Ella sueña con mantener su negocio activo y asegurar el pan de cada día.
texts.en: Yitza Margarita is 60 years old and it is not the first time she has been financed by Fundacion Leon; she has proven to be a good client.  She sells general merchandise and it has been great to support her family.  Yitza considers herself as a very responsible person and enjoys the interaction she has with customers that come to her for different products.  She will use this loan to purchae raw materials such as; bed sheets, shoes, intimate clothing, general clothing, cosmetics, and other things.  She knows that it if more favorable for her if she purchases in bulk, this way she pays less for products.  She dreams of keeping her business active and securing her daily bread.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Women In Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Women In Unity” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 3,600,000 in order to expand the size and quality of their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Fudia K., pictured on the left. Fudia is age 56. She was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are no longer attending school. Fudia has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells firewood and she will use her share of this loan to buy firewood in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy firewood in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Francois Xavier

texts.en: Francois Xavier is 29 years old. He is single. He sells food and other items for home use in his boutique. He has spent five years in this business. With the loan, he will buy more food and lotions. His business is very common for the people around him simply because it is where they buy necessary items for home use daily. With the profit, he will increase the quantity of what he sells.

loans.use: To buy more food and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Verónica De Los Ángeles de 26 años, reside en el municipio de san Jacinto,  donde vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Verónica posee una pulpería en los cuales comercializa productos de primera necesidad como pastas, pan, huevos y otros más los cuales son fundamentales dentro de un hogar. Ella cuenta con 2 años de poseer el negocio, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando su economía familiar, la cual en muchas ocasiones es bastante mala, sobre todo porque muchas veces ella no cuenta con todos los productos que las personas buscan lo cual disminuye en gran manera sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir su negocio con esos productos tan necesarios que no posee.
texts.en: Veronica De Los Angeles is 26 years old and lives in the San Jacinto municipality alongside her husband and 2 children.  Veronica owns a grocery store where she sells items of basic necessity such as: pasta, bread, eggs, and other fundamental products to a household.   She has been owner for the past 2 years and it has helped to improve her household income which in most occasions is bad especially since most times she doesn't stock product that her clients look for and in return it diminishes her earnings.  This is why she is asking for a loan, in order to have the funds necessary to be able to stock her business with the much needed products she currently does not have.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Binta T. is a 42-year-old woman. She was born in Bombali, a district in northern Sierra Leone. She lives in Makeni city together with her husband who is a school teacher and her three school-going children. Binta is a businesswoman who sells cloths called “Bamakos.” She has been a businesswoman for many years now.  

Binta has requested a loan of SLL 3,500,000 from Kiva field partner Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT) in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy Bamako cloths in large quantities to add to her current stock. In this way, her business will improve in size and quality, attracting many customers into her business.

loans.use: Buy Bamako cloths in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
El Señor E. J. Froilan tiene 23 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, el es el hermano mayor de su familia su padre falleció cuando él era niño, desde entonces el y su madre son el único sustento que tiene su familia, el cuenta con 5 hermanos menores a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, el cliente se dedica al servicio de moto taxista en la localidad de Ivirgarzama hace mas de 3 años, el está afiliado al sindicato de moto taxista "CARRASCO",  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta demanda de pasajeros que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia, el sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas se apersonan para solicitar sus servicios.

El cliente es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una motocicleta, para mejorar la vida que lleva y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, para que sus hijos puedan terminar de estudiar.
texts.en:
Señor E. J. Froilan is 23 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  He is the oldest sibling in his family.  His father died when he was a child and since then he and his mother are the sole supporters of  the family.  He has 5 younger siblings whose education he helps to support.  He has been a moto taxi driver in the town of Ivirgarzama for the past 3 years.  He has also been an active member of the moto taxi union Carraso for 3 years.  The service that he offers is in high demand because it is easy, fast and efficient.  This makes it very profitable.  The union has stops and turns at different points in Ivirgarzama where people can come and request his services in-person.  

This is his first loan with our institution.   He will use it to buy a motorcycle to improve his quality of life and that of his family and his siblings will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his moto taxi business

loans.name: Kaberia

texts.en: Kaberia is 27 years old and single. For the past two years, he has worked in the printing business. He joined Faulu Kenya under the Visioners Group which allows him to mingle with businesspeople and gain business skills. Kaberia is employed and hopes that one day he will be able to leave his employment and open a business. In the future, he would like to open more printing outlets and employ people. He has requested 30,000 KES to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Abahuje Group

texts.en: Frolide is 32 years old. She is married to a farmer. They have three children between the ages of 11 and 2. One of her children goes to school. Frolide sells rice, beans and sugar. She has spent two years in this business which is well known. She sells in various marketplaces where she interacts with different customers. With this loan, she will buy more stock to sell. She plans to save the profit. Frolide feels proud of her business. Frolide is the group leader of Abahuje Group. Abahuje means "togetherness" in English. In the photo she is holding a UOB passbook with a red dress.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Christ Roi Plus Group

texts.en:
S. is 44 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children, ages 7 and 26 years old. She sells clothing, handbags, dishes and miscellaneous goods. She has been active in her business for years. She joined one of HOPE’s groups (a DR Congo microfinance program) in 2008 and has received ten loans. Thanks to HOPE’s loans, S.’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $60 per week. S. intends to buy more clothing with the next loan to resell at a profit in order to increase her capital. Her ambition is to become a clothing provider in her area. S. works hard in order to achieve her dream.

S. is the leader of the community bank named “Christ Roi Plus". It is composed of 15 members, who are united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 25 years old. She is married and has one child who is 2 and a half years old. Her husband is a soldier. Jeanne sells green bananas and Irish potatoes. She has had this business for five years. With this loan, she will buy more green bananas and Irish potatoes. She plans to save the profit from her business. She says that her business is well known by all her clients and that is why she has succeeded. In the future, she would like to upgrade her business and start selling new products like clothes.

Jeanne is the leader of a borrowing group called 'Tuzamurane Group'. Tuzamurane is a Kinyarwanda word that means 'Rise Together' in English. She is in the back row with her hand raised.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en: Claudine is 30 years old. she is married and has two children aged four and seven. One of her children goes to school. Her husband works as a rock extractor. Claudine is the leader of a borrowing group called Tuzamurane Group. Tuzamurane means "rise together" in English. Claudine sells various items such as sugar, rice, and cooking oil. She has been in this business for four years. With this loan, she will buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. With the profit from the business, she will save money. Her business is booming because she provides good customer service. In the future, she would like to own a big shop where all the people can buy from her.  In the photo, Claudine is on the second row holding a blue notebook.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber and nails

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Julia tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida como es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este negocio pues ha logrado obtenerlo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, es una persona que tiene el espíritu de salir adelante pues lucha por sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad y que están a su cargo es por esto el motivo del financiamiento que es para la compra de materia prima como cerdos, ya que le han realizado muy buenas propuestas y no le gustaría perderlas.
texts.en:
Julia has been a Fundación client for a long time.  She is very happy with her life’s work which is butchering pigs.  She has been in this business for over 17 years.  She has made it succeed through much effort and sacrifice.  She is a person with the determination to get ahead because she fights for the two minor children in her care.

The purpose of the loan is to buy raw materials like pigs because they are being offered at good prices and she doesn’t want to miss out on the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Abavandimwe Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 47 years old and her husband is a driver. They have eight children between the ages of two and 26. Two of them have completed their studies. Five more go to school, while the youngest is not yet of school age. Jeanne is a group leader of Abavandimwe Group. Abavandimwe is a Kinyarwanda word that means “The Relatives” in English.  
She sells beans and with this loan she will buy more beans to sell. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children. She dreams of having a big market where she can supply a larger quantity than what she has been selling. In the photo, Jeanne is the one with glasses.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria D. C. G. and her family started Express Cleaners in 2002 after her husband’s employer, a commercial laundry service, went out of business. Maria was a busy stay-at-home mom with four kids when her husband, Aron, came home and told her he had lost his job. However, they viewed this unfortunate event as an opportunity to start their own dry cleaning business. They spent their savings and bought machinery to start the business. Aron’s coworkers at the commercial laundry service company came to help set up the machines and teach the whole family how to clean the clothes. Maria and Aron have since opened two more Express Cleaners in the El Paso area and have employed all of their four children. Aron always says, “From here to the door, we are all employees, after the exit door, we are family.” 

Maria plans to use this loan to buy a new washer. She and Aron have been using a 30-year-old washer which requires doing everything manually, from measuring out the starch to putting the clothes in a separate spinner and spinning it by hand. The new, larger-capacity washer will calculate the amount of starch automatically, wash the clothes faster, and spin the clothes so they can dry. 

Maria and her children were all born in Mexico and Aron was born in Los Angeles. Once Maria set foot in the United States, she knew that she had made her first step toward success. After staying at home with her kids for the majority of their youth, she was sad that she had made it to the U.S. (a place she defines as a “land where dreams come true”), and had not completed her dream of starting her own business. Now, as the co-owner of three Express Cleaners that employ her family and people in the community, she has become that much closer to her dream. However, Maria affirms that she has several more steps till she achieves her goals, and these steps have to be taken slowly and firmly. She wants to own, not rent, the working space, to buy better machinery to grow her business, and to pass it down to her grandchildren. Maria says, “The United States is a place where dreams come true, but you have to work very hard and start from scratch. It is not easy.”

Maria and Aron employ all of their children. Their son Mario, the accountant, says, “Nothing can compare to owning your own business. It takes time, sacrifice and responsibility, but in the end it is worth it because you’re seeing something that is working. I know that I can pass this on to my kids; my whole family is putting something into this business. It is very beautiful”.

loans.use: To buy a new washer

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 32 years old. Her husband is a businessman. She has five children between the ages of ten months and 12 years. Three of her children are enrolled in school. 

Delphine sells a variety of items for home use in her shop. She has had this business for eight years. With this loan she will buy more soft drinks, soap, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. With the profit from the business she will save money. Her business is successful simply because she is well known by her customers and has a good reputation with them. 

In the future, she would like to fill her shop with all of the goods that her customers demand.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Mabell

texts.es:
Mercedes Mabell A. M. tiene 30 años. Es soltera vive con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 
 
Mercedes es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Mercedes trabaja en el comercio vende productos de veterinaria y da asistencia medica para animales en las granjas del sector, además es profesor de un colegio, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta da servicios.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para comprar carro, y una granja con sus propios animales.

Le gusta escuchar música y actualizar los conocimientos con relación a al medicina de los animales.
texts.en:
Mercedes Mabell A. M. is 30 years old.  She is single and lives with her son in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.  She has one son.

Mercedes is a member of the rural communal bank "La Esperanza,"  which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas.  This is a community where there is a lot of wholesale trade activity.  This group meets every month in the San Vincente neighborhood.

Mercedes works in retail trade, selling veterinary products and giving medical care to animals in the farms in her area.  In addition, she teaches at a school.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells them from her home, and she provides services door-to-door.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise to expand her business.  This loan will help her to buy the supplies that she needs.  Her dream is to have the money to buy a car and to have a farm with her own animals.

She enjoys listening to music and updating her knowledge of veterinary medicine.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Anuarite

texts.en:
Anuarite is 35 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of two and 13. Five of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband is a driver. 

Anuarite sells cooking oil, sugar, soaps, soft drinks and lotions. She has spent ten years in this business. With this loan, she will buy more items such as sugar, soaps, and soft drinks to sell. With the profit she will buy more stock for sale. She says her business is well-known because she has a large number of customers. 

In the future, she would like to sell food as well.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soft drinks and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio tiene 34 años, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad, vive en la comarca San Francisco De Asís. Se gana la vida trabajando en una pulpería y vende cosméticos desde hace más de 10 años de experiencia. Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de sí para salir adelante. El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Pues cada día se esfuerza más para realizarlo. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima ya que su negocio ha crecido y tiene una mayor demanda.Esta acción le permitirá otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para hacerles progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio, 34, has a minor son.  He lives in San Francisco de Asís.  He earns his living working in a grocery store and has also sold cosmetics for over 10 years.  This activity makes it possible for him to support his family so he always does his best in order to get ahead.  He wants to do some home improvements and every day he tries harder to accomplish them.

This loan will be used to buy stock items for his store because the business has grown and he has more demand.  This action will allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

His greatest wish is to continue working towards their progress and success.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Aurore Plus Group

texts.en: Jiji has been selling secondhand clothing since 1992. She started her business selling pagnes (women’s wrap clothing). Over the years, her business has prospered with her determination and hard work, and she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business. With good management and savings, Jiji has been able to increase her working capital. She sells at the market in the western area of Kinshasa and her business makes $100 per week. She is confident in her business and she is determined to be a secondhand clothing importer someday – a provider in DRC in general and Kinshasa in particular. Jiji is 42 years old, married and has six children between the ages of 3 and 21. Three of them go to school.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of secondhand clothing to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Evelyn De Jesus

texts.es:
Evelyn De Jesus R. V. tiene 19 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y  los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 
 
Evelyn es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Evelyn trabaja en el comercio vende ropa tarjetas de porta realiza recargas para celulares, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar una casa grande.
Le gusta salir de viaje.
texts.en:
Evelyn De Jesus R. V. is 19 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.  She has 2 children.

Evelyn is a member of the rural communal bank "La Esperanza,” which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas.  This is a community where there is a lot of wholesale trade activity.  This group meets every month in the San Vincente neighborhood.

Evelyn works in retail trade selling clothing and "Porta" (an Ecuadorean cell phone company) mobile phone recharge cards.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil, and sells her items from her house and door-to-door.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise to expand her business.  This loan will help her financially to buy the supplies she needs.  Her dream is to have a large house. 

She enjoys traveling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Iliana Isabel

texts.es:
Iliana Isabel E. C. tiene 31 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.  

Iliana es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Iliana trabaja en el comercio vende ropa y cosméticos por medio de revistas perfumes y joyas de fantasía, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar una casa y realizar un viaje a las Islas Galápagos.

Le gusta salir de viaje y cocinar.
texts.en:
Iliana Isabel E. C., 31, is married.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

Iliana is a member of the La Esperanza (Hope) communal bank located 25 kilometers from Ventanas canton.  It’s a community mostly dedicated to commerce and this group meets monthly in San Vicente neighborhood.

Iliana sells clothing and catalogue cosmetics and costume jewelry that appear in perfume magazines.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and her sales occur in her home and door-to-door.

She is asking for funds to buy merchandise to enlarge her business.  Support from the loan will help her economically so that she can cover her needs.  Her dream is to buy a house and take a trip to the Galápagos Islands.

She likes to travel and to cook.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Luis Alberto; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de imprenta, el tiene una pequeña tienda de imprenta  que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  papeles y materiales para la imprenta.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Machupicchu".  The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mr. Luis Alberto, 45 years old, married with two children.  The associate has a printing business.  He has a small printing shop that he runs from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, and through this business he takes care of his children.  He wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan to buy paper and other printing materials.

He gives thanks to all that are participating making his dream come true and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: The associate is seeking a loan to purchase paper and printing materials.

loans.name: Leonor Flor

texts.es:
Leonor de 55 años, tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa,  vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

Hace 10 años empezó con una pequeña tienda de dulces ya que tenia 8 hijos que mantener y esta separada de su esposo. Desde entonces ha venido trabajando por ellos para que tengan una buena vida y puedan estudiar. Trabaja en la tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Su tienda esta ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa, vende bebidas, arroz, azúcar, enlatados, etc. Una de los problemas que tiene para atender la tienda es que su mama esta delicada de salud y necesita pasar mas tiempo con ella. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, enlatados para surtir mas su tienda ya que quiere agrandarla. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito, y poder expandir su tienda en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Leonor, 55, has a grocery store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a canton called, Playas, one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations rich in seafood.

Ten years ago she started with a small candy store because she had 8 children to support and she’s separated from her husband.  Since then she has been working for them so that they have a good life and go to school.

She is open for business from 6am until 11pm every day.  Her store is in the front of her house.  She sells beverages, rice, sugar, canned goods, etc.  One of the difficulties she has in tending to the store is that her mother is in delicate health and she must spend more time with her.

She wants to buy beverages and canned goods with the loan to better stock her store because she wants to enlarge it.  In the future she wants her children to successfully finish their schooling and to be able to extend her business to other places.

loans.use: For rice, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Alma Riza

texts.en: Alma Riza D. is a 21-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a Ready-to-Wear clothes business. She lives in Prk. Kalubihan, Brgy. Libertad, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. Alma Riza has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and RTW business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Alma Riza is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her business ventures. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Alma Riza hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Cagay, Brgy. Buenavista, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish. Her husband, Danilo, age 44, works as a fisherman and also helps with his wife's business. They have seven children who are 4 to 21 years old. Leonora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Leonora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use as additional capital for her fishing vending business and for fishing materials so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Leonora L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a fishing boat

loans.name: Isaura Isabel

texts.es: La señora Isaura Isabel inicio este negocio de venta de telas. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Pues ha sido muy difícil mantener a su familia. Ella es una persona muy responsable y busca la forma de salir adelante.   Comenzó con esta actividad porque no tenía un trabajo estable. Ella vive en lugar muy traficado pues hay diversos clientes que le solicitan una gran variedad de telas.   Ella indica que quiere comprar una casa para sus hijos y les pueda dejar algo.  El crédito lo destinara para compra de telas de diferentes colores y de muy buena calidad, está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Isaura Isabel started selling fabric over 8 years ago.  Supporting her family has been very difficult.  She is a very responsible person who always seeks ways to get ahead in life.  She started this business because she didn’t have a steady job.

The area where she lives has a lot of foot traffic and she has many of customers who ask for a variety of fabrics.  She says that she wants to buy a house for her children so that she will have something to leave them.

The loan will be used to buy good quality fabric in an assortment of colors.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: To buy fabric in assorted colors.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan R. is a single woman who lives in Bliss, Brgy. La Paz, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: entertainment (videoke and computer games) and general store businesses. Susan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own efforts, Susan has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 14,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to pay for equipment maintenance so that she can continue to save up for a secure future and start a new business. Susan R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Maintenance of equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia Laura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Silvia Laura; ella tiene 58 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. ropa para damas, varones y niños, ella tiene una tienda en el centro comercial Cusco que queda ubicado en el, centro D. la ciudad D. Cusco, ella atienD. desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio D. venta D. ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería  como blusas, pantalones y chompas al por mayor para la tienda.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Machupicchu".  The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Silvia Laura, she is 58 years old, married and has 4 children.  She splits her time between her daily activities and a business selling clothing for men, women and children.  She has a store in the commercial center of Cusco which is located in the center of the city of Cusco.  She works at her store from 10:00 am until 8:00 pm.  She wants to improve and expand her sales business.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, and sweaters at wholesale for sale in her store.

She is thankful to all those that are participating in making her dream come true and promises to make her loan payments in accordance with the established rules.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as blouses, pants and sweaters at wholesale for her store.

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higia ;   La socia tiene 44 años de edad, es separada y tiene 5 hijos, La socia se dedica  a la venta de comidas y crianza de animales menores en el mercado de Andahuaylillas, desde hace 7 años, ella estudio solo la primaria completa y como sus padres eran muy pobres no pudo continuar sus estudios secundarios y menos pensar en una educación superior,   La socia se caso a temprana  edad y no le ha ido nada bien, ella después de tener sus cinco hijos fue abandonada por su pareja y desde entonces a trabajado en todo tipo de trabajos para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos hasta el día de hoy. La socia necesita comprar cuyes para la venta este negocio lo conoce muy bien y es por esta razón que apuesta nuevamente en este tipo de negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes para criar, reproducirlos y venderlos.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos venden pasto, comidas, chicha, y los varones tienen autos y los han puesto al servicio del público como taxis.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Higia, 44, is a member of the “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS” (Andahuaylillas Merchants) communal bank which is located in Huanchac district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

She is separated and has five children.  She sells prepared food in the Andahuaylillas market and raises small farm animals.  She’s been in business for 7 years.  She only finished elementary school and, because her parents were very poor, she wasn’t able to continue on to secondary school much less even think of higher education.

She married young and hasn’t fared very well.  After having five children her husband left her and since then she has worked in all sorts of jobs to support her children to this day.

She needs to buy guinea pigs to raise and sell.  She knows this business very well and this is why she’s betting on it again.  She needs the loan to buy guinea pigs to raise, breed and sell.

The other members alternate household chores with retail.  They sell such things as: pasturage, meals, chicha (corn-based alcoholic beverage).  The men own cars that they use to provide public transportation, like taxi, services.

She is grateful for and appreciates the loan granted thus and at the same time commits to repaying in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Ángela Rosa

texts.es:
Ángela Rosa  L. E. tiene 52 anos. Es casada  vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Angela pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica  a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Angela trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y viajar a Valencia España.
Le gusta lavar cocinar y bailar
texts.en:
Ángela Rosa L. E., 52, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

Ángela is a member of the Dole communal bank located in Dole which is part of Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It’s a group involved in short-cycle farming.  Most grow bananas.  The bank has 16 members.

Ángela is a banana grower on leased lands.  She buys her supplies in Guayaquil and sells her products at home and in the Ventanas market.

She is asking for funds to expand her business.  The loan’s support will help her economically to meet her needs.  Her dream is to improve her home and to travel to Valencia, Spain.

She enjoys doing laundry, cooking and dancing.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia F. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Lapaz, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband Andres F. Jr., who is 60 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have two children who are 34 and 38 years old: One is married and the other one is working to help pay for the family's living expenses. Virginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her granddaughter and to set up a machine shop for her husband. Virginia F. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle P. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a pig-fattening business. She lives in Pasil, Brgy. Malabugas, Bayawan, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Annabelle is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase feeds and vitamins for the pigs she is raising. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Annabelle aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Wood

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie N. is a single woman who lives in Sitio Mambucog, Brgy. Zone 16, Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and being a cosmetics agent. Elsie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,600, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her general store and cosmetic-sales business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and expansion of her business. Elsie N. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of goods to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cocepción Group

texts.es:
El grupo concepción está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas provenientes de Managua. Este grupo lleva siete ciclos trabajando con adim lo cual les ayudado a mejorar y sus negocios.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María de la ConcepciónPalacio de 62 años, fémina creativa quien se dedica a la decoración de eventos desde hace 30ños y la realización de piñatas actividad en la que incursionó en el 2009. Ella tiene la meta en gradecer su negocio con la adquisición de silla, mesas, manteles, cristalería etc. para todo tipo de eventos.

P. es madre de cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad de los cuales su hija es quien le ayuda tanto en las decoraciones como en la administración del negocio.
 
Las otras dos integrantes son Rosaliade Palacio de 29 años quien  comercializa cosméticos (lápiz labial, delineadores, sombras, marbellí, rubor, polvo compacto, cremas…etc.) y ropa (camisas, camisetas, blusas, faldas, pantalones… etc.) y Degsi C. de 23 años quien comercializa productos zelsa y Arabella desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The “Concepción” group is made up of three hard working, enterprising, dedicated women from Managua.  They have been collaborating with Adim for seven cycles which has helped them improve their businesses.

The group coordinator is Mrs. María de la Concepción Palacio, 62, a creative woman who has been working as a party decorator for 30 years and as a  piñata maker since 2009.  Her goal is to expand her business buying tables, chairs, tablecloths, glassware, etc. for all kinds of events.

Mrs. P. has four adult children.  Her daughter helps her both with the decorations and with running the business.

The other two group members are: Rosalia de Palacio, 29, who sells cosmetics (lipsticks, eyeliners, eye shadow, Marbella brand items, rouge, compact powder, creams, etc.) and clothes (shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, etc.) and Degsi C., 23, who has sold Zelsa and Arabella brand products for the last two years.

loans.use: To buy decorating supplies.

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es: Silvia Del Carmen pues se ha esforzado mucho por mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. Esta no es la primera que realiza financiamientos, pues busca la forma de mejorar su negocio. Su actividad es la venta de cosméticos, hace más 11 años que tiene este negocio pues  es una persona muy emprendedora y que sabe  administrar muy bien el dinero. El negocio lo inicio en un momento en que estaba desempleada y necesitaba un medio que le generara ingreso para su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de cremas, perfumes, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios.
texts.en:
Silvia Del Carmen has worked hard to improve her household income.  This isn’t her first loan because she is always seeking ways to improve her business.

She has sold cosmetics for over 11 years.  She is quite enterprising and knows how to administer her money well.

She started the business when she became unemployed and needed a way to earn household income.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, nail polish and lipstick.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luís Antonio F. V. tiene 34 anos. Es casado  vive con el esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Luís pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Luís trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luís Antonio F. V., 34, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Dole communal bank located in Dole which is part of Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It’s a group that works mostly in short-cycle banana farming.  It has 16 members.

Luís grows bananas on leased fields. He buys his supplies in Guayaquil and sells at home and in the Ventanas market.

He is asking for funds to buy supplies to enlarge his business.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  His dream is to have a house of his own.  He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz L. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and sugarcane farming. She lives in Hda. San Pablo, Brgy. San Pablo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. Ma. Luz has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and sugarcane farm, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Luz hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase several dozen shirts and pants for resale.

loans.name: Eddy Donato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Eddy Donato; el tiene 51 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de ferretería donde vende todo tipo de herramientas, el socio atiende desde las 7:30 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de ferretería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería al por mayor.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eddy is a member of the community bank named Machupicchu. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and region of the same name.

Mr. Eddy Donato is 51 years old. He is married and he has 2 children. He has a hardware store from where he sells all types of tools. He has his business open for business from 7:30 a.m. to 7:00 pm. It is through this business that he is able to provide for his children. He would like to expand his hardware store. He requests a loan to purchase more inventories in wholesale.

He is very grateful to all of those that are taking part in the realization of his dream and he is committed to the terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools in wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.en:
Maria Lorenza is 44 years old and lives in the area of Ybate around the town of Ita. She has two sons and a 22-year-old daughter with a little baby and another son still attending school. 

For 15 years Maria Lorenza has been making honey bread, cakes and homemade sweets. She has a store in Ita where she sells her products and has a good number of regular customers; most are street vendors who are satisfied with the prices and products. 

Maria Lorenza thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the loan and the trust bestowed upon her and her business and will work hard to make her payments on time so that she can have larger loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, and baking powder

loans.name: Ma. Delsa

texts.en: Ma. Delsa M. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a restaurant, a general store and buying and selling charcoal. She lives in Prk. Centro 1, Brgy. Sta. Lourdes, Puerto Princesa, Palawan. Since she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delsa has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Ma. Delsa is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Delsa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Heraclides Antenor

texts.es:
Heraclides Antenor G. S. tiene 54 años. Es casado  vive con el esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Heraclides pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Heraclides trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa propia y negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Heraclides Antenor G. S. is 54 years old. He is married and he lives together with his wife and their children. They live in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. They have 5 children. 

Heraclides is from a village named Dole and it is located in the region of the same name and in the community of Puerto Pechiche, Puerto Viejo. Most of the members of the group are dedicated to short cycle agriculture, specializing in the cultivation of bananas. This group has 16 members in total. 

Heraclides is an agriculturist and he cultivates bananas in a field that he manages himself. He makes his purchases in Guayaquil and he sells his products from a stand in his house and at the market in Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to purchase items needed to expand his business. With the loan he will be in better position to fill their needs. His dream is to have a house of his own and a store for his business. 

He enjoys participating in sports.

loans.use: To purchase materials to develop his business.

loans.name: December 8 Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la señora Doralicia Benítez quien está domiciliadla en el Barrio San Roque de C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su barrio.
El comité se Denomina 8 de diciembre  están en el Noveno Ciclo   con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.
Todas las integrantes cuentan con una actividad independiente que realizan para sus ingresos, una de las integrantes es la señora Rosa quien se dedica a la venta de ropas en un puesto que posee en su domicilio.
En su tienda cuenta con variedades de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños a precios muy accesibles ya que las mercaderías que ella vende son D. Brasil donde los precios son más competitivos.
Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su puesto de ventas como remeras, camisas, shorts, vestidos todo la temporada, primavera-verano.
texts.en:
Doralicia B., a resident of the community of San Roque de CDE, contacted her friends and neighbors to come together as a group.

This group is named December 8 and they are on their ninth loan cycle. There are 17 members and they are a group of very unified and responsible individuals. 

Each of the members has a business of their own and their own source of income. One of the members is Rosa and she sells clothing from a stand she has in her house.

In her store she has a variety of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children at very accessible prices. The merchandise she sells is from Brazil where the prices she gets are very reasonable.

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her store such as jackets, shirts, shorts, and spring/summer dresses for every occasion.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia G. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Liloan, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by selling soft drinks and snacks. Her husband, Simeon G., works as a security guard. Olivia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and through her own efforts, Olivia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,500, improving her family's standard of living.
