This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for more soft drinks to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family. Olivia G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Rafael; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero; el socio estudia la carrera profesional de administración de Empresas en la universidad Andina del Cusco, el socio quiere concluir sus estudios para poder trabajar y así poder desempeñar un cargo más adelante. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rafael is a member of the community bank named Machupicchu. It is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and region of the same name. 

Rafael is 25 years old and he is single. He is studying business administration at the Andina University in Cusco. He wishes to complete his studies to be able to work and develop in the future. He requests a loan to be able to pay his university tuition. 

He is very grateful to all of those that are taking part in the realization of his dream and he is committed to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita C. is a widow who lives in Tangkinto, Brgy. Mabini, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling dried fish. Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Lolita C. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Blasida

texts.en: Blasida is 22 and is married to Cirilo, 20, who works as a horticulturist. Mrs. Blasida started working at a young age as a merchant. She mentions that she started with a very small business but with time, effort and family help, she now has a very well stocked despensa (convenience store) where customers can find all kinds of basic home products for everyday needs. Thanks to her work and dedication, she has been able to provide basic necessities and comforts for her parents and siblings, who do farm work in the fields.

loans.use: Purchase rice, bread, sugar and meat

loans.name: Nery Ivone

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nery Ivone; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de alquileres de departamento, ella tiene un departamento que alquila los diferentes cuartos, la socia quiere mejorar los cuartos. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar y comprar materiales para los cuartos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nery Ivone is a member of the community bank named Machupicchu. It is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and region of the same name. 

Nery Ivone is 36 years old and she is single. She balances her daily activities with her business. She rents out rooms and she would like to improve the condition of her facilities. She requests a loan to implement those improvements and to purchase those materials needed. 

She is very grateful to all of those that are taking part in the realization of his dream and he is committed to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To implement improvements to rooms for rent.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yeni; ella tiene 40 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. agencia D. viajes, ella atienD. desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio y mejorar. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el negocio D. agencias D. viajes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yeni is a member of the community bank named Machupicchu. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and region of the same name.

Yeni is 40 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She manages a travel agency from 8:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening. She wants to expand her business. And to this end she requests a loan to invest in her business. 

She is very grateful to all of those that are taking part in the realization of his dream and he is committed to the terms of the loan.

loans.use: To invest in her travel agency.

loans.name: Rudy Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Rudy Alberto tiene 35 años y vive con su esposa y vive en el barrio San Francisco. Pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta tener este medio de vida como es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es inicio para cuando anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa con lo poco que obtuvo logro empezar este humilde negocio. El señor Rudy utilizara el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así poder tener mejores ganancias.
Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, su meta es que su negocio sea grande y que tenga mucha variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, también nos comento que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rudy Alberto is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and they live in the community of San Francisco. He has demonstrated to be a very responsible person and he feels very happy to have her grocery store as his source of income. He has had this business for more than 4 years and he was once employed by a company and later he managed to start his business, though its beginnings were quite humble. Rudy will use his loan to invest in the purchase of inventory for his business with the goal of improving his profits. 

His business is located in his home. His goal is to expand his business and to offer a wide variety of products to meet his clients' demands. He dreams of providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ronette

texts.en: Ronette B. is a married woman who lives in Purok Tubod, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food-vending business. Her husband Reslie, who is 45 years old, works as a laborer in a sugarcane plantation to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are from 6 to 26 years old. Ronette joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ronette has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and for a better future for her children. Ronette B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Elizabeth; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el estudio de la carrera profesional de contabilidad, ella estudia en la universidad andina del Cusco, la socia quiere terminar de estudiar para poder trabajar en el área de contabilidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the community bank named Machupicchu. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and region of the same name.

Elizabeth is 24 years old and she is single. She is studying to be a professional accountant at the Andina University in Cusco. She wants to finish her studies to start work as an accountant. She requests a loan to pay for her tuition. 

She is very grateful to all of those that are taking part in the realization of his dream and he is committed to the terms of the loan.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Esmeralda Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esmeralda II está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Lidia Aurora M. S. de 43 años quien se dedica al comercio de lotería, raspadita y decimo actividad que realiza desde los 13 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en la adquisición de estos billetes de lotería ya que en estos meses se dan los premios altos y es donde las ventas suben.

M. tiene el proyecto de poner una tienda donde venda desde ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, etc. y mejorar su negocio de la lotería.
 
Las otras integrantes son Raquel del Carmen M. S. y Verónica Elizabeth G.. M. S.  de 36 años quien es comerciante de lotería desde hace 17 años, actividad que inicio porque no tenía otro medio de subsistencia. Ella además de este negocio tiene un puesto de comida rápida y tiene la meta de montar un restaurante. Mientras G. se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y prendas de oro y plata en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
The group named Esmeralda II is made up of three hard working women. One of the members is Lidia Aurora M. Sanchez. She is 43 years old and she sells lottery tickets, a business she has had since she was 13 years old.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of these lottery tickets to take advantage of this time of year when large prizes are awarded and sales are good.

Mrs. M. wants to set up a store to sell clothing, shoes, perfumes, skin creams etc. She also wishes to supplement her lottery ticket business.

The other members are Raquel del Carmen M. Sanchez and Veronica Elizabeth G.. Mrs. M. Sanchez is 36 years old and she has been selling lottery tickets for the past 17 years. She started her business when she didn't have any other source of income. In addition to this business she also has a fast food stand and her goal is to expand it into a full restaurant. 

Mrs. G. sells Avon brand products and gold and silver jewelry in wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets for resale.

loans.name: Luzmarie

texts.en:
Luzmarie M. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Golden Rosary, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   trisikad transport, food vending and livestock. Her husband Ricarido, who is 50 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 14 to 24 years old. Luzmarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luzmarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to do some maintenance work in her food stall at the local school canteen and purchase goods to resell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Luzmarie M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

Luzmarie is shown in the accompanying photo posing with the trisikad (bicycle with a sidecar for passengers) that is one of her sources of income in addition to her food vending and livestock raising activities.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF),is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her canteen

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos is 44 years old and lives in a very populated neighborhood in the town of Ita with his wife, Lorenza, and his school-age son. 
Juan is a carpenter and has his shop at home where he makes all kinds of furniture like tables, chairs, nightstands, armoires and others. He sells to street vendors and also takes special orders. He has been in business for 15 years and during this time has been able to acquire many tools and machinery needed. 

He has been a good client of Fundacion Paraguaya and this time he asks for credit to start selling charcoal. Juan says this activity will generate additional income. He already made a cart and has a horse to transport the charcoal to the market and sell it.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda R. is a married woman who lives in Purok Mahogany, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by growing vegetables.  Her husband, Reniboy, who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 6 to 22 years old. Luzminda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luzminda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase fertilizers for her eggplant garden so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Luzminda R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

Luzminda is shown in the accompanying photo with large sacks of her vegetables all packed up and ready to be taken to the market.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her eggplant garden

loans.name: Galdis Karina

texts.es:
Gladis de 32 años, tiene una tienda de víveres y dulces en la parte delantera de su casa, es madre soltera con dos hijas y viven en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Empezó en 1995 con la venta de un terreno en la ciudad de Esmeraldas ya que decidió vivir en Guayaquil y tener una pequeña tienda. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido aumentar su tienda con vivieres, trabaja desde las 06h00am después de enviar a su hija a la escuela. Vende la libra de arroz $ 0.30, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.25, el litro de aceite a $ 1.10 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas y ropa para tener otro ingreso adicional en la tienda y arroz. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y que sus hijas obtengan una beca estudiantil.
texts.en:
Gladis, 32, has a grocery and candy store in the front part of her house.  She is a single mother of two daughters.  They live in a periurban area called Fortín that is noted for its hilly, unpaved streets.

She started out in 1995 when she sold a lot in the city of Esmeraldas having decided to move to Guayaquil and open a small store.  Gradually she’s been able to stock her store with foodstuffs.  She opens her business at 6am after sending her daughter to school.  She sells a pound of rice for $0.30, a pound of sugar for $0.25 and a liter of cooking oil for $1.10, etc.

She wants to use to loan both to buy display cases and clothes so that she can have an additional source of income in the store and to buy rice.

In the future she’d like finish building her house and that her daughters obtain a scholarship.

loans.use: For display cases, rice and clothes.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esperanza está conformado por  Josefa Jarquín, Ana Chávez y Elizabeth Aragón tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Josefa de 41 años  quien se dedica al comercio de ropa, perfumes y gaseosa desde hace un año. Ella tiene cinco hijos de los cuales los tres menores están a su cargo.

Las otras integrantes son Ana Chávez 40 años vende ropa (camisas, pantalones, blusas) y cosméticos (lápiz labial, delineadores, sombras, marbellí, rubor, polvo compacto, cremas…etc.) desde el 2002 su meta es tener un negocio surtido y Elizabeth Aragón Blandino venta de ropa (camisas, pantalones, blusas) desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” (Hope) group’s members are: Josefa Jarquín, Ana Chávez & Elizabeth Aragón, three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women.

The group coordinator is Josefa, 41, who has sold clothes, perfumes and soft drinks for the last year.  She has five children, three of whom are still minor and in her care.

The other members are Ana Chávez, 40, who has sold clothes (t-shirts, pants and blouses) and cosmetics (lipstick, eye liner, eye shadow, Marbella brand items, rouge, compact powder, creams, etc.) since 2002; her goal is to have a better stocked business and, Elizabeth Aragón Blandino, who has sold clothes (shirts, pants, blouses) for the past five years.

loans.use: For clothes, perfumes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is a widow who lives in Bangga villa, Brgy. Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  carpentry, buying and selling charcoal and selling chicken. She has three children who are 2 to 7 years old. Maricel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maricel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more materials for her carpentry business so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Maricel C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia G. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: meat vending, a general store and fishing. She lives in Brgy. Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her meat vending, general store and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Ofelia is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund operations. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ofelia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Miguel Eusebio

texts.es:
Miguel de 47 años, tiene un criadero de cerdos y venta de carne, viven en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Ya tiene 5 años vendiendo cerdos y venta de la carne ya que desde pequeño el sabia de esta profesión porque su familia se dedicaba a esto. En la actualidad tiene en la parte delantera de su casa un garaje donde alimenta a sus cerdos y los mata para que su carne sea vendida a diferentes tienda en el Fortín, trabaja solo desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00 del día. Tiene tres hijos que después de llegar de la escuela le ayudan y aprender de cómo griar un cerdo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pinturas y bloques para readecuar el criadero ya que es de madera y una parte para arreglar su casa. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan un buen trabajo para mantener a sus familias.
texts.en:
Miguel, 47, raises pigs to sell the meat.  He lives in a periurban area called Fortín which is noted for its hilly, unpaved streets.

He has been selling pigs and pork for five years. He’s been knowledgeable in this line of work since he was a little boy because his family was in the same business.  

He has a garage in the front of his house where he raises the pigs and then butchers them to sell the pork to different stores in Fortín.  He works alone from 7am until noon.  He has three children who help him when they get home from school and are learning how to raise pigs.

He wants to use the loan to buy cement, paint and concrete blocks to use in part to refurbish the pigpens that are currently made of wood and in part for home improvements.

In the future he wants his children to become professionals and have good jobs to support their families.

loans.use: For cement, paint and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Tulipan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tulipán está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Luz Marina Jarquín de 40 años se dedica al comercio de comida desde hace 10 años. Ella invertirá el préstamo en materia prima arroz, frijoles, cebolla, aceite, carne, pollo, tomate…etc. con el fin de mejorar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes son María Salvadora O. Martinez de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora que comercializa gallina en el mercado Oriental, Yamileth del Socorro O. de 33 años tiene una pequeña comideria negocio en el que invertirá y Sandra R. de 41 años comercializa pan, cafe y cafe con leche.
texts.en:
The Tulipán (Tulip) group is made up of four hard working women.  One of them is Luz Marina J., 40, who has sold prepared meals for 10 years. She will use the loan to buy raw materials like: rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, etc. to improve her business.

The other group members are: María Salvadora O. Martínez, 34, a hard working woman who sells chicken in the Oriental Market, Yamileth del Socorro Osorio, 33, who has a small eatery in which she will invest and Sandra

loans.use: For raw materials like: rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Kalubihan, Brgy. Libertad, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and food vending. Her husband Edgardo, who is 44 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 2 months to 20 years old. Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store and food vending businesses so that she can continue to pay for her daughter's school tuition. Jocelyn V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn T. lives in Kalumboyan, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: farming and selling rice.  Her common-law husband Mario Magbanua, who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  She has three children who are 3 to 6 years old. Arlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arlyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase farming equipment and tools so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Arlyn T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

texts.en:
"Denma S. is a 47-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fish vending and a general store. She lives in Villareal, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. Denma is now borrowing 15,000 PHP so she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Denma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: Valeriana tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas sembrando principalmente alfalfa ya que es uno de los productos que le generan mayores ganancias. Asimismo siembra otros productos mas que le sirven para complementar sus ganancias. También cría animales que lleva a campos lejanos para pastar y después de varios meses venderlos. Valeriana tiene muchos deseos de seguir progresando es por ello que esta pensando sembrar en más extensiones de terreno para continuar su producción. Es el noveno crédito que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Valeriana, 51, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  She has been a farmer for many years growing primarily alfalfa which is one of the most profitable products.  She also plants other products to add to her profits.  In addition, she raises animals that she takes to pasture in distant fields and after a few months sells them. Valeriana has many wishes to continue to progress so she is thinking about planting larger fields to continue with production.

This is her 9th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she’s known for being a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.

She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan that will be so helpful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure to use on the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Julianita

texts.en:
Julianita D. is a married woman who lives in Purok 6, Barangay Kalumboyan, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dry goods sales and a cafeteria. Her husband Pedro D., who is 51 years old, works as a dry goods vendor to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 17 to 30 years old. Julianita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Julianita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,500 PHP,  uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital in her business activities so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and the education of her children. Julianita D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. loans.use: Additional revolving capital

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur M. is a 30-year-old married man and the loving father of two children. For a year, Elnur has had a small shop near his house where he sells all kinds of household and office supplies. He dreams that his children can get better living conditions, and that is why he is working hard, together with his wife, who always assists him with everything. Elnur's business is successful in bringing considerable income to the family. Today, Elnur wants to expand his business and increase his working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to sell

loans.name: Tiacaque Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama TIACAQUE porque es el nombre de la comunidad y el significado del nombre es “lugar donde nace agua entre peñascos” dado que la comunidad está en una lomita y se sitúa entre algunas presas. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Tiacaque, México, y se caracteriza por tener un centro turístico llamado por el mismo nombre de la comunidad, en donde se dedican a la cría de truchas; a un costado se localizan las comunidades de san francisco cheje y Ejido de Malacota  es un lugar donde las personas por lo general se dedican al ganado como cría de borregos, becerros, güilos, en general animales silvestres.  El grupo está conformado por  12  integrantes. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama María Cristina O. M. Tiene 28 años estudió hasta la secundaria, comenta que busca ayudar a su esposo con su negocio para que sus hijos puedan llegar a ser unos profesionistas y su vez aprendan como se maneja el negocio para que ellos después puedan tener el suyo, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos (una mujer y un hombre). María Cristina  se dedica a la cría y venta de borregos que comercializa en, el tianguis de Ixtlahuaca los lunes y también con vecinos y parientes principalmente, se inicio desde hace 4 años en el negocio sin pensar que fuera a ser esta actividad una fuente de ingreso, le ha gustado mantener el negocio porque con el dinero que saca puede darle algunas comodidades a sus hijos y en especial que no les ha falta para comer. Su dedicación y perseverancia harán posible que tenga buenas ventas, puesto que anteriormente ha enfrentado diferentes dificultades como cuando enferman los animales y mueren, pero con el crédito se ayudará a salir adelante de esos problemas y tener su negocio a salvo.
texts.en:
This group is called “TIACAQUE” because that’s the name of the community and the name means “place where the water rises between cliffs” because the community is located on top of a small hill and between some dams.  

It is located in the community of Tiacaque, México, which has a tourist center of the same name noted for its trout hatcheries.  Adjacent are the communities of San Francisco Cheje and Ejido de Malacota.  It’s a place where residents, for the most part, raise livestock: sheep, calves, doves and wild animals in general.

The group has 12 members.  One of them is María Cristina O. M., 28.  She finished secondary school and she comments that she wants to use her business to help her husband so that their children can become professionals as well as learn to run a business so that some day they can have their own.

She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl.  She raises sheep that she sells in the Ixtlahuaca market on Mondays and also to neighbors and relatives primarily.

She started four years ago not thinking it would become a source of income.  She enjoys the business because profits she earns from it provide a few comforts for her children but especially guarantees that they have enough to eat.

Her dedication and perseverance will make good sales possible because she has faced difficulties, like animal disease and death, in the past.  However, with help from the loan she will rise above these problems and keep her business safe.

loans.use: To restart her cattle raising business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena K. is a married woman who lives in Tinago, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband, Nicaster K., who is 47 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 21 and 24 years old. Lorena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped in uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and pay off all of her outstanding debts, while still sustaining her family's needs. Lorena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.name: Devora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Devora está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Rosa Argentina L. G. de 30 años quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace cinco años con la ayuda de su madre y con el fin de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Mayra Carolina G. Soza de 40 años quien tiene un cafetín desde hace 8 años negocio que inicio con poco y que gracias a los créditos ha mejorado y Yareth del Concepción L. quien se dedica a la venta de repuesto de bicicleta desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The Devora group is comprised of three hardworking women, one of whom is Rosa Argentina L. G. who is 30 years old and who has been selling shoes since five years ago with the help of her mom so that she can give her daughter a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are Mayra Carolina G. Soza, 40 years old, who has had a coffee shop for eight years that she started with very little, and thanks to the loans, has improved, and Yareth del Concepción L. who has been selling bicycle replacement parts for five years.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es: Frida es una mujer honesta de 36 años, que vive con Néstor de 36 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo viven con dos de ellos; Kevin, de 10 y Joel, de 2 años; los cuatro viven en la selva central (comunidad nativa pumpuriani). Como jefa de la comunidad nativa, Frida se encarga de las contrataciones de los terrenos de cultivo, ya que la principal actividad de sus pobladores es la siembra de plátanos y café. Hace ya 12 años que viene sembrando maíz híbrido, plátano y café, por ello siempre esta constantemente cuidando sus plantaciones, de esa manera asegura que sus plantas crezcan fuertes y nutritivas; “tienes que trabajar todos los días”, asegura. Sus cuidados han hecho que sus cultivos sean de calidad, y hasta los mismos comercializadores visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para comprar sus cosechas. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Frida, instaló una pequeña bodega de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad, asimismo ofrece bebidas heladas, ya que el fuerte calor y la lejanía del lugar, hacen que adquiera mayores ganancias. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y como presidenta de su banco comunal agradece el apoyo que reciben sus miembros. Frida, tiene pensado invertir el crédito en el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de café, ya que tiene 2 hectáreas de terreno de cultivo, con los cuales podrá sembrar mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Frida is an honest woman who is 36 years old; she lives with Nestor who is 36 years old, with whom she has four children, but they only with with two of them: Kevin, 10, and Joel, 2. The four of them live in the central jungle (native Pumpuriani community). As head of her native community, Frida is in charge of contracting on the farm lands, since the main activity for the residents is planting plantains and coffee. For 12 years, now, she has been planting hybrid corn, plantains, and coffee. To maintain the quality of her products, she constantly cares for them because if she doesn't cut back the weeds her plantations won't be able to grow strong and nourished. "You have to work every day," she says. Her work has made it so her plants are quality, so sellers visit her farmlands to buy her harvests. Frida doesn't just do farming, though. She set up a small store where she sells basic-needs items as well as cold drinks. The strong heat and remoteness of the place make it so she has good revenue. This is her fifth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and as president of her communal bank, she is thankful for the support that the bank members receive. Frida is planning to invest her loan in the maintenance of her plantations. She opened two hectares of farmland, and she is sure she will be able to plant more.

loans.use: Care for her coffee plantations

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur N. is from the district of Agsu. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. 

He is the father of two children whom he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. It’s important to note that Seymur is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. For this reason, he applied for a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat loan to purchase three cattle to help him increase his income.

texts.en: Teofista T. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: trisikad passenger transport and fish vending. She lives in Villareal, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her trisikad and fish-vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. Teofista is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase a transport vehicle to use in her business. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. The attached photo shows Teofista and her husband Roberto. Teofista aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq A. is 60 years old and is married with three children. Rafiq sells seasonal fruit and vegetables in the local central market. He has had this business for more that 10 years. Fresh fruit and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday life. Every hostess has some in store in case guests arrive at the house. 

Considering the constant demand for his goods, Rafiq 's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for his family. Rafiq has a large and friendly family who always try to help each other. Now, he wants to increase his stock of goods to meet customer demand. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN. He will spend the loan on the purchase of more items to increase the range of goods he has for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to increase his income
