Esperanza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Esperanza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1,500, lifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000. She intends to use this as additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store so that she can continue to save up for future improvements in her business. Esperanza M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria R. is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  an Avon beauty product dealership and livestock sales business. She lives in Crossing Baterna, Brgy. Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. 

Maria is now borrowing PHP 19,500 to continue funding operations of her cosmetics business. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund operation of her cosmetics sales business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is married with a teenage son, Chaba. She is a clothing vendor in the central marketplace of her home town of Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Silviya has been working in women’s clothing merchandise since 2005. She has invested 25,000 Grivnyas in inventory since she started her venture. Currently, her gross income is 15,000 Grivnyas. Her net profit is about 4,000 Grivnyas. 

Silviya is seeking a 6,000 Grivnya loan to purchase seasonal clothing items. She is a serious and prudent business owner. Sylvia’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet clients' needs, along with her assortment of clothing of different sizes, will help her to keep loyal clientele. Her responsibility, stable business growth and prompt payment record characterize Sylvia as a consistent and serious entrepreneur, capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: to increase her range of merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J. is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling food. She lives in Brgy. Paraiso, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Susan is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to fund her business operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Susan aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund operations of her food business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred D. C. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Socorro, Brgy. Mabini, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: the buying and selling of dry goods, vegetable vending and food vending. Her husband, Edgardo, who is 62 years old, is a retired employee who helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 25 to 37 years old. 

Mildred joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mildred has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, thus lifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy dry goods to sell so that she can continue to save for the future expansion of her business. Mildred D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and slippers to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 60-year-old married man who lives with his wife and child. Salim has owned a small chicken farm in Bint Jbeil since 1990 and he's proud and happy with what he's doing. It's his only source of income and he his doing his best to raise his chicks in a healthy medium to result in the best quality product. Salim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to pay for his child's school fees and stationery. Salim is working hard to provide a secure living and education for his family members and he hopes to expand his business to a bigger farm in the near future.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school expenses and stationery

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is a 33-year-old single man from Bint Jbeil who has been working in construction since 2000. He specializes in cement work. Abass is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time to buy a crane that will make his work easier. Abass's first loan was of good benefit for his business and he hopes that this one has the same or greater benefit. What's special is that he doesn't limit himself to cement construction but also works in almost every kind of maintenance. His clients enjoy working with him; most of them agree that what keeps them dealing with him is his personality and joyful sense of humor. He's fast and works strictly to his due dates to meet the clients' demands. In the future he hopes to own his own construction machines, in particular a cement mixer.

loans.use: To buy a crane necessary for his business

loans.name: Elvia Ramona

texts.es:
Elvia de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Tiene un puesto de venta de comida rápida. 

Para tener una mejor economía ya que su esposo es albañil y tiene 5 hijos que todavía son pequeños comenzó con un pequeño puesto de venta de “pripitas” es una comida rápida hecha con los intestinos de la vaca, poco a poco incremento sus ventas  e incremento su comida con “corviches” comida rápida hecha con plátanos y pescado. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días haciendo comidas rápidas.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena y bloques para mejorar su negocio ya que es de tablas y otra parte para su casa. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener una finca con muchos animales y vegetales para pasar su vejez.
texts.en:
Elvia, 46 years, old, lives in a suburban area called Fortin, which is characterized by its trails and mountains. She has a fast-food stand.

In order to have a better financial situation, since her husband is a brick layer and she has five children who are all still small, she started with a small stand selling "pripitas," which is a fast-food made from cow intestines. Little by little she increased her sales and expanded her menu to include "corviches," a fast-food made with plantains and fish. She is now working from 8 am to 6 pm every day, making fast-foods.

With this loan she wants to buy cement, sand, and bricks in order to improve her business since it's unfinished in another part of her home. In the future she wants to improve her home and have a farm with a lot of animals and vegetable where she can spend her older years.

loans.use: Cement, sand

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel started working in the trucking business to travel and see new things. Trucking companies contract Miguel and his truck to transport goods all over the country. After 5 years of use, the tires and engine of this particular vehicle are now wearing down and eventually the truck will stop running. In order for Miguel to continue working, he has to make the necessary repairs to his truck. Without a loan, Miguel would have to find another job. While this loan will not create a job, it is of equal importance in that this small loan will help Miguel retain his job so he can continue supporting his family of six.

One day, Miguel hopes to enter the real estate business. After his son graduates from school, they plan to build homes together.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been in the modeling industry for over 20 years and has turned that experience into a successful business. After four years of building her business, she has cultivated successful relationships with several large corporations and expanded her business into nine different states. Her modeling business has also received several minority awards and has become a staple of the Atlanta community. 

Rose originally approached ACCION USA when commercial banks were not willing to give her loans and she did not want to see four years of successful small business destroyed. This is Rose’s second loan from ACCION USA. She used her previous loan to help her gain new business, especially after several of her contracts were pulled due to the downturn in the economy. She will use this loan to provide her business with a cushion so she can focus on rebuilding many old contracts and pursuing new and exciting ventures. 

Rose is very proud of her business and has worked very hard to achieve the status her agency currently enjoys. She looks forward to growing into the future and continuing to build her reputation as a formidable businesswoman. 

Also take a look at Rose’s website http://www.umodelinc.com

loans.use: To rebuild contracts and expand into new contracts

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel R. and his wife, Ingrid, will use this loan to buy a van and equipment to start a carpet-cleaning business. They bought this business from a friend and are keeping the same name, Royal Steamers, and hope to maintain the prior customer base. Abel currently works at the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles, and his wife has her own business of doing accounting and bookkeeping for truck drivers. The couple plan to maintain their other jobs and manage this on the side. Abel says, “My wife and I are really productive. We constantly have side projects going on. It’s our lifestyle.”

They are in the process of training an employee right now, and hope to eventually hire more employees in order to contribute to lowering the unemployment rate in El Paso. They also look forward to expanding their business to the commercial sector. Abel is a proponent of microcredit: “I have seen people who have lost their jobs and had hardships and it’s really hard to get back on your feet. I’ve then seen these people get loans and create their own jobs. It’s something great.”

loans.use: To buy a van and carpet-cleaning equipment

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in selling CDs and radio cassettes since 2006. Kassem hopes to increase his capital and his stock-holding. That is why he requesting a loan from Al Majmoua and it's not his first time to do so. He's a client with good standing and Al Majmoua is proud to deal with him again. His clients are the village's neighbors, especially teenagers and lovers, and also friends and relatives. His experience in such a business differentiates him from others. He hopes to expand his business to the DVD sector soon.

loans.use: To increase his capital and his merchandise

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is divorced with a daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. Tetyana owns a retail bakery business, selling bread and pastry in her home town. All of her eight vending kiosks are located either in downtown or in the busy food marketplace. Tetyana’s mother bakes fresh products along with fifteen hired employees. Tetyana helps her sell baked goods in eight vending kiosks and also delivers them wholesale to fifteen more grocery store locations in town.   

Tetyana started this business eight years ago. Presently, she has 60,000 UAH in turnover capital. This time she is requesting a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase food stock products for her bakery business and pay rent for eight vending facilities where she sells the baked goods.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise and pay rent for 8 vending facilities

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socias del Bancomunal Perla, es madre de 3 hijos, la mayor tiene 14 años y el último 4 años, todos están estudiando, Norma se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como son arroz, aceite, gelatina, cereales, harina, levadura, mantequilla, caramelos, chicles, etc, estos productos los ofrece en el Mercado 12 abril. 
Norma solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor. Lo que más le agrada de Finca Perú es que puede ahorrar y asistir a las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Perla (Pearl) Communal Bank; she is a mother of three: the oldest is 14 years, and the youngest is 4 years; all of them are studying. Norma sells groceries like rice, oil, gelatin, grains, flour, yeast, butter, candies, gums, etc. She sells these products in the April 12 Market. (Translator's note: April 12 is the name of the market, not the day when sales occur.)

Norma is requesting a loan to purchase groceries wholesale. The thing that she likes most about being with Kiva partner Finca Peru is that she is able to save and attend the training sessions.

loans.use: Purchase groceries wholesale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 24-year-old single man from Bint Jbeil, working as a blacksmith since 2005, with nine years of experience. His experience is his strong point among competitors. Hassan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a cutting disc necessary and important for his business. 

Cash flow was the major problem he faced at the beginning of his business, but he got Al Majmoua's help and it was a great benefit. Hassan hopes to get help this time because he believes he can succeed and improve his work for the better if he gets the suitable support.

loans.use: To buy a cutting disc necessary for his business

loans.name: Nelly Barbara

texts.es:
Nelly de 42 años, tiene un comedor en donde vende meriendas y piqueos. vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas

Empezó hace 5 años atrás con una mesa y una silla en la parte delantera de su casa por la buena acogida de sus vecinos el negocio fue creciendo y diversificando mas las comidas que hacia. Poco a poco incremento los platos y readecuo un local para su comedor, en la actualidad trabaja desde las 14h00pm hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Los platos que vende son arroz con menestra y carne, pollo, chuleta etc. Uno de los inconvenientes al vender en su local es que se va la luz a menudo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una refrigeradora y pinturas para readecuar su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su casa con una losa y que su comedor sea el mas conocido en todo fortín para tener mas ingresos y asegurar el futuro de sus hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Nelly, 42 years old, has a restaurant where she sells snacks. She lives in a suburban area called Fortin, which is characterized by its trails and mountains.

She started 5 years ago with a table and a chair in the back part of her house. Through the excellent reception she got from her neighbors, the business grew and diversified to include more dishes that she made. Little by little she increased the dishes and revamped a space for her restaurant. Now she is working from 2 pm to 10 pm every day. The meals she sells are rice with mixed vegetables and meat, chicken, lamp chops, etc. One of the inconveniences of selling out of her locale is she hardly ever sees the light.

With this loan she wants to buy a refrigerator and paintings to decorate her business. In the future she would like to have her house with a heater and for her restaurant to be better known throughout Fortin so she will have more income and secure her small children's futures.

loans.use: Refrigerator, paintings

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 30-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife, working in selling chickens since 2008. Hussein travels through villages to sell his chickens. He doesn't own a shop. It's only his car that he uses to improve his business. 

This is Hussein's first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. He wants to increase his capital and also to buy a car for his wife in order to help her in making an extra business, which will increase their income and improve their living. 

He hopes to expand his business through buying a shop where he will sell chicken and poultry products.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Mohamad Hassan

texts.en:
Mohamad Hassan is a 20-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and single child. He has worked painting houses since 2007, and he's good at what he does. 

This is the second time Mohamad Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, and this time it's for buying a Rapid, a useful car for his business, that will help him in transporting all his tools in a short time, which will make his business more successful. 

His clients are from his village and from nearby villages. At the beginning Mohamad Hassan faced financial problems that changed with Al Majmoua's help, and he's sure that this loan will bring him a lot of the success he's seeking.

loans.use: To buy a car useful for his business

loans.name: Eduvi Cristina

texts.es:
Eduvi de 38 años, tiene una pequeña panaderia en su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas

Escogía tener una panadería ya que hace muchos años atrás aprendió a hacer panes y no quería desperdiciar ese talento. Compro un horno y  harina para comenzar con la panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad vende pan en su pequeño local que tiene en su casa trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Uno de los inconvenientes para hacer panes es el polvo que produce la calle ya que son de tierra. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar leche, mantequilla, harina para su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento y tener mas grande su panadería.
texts.en:
Eduvi is 38 years old and has a small bakery in her house. She lives in a semi-urban area called Fortín, characterized by dirt roads and mountains.

She chose to have a bakery because many years ago she learned how to make bread and didn't want to lose the skill. She bought an oven and flour to start the bakery in the front of her house. Now she sells bread from her in-home store, working from 6:30am to 8pm every day. One of the inconveniences she encounters in making bread is the dust that spreads from the dirt roads.

With this loan, she would like to buy milk, butter, and flour for her bakery. In the future, she would like to have a house of cement and expand her bakery.

loans.use: Milk, flour, butter

loans.name: Samuel Saul

texts.es:
Samuel Saúl G. S. tiene 22 años. Es soltero  vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos.

Samuel pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Samuel trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa y comprar terrenos para cultivar.
Le gusta caminar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Samuel Saúl G. S. is 22 years old. He is single, and lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. He does not have any children.

Samuel belongs to the group Ventanilla Dole, located in the precinct of the same name in the parish of Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo. This group of 16 members is dedicated to short-cycle labor, mostly the cultivation of bananas.

Samuel works in agriculture, planting bananas on farmland that he leases. He does his shopping in Guayaquil and makes sales from his home and in the Ventanas market.

He is seeking credit to purchase merchandise to expand his business. The credit will help him economically, to meet his needs. His dream is to have a house and to buy land to cultivate. He enjoys walking and playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand business

loans.name: Medardo Rafael

texts.es:
Medardo Rafael Rodríguez C. tiene 35 años. Es casado  vive con los hojas y la esposa, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Medardo pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Medardo trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa y comprar terrenos para cultivar.
Le gusta caminar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Medardo Rafael Rodríguez C. is 35 years old and lives with his spouse in the Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. He has one son.

Medardo belongs to the group Ventanilla Dole, located in the precinct of the same name in the parish Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo. This group of 16 members is dedicated to short-cycle labors, mostly the cultivation of bananas.

Medardo works planting bananas on land that he leases. He does his shopping in Guayaquil and makes his sales from his home and in the Ventanas market.

He is seeking this loan to purchase merchandise to expand his business. This credit will help him to meet his needs. His dream is to have a house and buy land to cultivate. He enjoys walking and playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand business

loans.name: Pablo Javier

texts.es:
La señor Pablo Javier B. Burgos tiene 19 años y vive en la ciudad de Tarija -Cercado. Pablo actualmente está estudiando en la carrera de arquitectura y durante la semana se dedica a sus estudios y a los días viernes y sábados o cuando se le presente un contrato de su amplificación se dedica a su actividad, la cual seria, la de dj" de su amplificación y locutor de un medio de comunicación social, la misma lleva el nombre de radio Atlántida  y según se contrate su amplificación, él percibe un ingreso económico por evento social lo cual mensualmente obtiene un ingreso mensual, aparte de su ingreso como locutor de donde también percibe ingresos mensuales. Este ingreso le permite a Pablo cubrir sus gastos de estudios de la universidad. 

Pablo nos dice que con el crédito que sacara lo invertirá en la compra de un equipo portatil que maneje las consolas de amplificación ya que la compactera que el tenia para manejar las mismas se le quemo este equipo portatil será completamente laboral para su amplificación Pablo sostiene que la compra de este equipo le permitirá obtener más ingresos ya que con la experiencia de 2 años que tiene en este rubro piensa trabajar de manera individual a la de la radio. Ya asi terminar sus estudios y ser un profesional eficiente.
texts.en:
Pablo Javier B. Burgos is 19 years old and lives in the city of Tarija - Cercado. Pablo is currently studying architecture and during the week he studies. On Fridays and Saturdays, or when he is presented a sound system contract, he is a sound system DJ and mass media announcer for a radio station called Atlántida. According to his contract to provide sound system services, he receives a monthly income for social events, which is separate from his income as an announcer where he also receives a monthly income. This income allows Pablo to cover his expenses to study at the university.

With the loan he is requesting, Pablo will invest it in the purchase of portable equipment that manages the sound system consoles, since he burned out the player that he had to play the CDs. This portable equipment will be used strictly for work purposes. Pablo maintains that with the purchase of this equipment, it will allow him to earn more income. With his two years of experience that he has in this area, he is thinking about working in an individual manner at the radio. He will finish his studies and be an efficient professional.

loans.use: To buy portable equipment to manage the consoles for sound system equipment

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro Antonio B. C. tiene 30 años. Es casado  vive con los hojas y la esposa, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Pedro pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Pedro trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa y tener un negocio propio con todo lo necesario.
Le gusta trabajar para tener dinero.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio B. C. is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his children and wife. He lives in El Cantón de Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. He has one son.

Pedro belongs to Ventanilla Dole located in the neighborhood with the same name and belongs to the Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo group. It is a group that works with fast-growing banana crops. This group has 16 members.

Pedro works in agriculture raising bananas on land that he rents. He does his shopping in Guayaquil and sells his produce from his home and in the Ventanas market. The loan would help him economically by letting him buy his necessities. His dream is to have a house and his own business with everything he needs. He likes to work in order to earn his money.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand his business

loans.name: Francisco Fernando

texts.es:
Francisco Fernando B. C.  tiene 29 años. Es casado  vive con los hojas y la esposa, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Francisco pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Francisco trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa para los hijos.
Le gusta trabajar y caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Fernando B. C. is 29 years old, married, and lives with his children and wife in Cantón de Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. He has three children.

Francisco belongs to the Dole community bank located in the district with the same name and belonging to the Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo. It is a group that works with fast-growing crops, and the majority of them work with bananas. This group has 16 members.

Francisco works in agriculture growing bananas on rented land. He does his shopping in Guayaquil and sells from his home and at the Ventanas market.

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to expand his business. The loan will help him economically with purchasing what he needs. His dream is to have a house for his children. He likes to work and go walking with his family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand his business

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres de Esperanza 3, compuesto por 5 mujeres microempresarias, todas están dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, venta de alimentos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por ella, su esposo y 2 hijos, su negocio es una cafeteria donde vende todo tipo de comidas, desde refrigerios como sandwiches y jugos, a almuerzos como mariscos y otros. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es lograr que su negocio sea firme, y lo que mas disfruta en sus tiempo libre es ver television y cocinar.

Carmen está muy emocionada de recibir su primer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 2 años, el cual inició con cuando trabajaba con la antigua propietaria y la señora se lo cedio. Carmen está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de jugos, frutas, refrigerios y algunas carnes y mariscos, esta asociada va a utilizar sus ganancias para pagar la educación de sus hijos, y para ahorrar, desea que su negocio pueda ser sostenible y le genere buenas ganancias para poder satisfacer todas las necesidades de su familia y poder planear un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Carmen is one of the members of the Mujeres de Esperanza (Women of Hope) 3 Group, composed of 5 women who are small-business owners. They all work selling clothing, natural products, shoes, food, etc. Her family is composed of herself, her husband, and two children. Her business is a cafeteria where she sells all kinds of food, from snacks like sandwiches and juices to lunches of seafood and more. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have a stable business, and she most enjoys watching television and cooking in her free time.

Carmen is very excited to receive her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for around 2 years and she started it when the former owner she was working with gave it up. Carmen plans to use her loan to buy juices, fruits, snacks, meat, and seafood. She is going to use her earnings to pay for her children's education, and she will also save some money. She desires to have a self-sustainable business that will generate enough earnings to support her family in order to count on a better future.

loans.use: To buy juices, soft drinks, seafood

loans.name: Angel Serapio

texts.es:

Ángel pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Ángel trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas.

Le gusta bailar en las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Ángel Serapio S. C.  is 35 years of age.  He is married and lives with his children and wife.  He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the Province of Los Ríos.  He has 4 children.  

Angel belongs to the Dole communal bank located in the precinct of the same name which is part of Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It is a group that is dedicated to farming crops with a short growing cycle.  Most grow bananas. This group has 16 members.  

Angel works in agriculture and sows bananas on an estate that he leases.  He buys the young plans in Guayaquil and sells the bananas in the areas near his house and in the market of Ventanas.  

He requests the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand his business.  The support of the loan would help him economically to supply his needs.  His dream is to have a house for the children.  He likes to dance at the festivals of the precinct.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to grow his business

loans.name: Mene

texts.es: Mene, de 28 años está casado con Libia, de 29 años, como una familia unida, ellos trabajan para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus 4 hijos, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Hace 4 años que junto a su esposa se dedica a la agricultura; donde siembra una variedad de productos propios de la zona como: plátano, yuca, maíz híbrido y café. Todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivo donde limpia sus sembríos de la maleza que crece a su alrededor, “es la actividad que me gusta hacer”, afirma. Ahora Mene está planeando sembrar cítricos; a los que le dedicará un tiempo extra, ya que requieren cuidado durante 4 años para que puedan dar fruto, de la misma manera él está juntando capital para poder abrir una pequeña tienda de comestible, con producto de primera necesidad, para poder incrementar sus ingresos y apoyar a los pobladores de su localidad que por la lejanía, viajan constantemente a la ciudad a adquirir dichos productos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y con el apoyo de su banco comunal está seguro que podrá lograr sus objetivos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una variedad de herramientas, con las que podrá cuidar sus cultivos, en especial sus platanales ya que en 15 días darán fruto.
texts.en:
Mene, 28 years of age, is married to Libia, age 29.  As a united family they work to give a better quality of life to their 4 children, who they care for in their own house located in the Peruvian forest (native community of Centro Pumpuriani).  

For 4 years, he and his wife have been dedicated to agriculture.  They sow a variety of their own products of the zone such as: banana, yucca, hybrid corn and coffee.  Every morning from the first hours of the day he is directed to his lands, where he cleans his sown fields of the weeds that grows around them.  "This is the activity that I like to do", he affirms.  

Now Mene is planning to sow citrus fruits; which will demand extra time, since they require care for 4 years before they will bear fruit. In the same way he is needing capital to be able to open a small food store, with groceries, to be able to increase their income and to give support to the settlers of their locality who, because of the remote-ness, must travel constantly to the city to acquire said products.  

This is his fifth loan with MFP and, with the support of his communal bank, he is sure that he will be able to achieve his objectives.  With the loan that he requests, he will buy a variety of tools, which will enable him to take care of their cultivations, especially their banana plantations, which will bear fruit in 15 days.

loans.use: To buy tools to take care of his banana plantations.

loans.name: Buenaventura Vivar

texts.es:

loans.name: Yenny Alexandra

texts.es:
Yenny de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres. 

Comenzó hace 7 meses con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo que es operador de maquina, vende bebidas, dulces, enlatados y otros víveres en su tienda a un bajo costo. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  No quiere tener hijos hasta que tenga un buen sustento económico para que ellos tengan todo lo que necesiten. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceite, arroz y bebidas para surtir mas su negocio ya que recién comienza y quiere que todos sus clientes tengan todo lo que necesitan. En el futuro quiere agrandar su tienda y construir su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Yenny, age 25, lives in a suburb named Fortín which is characterized by it's dirt roads and mountains.  She has a small general store.  

She began the store 7  months ago in order to support her family and help her husband who is a machine operator.  She sells beverages, sweets,  canned goods and other provisions in her store at a reduced cost.  She works from 6AM to 9PM every day.  She does not want to have children until they have a good economic standard of living so that they have everything that they need.  

With the loan she wants to buy oil, rice and beverages to better supply her business that she recently started and to satisfy the demands of all of her clients so they have everything that they need.  In the future she wants to enlarge her store and to build a house of cement.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and beverages for resale in her store.

It is a group dedicated to farming crops in a short growing cycle, mainly corn, rice and 'gandul' beans (similar to black-eyed peas).  The group has 13 members.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 35-year-old married man and the owner of a car tire repair and selling shop since 2004. 

Mazen is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy an important machine necessary to improve his business.  Mazen's clients can be anyone in need of such service. His experience in this field, his honesty and the service he provides attracts most of his clients. 

Mazen hopes to develop and improve his business to eventually own a big car maintenance garage.

loans.use: To buy a machine necessary for his business

loans.name: Nelly Margoth

It is a group dedicated to farming crops with short growing cycles, mainly corn, rice and grandul beans (similar to black-eyed peas).  This group has 13 members.

Nelly works in agriculture.  She sows corn, rice and beans.  She buys her seed in Guayaquil and sells her crops in the in the area near her home and in the market of Ventanas. 

She requests the loan to buy corn and rice for sowing.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  Her dream is to buy supplies to continue sowing her crops and to have money to give an education to her son.  She likes to cook.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice and beans for sowing crops.

loans.name: Yulbe

texts.es:
Yulbe, es un hombre alegre y trabajador de 35 años, que vive con Jarid de 24 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos menores, Yens, de 5 y Zian de 9 meses; a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa de Centro Pumpuriani). Cuando tenía 19 años, Yulbe comenzó su camino por la agricultura, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo mucha experiencia, sobre todo, en las técnicas de cultivo. En sus sembríos de café, plátano, maíz híbrido y yuca, aplica todo lo aprendido; ahora está poniendo en práctica unos viveros de café; con ello podrá renovar sus plantaciones, con unas nuevas y de esa manera obtener sembríos de mayor calidad. Ahora Yulbe, es uno de los mejores productores de café, en su localidad, es reconocido por su trabajo y constantemente los compradores mayoristas visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para poder negociar sus productos. En adelante el está él está pensando comprar más terrenos de cultivo, con los que podrá ampliar sus sembríos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y está agradecido con su banco comunal, ya que sin su apoyo no podría sembrar en mayor cantidad y calidad; afirma. 
Yulbe, podrá comprar con el crédito obtenido 900 mamones (plantas para el sembrío de plátanos), como también en el pago de los peones que atienden su vivero de café.
texts.en:
Yulbe is a happy man and worker of 35 years of age, that lives with Jarid, age 24, with whom he has 2 small children; Yens, age 5 and Zian, age 9 months.  They take care of the children and educate them in their own house located in the Peruvian forest (native community of Centro Pumpuriani).  

When he was 19 years old, Yulbe began his road in agriculture.  In time he acquired a lot of experience, above all in the techniques of cultivation.  In his sown fields of coffee, banana, hybrid corn and yucca, he applies all that he learned.  Now he is putting in practice some coffee fields. With this he will be able to renew his plantations with a new crop and in that way obtain fields of greater quality.  

Now Yulbe, is one of the better producers of coffee in their locality.  He is recognized for his work and the wholesale buyers constantly visit his agricultural lands to be able to negotiate for his products.  Going forward, he is thinking of buying more lands for cultivation so that he will be able to expand his sown fields.  

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is grateful to his communal bank, since, without its support, he would not be able to sow in greater quantity and quality, he affirms.  With the loan requested Yulbe will be able to buy 900 young banana plants (for sowing a field of bananas) and also to pay the laborers that tend his coffee fields.

loans.use: To buy 900 banana plants and to hire labor to tend his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ángel Aurelio

texts.es:

Ángel pertenece a L. VentanilL. Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a L. parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores D. ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilL. tiene 13 miembros.

Ángel trabaja en L. agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las venD. en un local D. su casa y en el mercado D. Ventanas.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:

Ángel is a member of the VentanilL. Nueva Inspiración [New Inspiration Group] located in the Anchoveta neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo.  It is a group dedicated to short cycle workers who mostly grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  The group has 13 members.

Ángel works in agriculture growing short-cycle corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He buys them in Guayaquil and sells them at a store near his home and in the market in Ventanas.

He is asking for this loan to buy corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  This loan will help him economically be able to meet his needs.  His dream to continue farming to make money and to purchase a car.  He likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia El Progreso 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Margarita es una D. los miembros del Grupo Mujeres hacia el progreso 2 y 3, compuesto por 10 microempresarios, todos están dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, venta D. alimentos, etc. Su familia está compuesta por elL., su esposo y 3 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 viven con elL.. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es cuidar por L. salud D. sus hijos y que elL. pueda satisfacer esta necesidad en el momento que se presente. Le encanta ver television y asistir a L. iglesia.

Margarita está muy emocionada D. recibir su quinto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio. ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 5 años, el cual inició con sus recursos propios, vendiendo Velones decorativos. Margarita está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en L. compra D. Productos misceláneos como velones decorativos, ropas y accesorios. ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para ahorrar y reparar su casa, su sueño es poder tener su negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Margarita is one of the members of the Grupo Mujeres Hacia el Progreso 2 and 3, maD. up of 10 micro business owners. They all work selling clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. Her family is maD. up of her, her husband and her 3 children, 2 of whom live with her. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is caring for her children's health and being able to satisfy this need when the moment arises. She loves to watch television and help out at the church.  

Margarita is very excited to be receiving her fifth loan at Esperanza Internacional after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and taken a step for her business' growth. She has had her business for around 5 years, which she started with her own resources, selling decorative candles. Margarita is planning on investing her new loan in purchasing various products such as decorative candles, clothing, and accessories. She is going to use her earnings to save and repair her house. Her dream is to be able to have her own well established business.

loans.use: To purchase accessories, clothing and decorative candles.

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es: Teobaldo, de 42 años, es un hombre luchador; convive con Baseliza de 40 años, con la que tiene 5 hijos menores, a quienes alimenta y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la Selva Peruana (comunidad nativa centro Pumpuriani). Pero como buen agricultor, él se traslada constantemente de la comunidad Sankivironi hacia Pumpuriani; donde tienen sembríos de café; “producto bandera de Teobaldo”; ya que sus 17 años de experiencia respaldan su éxito; él tiene 8 hectáreas de terrenos de café y sus sembríos son muy buenos; tanto así que los principales cafetaleros del lugar reconocen su calidad; por ello la fábrica de café natural de la localidad, “Montaña”, lo contrató como su principal distribuidor. Teobaldo siempre tiene la cantidad necesaria, para sus compradores; sin embargo, tiene problemas al trasladarse a las diferentes comunidades donde tiene que cuidar de sus cultivos; por ello está pensando adquirir una casa en la comunidad de Sankivironi, con ello podrá tener mayores facilidades para cuidar sus plantaciones. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está agradecido con su banco comunal ya que se apoyan y agrupan para poder subsidiar algunas carencias en la agricultura. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café, de la misma manera rozará 2 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivo (quemado de las plantaciones para sembrar una nueva), donde sembrará plátano y maíz.
texts.en:
Teobaldo is 42 years old and lives with Baseliza, who is 40 years old.  They have five young children who they feed and educated in their own home, located in the Peruvian jungle in the native community center Pumpuriani.  

Like a good farmer, he constantly travels to the Sankivironi community from Pumpuriani, where he has coffee fields.  His coffee is called "Theobaldo's flagship product", and his 17 years of experience supports its success.  He has eight hectares of coffee fields and his crops are very good.  The main coffee growers recognize his quality, and because of this, he is contracted as the principle distributor to the the natural coffee factory in his area, "Montaña" [Mountain]. 

Teobaldo always has the necessary quantities for his buyers, however, he has problems moving to the different communities where he has to care for his crops.  He is thinking about buying a house in the community of Sankivironi, where he will have more resources to care for his fields.  

This is is fifth loan with MFP, and he is grateful to his community bank because they support him and have groups to subsidize some shortages in agriculture.  With this loan, he will buy more coffee seeds and clear 2 hectares of arable land (by burning the fields to plant new crops) where he will plant bananas and corn.

loans.use: Purchase coffee seeds

Angel  pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Angel trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas.

texts.en:
Angel Alberto C. C. is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and single children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He has nine children.

Angel belongs to the Communal Bank “Nueva Inspiración” (New Inspiration), which is in the Anchoveta precinct of the parish of Puerto Pechiche in Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of the group engage in short cycle agriculture, mostly growing corn, rice, and black-eyed peas. This Communal Bank has 13 members.

Angel is a short cycle farmer who grows corn, rice and beans. He makes his purchases in Guayaquil and then sells his products from a store in his house and at the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy more supplies to expand his business. With the help he will be receiving through this loan, Angel will be able to acquire necessities. His dream is to continue farming so that he can have money to purchase a car.

Angel likes to engage in sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to expand his business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime, de 33 años, es un hombre honesto y luchador; es padre soltero de Herlin de 13 años; con quien vive y educa en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). A pesar de su declinada salud, Jaime; sale todas las mañanas desde muy temprano para cuidar sus plantaciones y asegura que muy pronto mejorará. Con la alegría que lo caracteriza, cuida sus plantaciones de maíz híbrido, plátano y café, que hace ya 10 años viene sembrando y cosechando constantemente, los que después comercializa a los compradores mayoristas que visitan sus terrenos de cultivo. En adelante Jaime está planeando construir su casa propia, ya adquirió un pequeño terreno donde los próximos meses comenzará a construir, de la misma manera abrirá su propio negocio de compra y venta de café, con ello piensa incrementar sus ingresos y poder pagar los estudios de su hijo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasta con el progreso de los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar abono natural y semillas de maíz, que en estos días sembrará.
texts.en:
Jaime, 33 years old, is an honest and hardworking man. He is a single father to Herlin, 13 years old, who he lives with and educates in a rented house that is located in the Peruvian jungle (the native community of Centro Pumpuriani). 

Despite some health problems, Jaime goes out early every morning to care for his fields of hybrid corn, plantains, and coffee. He has been constantly planting and harvesting for 10 years. He sells his crops to the wholesale buyers who come to his fields. Jaime is planning to build his own house. He has already bought a small piece of land where in the next few months he will begin to build. He will also open his own business for buying and selling coffee. With this business he plans to increase his income so he can pay for his son’s studies. 

This is his fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is very enthusiastic about the progress that members of his communal bank are making. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy natural fertilizer and corn seed, which he will be planting very soon.

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Teodosia Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es socia del Bancomunal Perla, tiene 1 hijo, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de tejidos y confección de ropas como son pantalones, blusas, etc., este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace un año y medio, menciona que su negocio va creciendo cada vez mas ya que al comienzo tenia poca clientela, pero ahora ya tiene más clientes. 
El sueño de Hermelinda es poder tener un local propio para poder confeccionar y que sea céntrico, el préstamo que solicita lo va ha invertir en la compra de cierres, telas, hilos, blondas, botones, etc.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Perla” (Pearl). She is a single mother with one child. Hermelinda sells woven articles and also sews clothing such as trousers, blouses, and other items. She started her business a year and a half ago and says that it continues to grow since she started with few customers. Now she has a larger clientele.

Hermelinda dreams of having her own shop where she can sew and be in a central location. The loan she is requesting will be invested in zippers, fabrics, thread, lace, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.use: Purchase zippers, fabrics, thread, lace, buttons, and other supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 40 años, es una mujer con ansias de éxito; ella convive con Samuel, de 43 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos; Fred de 18 y Sandy de 8 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. A pesar de las carencias que tiene, Rosa lucha por salir adelante. Hace 22 años que se dedica a la agricultura; actividad que le permite pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija Guisella. Todos los días desde muy temprano, sale a cuidar sus plantaciones de espinaca, papa y hortalizas, los que después de cosechar los lleva al mercado mayorista de la capital; ahí pudo encontrar muchas oportunidades de ganar más; la venta de hortalizas le es muy rentable ya que en la costa no se siembra estos productos y la demanda es asegurada durante el mes. Pero los planes de Rosa es abrir una ferretería donde pueda adquirir mayor ganancias sin dejar de sembrar. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y está contenta de pertenecer al banco comunal más respetado de su localidad; donde los miembros, son personas activas y trabajadoras. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará semillas de arvejas para las 4 hectáreas de terreno que sembrará.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40 years old, is a woman with great hopes for success. She lives with Samuel, who is 43 years old. The have 3 children together, but only 2 of them live with them; Fred is 18 and Sandy is 8. They live in their own house, located in the rural area of Palcamayo. 

Despite some hardships, Rosa works hard to get ahead. She has been working in agriculture for 22 years. This business allows her to pay for her daughter Guisella’s university studies. Every day, starting very early, she goes out to fields of spinach, potatoes, and vegetables. After harvesting them, she takes them to the wholesale market in the capital. There she is able to find many opportunities for earning more; vegetable sales are very good business because these products are not planted on the coast and demand is guaranteed during the month. However, Rosa’s plan is to open a hardware store where she can achieve greater earnings without giving up farming. 

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to belong to the most-respected communal bank in her area; the members are all active and hardworking. With the loan she will buy pea seed for the 4 hectares of land that she will plant.

loans.use: To buy pea seed.

loans.name: Sabina Alejandra

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es divorciada y madre de 3 hijos, el primero tiene 19 años y la última 13 años todos están estudiando, pero el mayor de sus hijos trabaja y estudia a la vez.
Sabina se dedica ala venta de abarrotes en general (fósforo, aceite, fideos, harina, gelatina, conservas, orégano, sal, arroz, azúcar. etc) en el Mercado Las Nazarenas, al iniciar su negocio comenzó con un capital de S/.300.00 y vendía molidos ajos, ají rojo, ají amarillo, etc., todo para aderezos, no tenia un puesto fijo por ello vendía en distintos lugares ya que era ambulante. Ella menciona que gracias a la préstamo que obtuvo de Finca pudo incrementar su capital y cambiar de negocio. 
La meta de Sabina es poder hacer crecer su negocio. Ella menciona que  la única dificultad que tuvo en su negocio es cuando se accidento pero actualmente no tiene ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank “Paloma” (Dove). She is divorced and the mother of three children. The oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest is 13. All of them are students, but the oldest works and studies part-time. Sabina sells groceries (matches, oil, noodles, flour, gelatin, preserves, oregano, salt, rice, sugar, and other products) at the Nazarene Market. She started her business with start-up capital of 300 PEN and sold crushed garlic, red pepper, yellow pepper, and other spices used for seasoning. Sabina did not have an established vending post, so she sold in different places as a traveling merchant. She says that thanks to the loan she obtained from FINCA, she was able to increase her capital and switch to another business.

Sabina’s goal is to grow her business. She mentions that the only problem she encountered with her business was when she was injured, but now she has no difficulties.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar in bulk

loans.name: Cruz Rocio

texts.es:
Cruz Rocio S. G. tiene 31 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 7 anos. 

Cruz es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

A Cruz se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva maíz y ha criado chanchos por los últimos 3 anos. Solicita el credito para comprar 3 chanchos mas. Con el apoyo del préstamo, podria intvertir, poco a poco ampliando su negocio de criar chanchos. Su sueno es que su hijo estudie en el colegio y que sea mas que ella. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta salir con sus hijos. Se dedica completamente a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cruz Rocio S. G. is 31 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province with her two children, ages 16 and 7.

Cruz is a member of the Communal Bank “El Placer de Ser Amigos” (The Pleasure of Being Friends), which is located 20 minutes away from the parish of San Jose del Tambo. The group has 15 members who are mostly involved in growing cacao and running their own small businesses.

Cruz is a farmer who has been growing corn and raising pigs for the past three years. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy three more pigs. With the help she is receiving through this loan, Cruz will be able to invest and slowly expand her pig business. Her dream is for her child to study through high school, which is more that what she achieved.

During her free time, Cruz enjoys being with her children because she devotes herself completely to them.

loans.use: Purchase three pigs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es conviviente y madre de 5 hijos, el mayor de 27 años y la última de 23 años, todos sus hijos son profesionales, ella tien una bodega en la ciudad de Cumaná, en este negocio se dedica desde hace 15 años. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropas en las ferias de Chungui, Seqelambras, San Miguel; pero al ver que sus hijos necesitaban de su apoyo decidió cambiar de negocio para a si estar más pendientes de ellos. 
A Rosa le va muy bien en los negocios,le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, ya que gracias a ello supo como educar a sus hijos y a comprenderlos. La meta de Rosa es poder tener un recreo propio y poder vender platos típicos de la región.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Paloma” (Dove). She is in a common law marriage and the mother of five children. The oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 23. All of her children are professionals. Rosa has a store in the city of Cumaná and has been in business for 15 years. She previously sold clothes at the fairs in Chungui, Segelambras, and San Miguel. Needing to support her children, she decided to change businesses since they were dependent on her.

Rosa is doing very well with her businesses. She enjoys the training she receives from her Communal Bank, which has helped her educate her children and understand them. Rosa’s goal is to open her own recreation center and sell traditional regional dishes.

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 31años, lucha por salir adelante, ella está convive con Miguel, de 33 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos; Franco de 8 y Dairon de 1 año de nacido; como una gran familia ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. La principal actividad de sus habitantes es la agricultura, es por que desde niña se dedicó al cuidado de los terrenos de cultivo de sus padres a quienes ayudaba con mucha dedicación. Con el tiempo, pudo comprarse su propio terreno de cultivo; ahora siembra gladiolos, espinaca, lechuga y manzanilla, pero asegura que este último le brinda mayores ingresos; por eso hace ya dos años que vienen elaborando filtrantes de manzanilla (pequeñas bolsas que se colocan en agua caliente para beber). Pero su procedimiento es artesanal por ello es que trabaja duro para poder dar el gran paso de modernizar y expandir su negocio. Ella esta segura de poder progresar en este negocio ya que las propiedades curativas de la semilla en las diferentes enfermedades como la ulcera, hace que esta planta tenga mayor demanda. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy contenta con el éxito obtenido, asegura que más adelante, con la ayuda de su banco comunal podrá hacer realidad su sueño. Con el crédito que obtendrá; podrá comprar 2 mil kilos de manzanilla que sumados a los 2 mil Kilos que sembró; podrá procesar una buena cantidad de filtrantes de manzanilla.
texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old and works hard to get ahead. She lives with Miguel, 33 years old, and they have 2 sons; Franco, 8 years old, and Dairon, 1 year old. The family lives together in their own house, located in the rural area of Palcamayo. The main economic activity of the people who live there is agriculture. 

Esther took care of her parents' farm land from the time she was a young girl, and she did so with dedication. Over time she was able to buy her own land; she now plants gladiolas, spinach, lettuce, and chamomile; it is this last one that brings in the greatest income. Because of this, for the past two years they have been making chamomile tea bags (small bags that are placed in hot water for drinking). Her process is by hand and so she is working hard so that she can make the changes to modernize and expand her business. She is sure that she will make progress with this business because the curative properties of the seed for different illnesses, such as ulcers, keep this plant in high demand. 

This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very happy with the success she has had. She is sure that, with the help of her communal bank, she will make her dream a reality. With the loan she will buy 2 thousand pounds of chamomile, which, added to the 2 thousand pounds she harvested, will be enough for her to process a good quantity of chamomile tea bags.

loans.use: To buy two thousand pounds of chamomile.

loans.name: Grace Jazmin

texts.es:
Grace de 20 años, es conductora de una moto haciendo taxi y llevando mercadería, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.

Como vive en una población a las afueras de Playas llamada "Las Villas" decidió después de salir de colegio independizarse y tener sus propios ingresos siendo una de las primeras motociclistas mujeres transportando gente como taximoto en Playas. Aunque normalmente los hombres son los que hacen esta profesión ella continua trabajando en la motocicleta para tener ingresos suficientes para sus estudios y demostrar que las mujeres pueden hacer lo que se proponen. Realiza expreso a estudiantes de la Universidad y recoge pasajeros desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas, carrocería y sillas para dar una mejor atención al sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener una pequeña empresa de motocicletas y así obtener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Grace, age 20, works as a motorcycle taxi driver and also hauls merchandise. She lives in Playas canton, one of many tourist spots in Ecuador with a diverse variety of seafood.

Grace lives in a town on the edge of Playas called “Las Villas”. After she finished high school, she decided to become indpendent and earn her own income by becoming one of the first female motorcycle taxi drivers transporting passengers in Playas. Although men typically make up the majority of this profession, Grace continues to work as a motorcycle taxi driver because she earns enough income for her studies and it demonstrates that women can pursue whatever they want. She caters to students at the University and offers her services to passengers between the hours of 6am and 10pm.

With this loan, Grace will be able to buy equipment, a passenger compartment, and seats so that she can provide better service for her customers. In the future, she wants to have a small motorcycle business and acquire a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase equipment, a passenger compartment, and seats for her vehicle

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina es socia del bancomunal Paloma, es madre D. 9 hijos, el mayor tiene 45 años y la ultima 24 años, desD. el año 1975 tiene una tienda D. abarrotes donD. venD.: arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, leche, mantequilla, sal, fósforo, aceite, fideos, harina, etc. menciona que no tuvo dificultades ya que gracias a que esta surtido su tienda ha ido incrementando sus ventas continuamente, la meta D. ella es que crezca mas su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo va ha invertir en la compra D. abarrotes al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, sal, fósforo, aceite, fideos, harina. ella se siente muy contenta D. ser socia ya que gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió a ahorrar y a ser puntual en sus pagos, le gustan mucho las capacitaciones por que le enseñan la manera correcta D. atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the community bank Paloma. She is the mother of 9 children, her oldest is 45 and the youngest is 24 years old. Since 1975, she has had a grocery store where she sells: rice, sugar, soft drinks, milk, butter, salt, matches, oil, pasta, flour, etc. She mentions that she hasn't had difficulty, for thanks to this assortment, her store has been continuously increasing its sales. Her goal is to grow her business more.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries wholesale, such as rice, sugar, salt, matches, oil, pasta and flour. She feels very happy to be a member, since thanks to the training, she learned to save and to be punctual with her payments. She likes the trainings a lot, because they show her the correct way to serve her customers.

loans.use: To purchase groceries wholesale, such as rice, sugar, salt, matches, oil, pasta and flour.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del bancomunal Llamocctachi, es madre de 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad, los que actualmente están estudiando, Antonia es conviviente más de 15 años, se dedica a la venta de alfalfa de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, la alfalfa lo siembra junto con su esposo en las comunidades de Simpapata y Llamocctachi (Compañía) y luego lo traen de manera diaria para poder venderlo. 
Antonia se siente muy contenta por que ha sido 3 veces Presidenta de su bancomunal, ya que es una socia muy cumplida en cuanto a sus pagos, es socia desde hace 8 años. 
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha utilizar para la compra de semillas de Alfalfa.
Antonia menciona que gracias a Finca Perú aprendió a ahorrar, a ser puntual y responsable.  
La meta de Antonia es poder comprar un terreno para así poder vender más cantidad de alfalfa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Como presidenta del Bc exige a las demás socias que sean puntuales, y responsables en sus pagos y que sea un Banco modelo.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the communal bank Llamocctachi. She is mother to two children aged 15 and 12 who are currently in school. Antonio has had a live-in partner for over 15 years and sells alfalfa as a street vendor in the Nery García marketplace. She and her husband grow the alfalfa in the neighborhood communities of Simpapata and Llamocctachi and then transport it every day for sale. 

Antonia feels highly satisfied to have been President of her communal bank three times as she is a member who follows through religiously with her payments. She has been a member for eight years. 

She will use the loan she is seeking to purchase Alfalfa seeds. 

Antonio mentions that thanks to Finca Perú she learned to save, to be punctual and responsible. 

Antonio's goal is to be able to buy a plot of land in order to be able to sell a greater quantity of alfalfa and for her children to become professionals. As president of the communal bank she demands that the other members be punctual and responsible with their payments and that it be a model Bank.

loans.use: To purchase alfalfa seeds

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 30 años, pertenece al grupo “Los emprendedores”, ella vive con sus padres, Oscar de 61 y Reyna de 60 años; a los que con dedicación; cuida y protege, juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. Ella, afirma que su mayor sueño es triunfar y darle a sus padres la calidad de vida que se merecen, y así lo esta siendo ya que como agricultora, ella tubo una gran idea y hace ya algunos años se dedica a la compra y venta de manzanilla; lo que después comercializa a las grandes empresas de filtrantes del país. Está muy contenta con ello y diariamente compra 5 kilos de manzanilla a los diferentes productores de su zona; las que luego traslada a Lima donde las empresas más importantes del rubro le compran en grandes cantidades. Ya todos la conocen, por ello tiene mayor cantidad de pedidos; por lo que ahora necesita más capital para poder comprar mayores cosechas de manzanilla. Con el tiempo y la experiencia ganada ella piensa comprar su propio molino, para poder abrir su empresa de filtrantes. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y como secretaria de su banco comunal, le gusta mucho trabajar por el desarrollo de sus integrantes. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más cosechas de manzanilla; para abastecer a sus clientes, asimismo planea abrir un almacigo (reserva de plantas de manzanilla).
texts.en: Marlene, 30, belongs to the communal bank "Los Emprendedores."  She lives with her parents, Oscar, 61, and Reyna, 60, and she is devoted to caring for them and protecting them.  They live together in her own home, located in the rural area of Palcamayo.  Marlene states that her biggest dream is to succeed and to give her parents the quality of life that they deserve.   Being that she had been a farmer, she had a great idea some years ago to buy and sell chamomile, which later she started to sell to the big herb processing companies in the country.  She is very content with this business; each day she buys 5 kilos of chamomile from the different producers in her area that she later takes to Lima, where the most important herb companies are located who buy in large quantities.  Now they all know her, and as a result she has a large quantity of orders.  Now she needs more capital so that she can buy larger amounts of harvested chamomile.  With the time and the experience she has gained she is thinking of buying her own mill so that she can have her own herb processing company.  This is her 3rd loan with MFP.  She is now secretary of her communal bank, and she very much enjoys working to develop the businesses of the other members of the group.  With the loan she requests, she will buy more harvested chamomile to supply to her customers.  In addition, she plans to put in her own seedbed so that she can have a reserve of chamomile plants.

loans.use: to buy chamomile that is already harvested, and to establish her own seedbed to have reserves of this plant.

loans.name: Rosalia Josefina

texts.es: Josefina trabaja arduamente en sus chacras de la zona rural de Huarochirí, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de tunas y cochinilla, hace mucho tiempo con el esfuerzo conjunto de su conyugue logro comprar dos chacras y actualmente se esmera para rentar dos mas y lograr sus ganancias. La fortuna de que su esposo labore como controlador en ferrovías le ha dado cierta seguridad. Además de invertir en la compra de abonos para su chacras, josefina está interesada en premiar a una de sus hijas que le ha presentado muy buenas calificaciones y por haber logrado ser una de las mejores alumnas en su centro educativo, invertirá en su paseo de promoción de su colegio en merito a su esfuerzo. Una de sus metas es que su otro hijo que se está capacitando como mecánico automotriz  tenga una factoría o taller para que se desenvuelva en su profesión. En nuestra foto se puede apreciar a josefina y  a Matías su hijo menor.
texts.en: Josefina works hard in her fields, located in the rural zone of Huarochirí, where she grows prickly pears and cultivates cochineal [an insect used to make red dye]. A long time ago, she and her husband were able to buy two small fields, and now Josefina would like to rent two more improve her earnings. Fortunately her husband works as a railroad controller, which has given them a certain degree of security. Along with investing in fertilizer for her fields, Josefina would like to reward one of her daughters for earning very good grades. She came out as one of the best students in her school, and Josefina would like to pay for for her high school's graduation trip in recognition of her efforts. One of Josefina's goals is for her son, who is studying to be an auto mechanic, to have a factory or workshop where he can develop his trade. In the photo above, you can see Josefina with her youngest son, Matías.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es socia del bancomunal Santa Rita, tiene 23 años, es conviviente desde hace 3 años, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropas de vestir (polos, casacas, camisas, blusas) en la Ferias de: Nazarenas, las Americas, Huanta, esta actividad lo viene realizando hace 3 años, todas estas prendas lo trae desde lima (las compra en Gamarra) viaja semanalmente.  
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha emplear en la compra de pantalones jeans (Lima-Gamarra )
la meta de Diana es poder tener un puesto fijo para poder vender sus productos y poder comprar un terreno pues actualmente vive en una casa alquilada.
texts.en: Diana is a member of the Santa Rita Communal Bank.  She is 23 and has been with her spouse for 3 years.  She has no children and devotes her time to selling clothing (polo shirts, jackets, shirts and blouses) in the Nazarenas, las Americas, and Huanta markets.  She has been doing this for 3 years, traveling weekly to bring all her garments (purchased in Gamarra) from Lima.  She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase jeans pants (Lima-Gamarra).  Diana's goal is to have a fixed stand to sell her products.  She also hopes to buy property, since she currently lives in a rented house.

loans.use: Purchase of jeans pants

loans.name: Alina Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Alina Elizabeth  con 58 años, reside en el pueblo de Matucana, es separada  y tiene dos hijos técnicos profesionales independientes. Se dedica a la venta de comida como: menú diariamente a diversas autoridades y empleados que laboran en el concejo y sedes del ministerio de educación de su comunidad, su negocio es conocido como el restaurant del chino. Otorga pensión de alimentos a varias personas que le pagan los días 20 o 30 de cada mes, prácticamente otorga un crédito de alimentos, en el transcurso del desarrollo de su negocio ha logrado comprarse una nueva cocina más potente y  menaje y utensilios nuevos, el préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos en un mercado mayorista para así generar más ganancias. Alina  es leal a Edaprospo por que recibe el capital necesario para ella de acuerdo a su economía. Desea seguir trabajando en su restaurante para conseguir regularizar los documentos de su vivienda que es sucesión de herederos.  Está contenta con su nuevo capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
