Alina Elizabeth is 58 years old and lives in the town of Matucana.  She is separated and has adult children who are professional technicians.  She sells food daily to various managers and employees from  the various offices of the ministry of education in her community.  Her business is known as “Restaurant del Chico.”  She provides meals to people who pay her 20 or 30 each month.  In the course of her business she has managed to buy herself a new, more powerful cooker, and new utensils.

She will use the money from this loan to invest in supplies at the main marketplace, allowing her to generate more income.  Alina is loyal to Edaprosporo because she is able to receive the capital she needs, according to her financial needs.

She wants to continue working in her restaurant so that she can get the transfer papers for her home which she inherited.  She is happy with her new working capital.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo, de 27 años, es un hombre, singular; él es padre soltero; vive con su hijo Jostin, de 2 años; al que cuida con mucho esmero en casa de su mamá, ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. Desde las primeras horas del día, Cirilo se levanta con mucha alegría, porqué lo que más le gusta a él es curar sus cultivos de espinaca; betarraga y demás hortalizas; que los comercializa 3 veces por semana a la capital; sus productos son los mejores de la zona; ya que con el cuidado y atención que les brinda; impide el incremento de plagas y gusanos, que por el frío ingresan a los cultivos. Sus constantes viajes lo realiza con su pequeño Jostin; ahí Cirilo  pudo ver una gran oportunidad; por ello dentro de 3 años, comprará un camión, con el que trasladará una gran cantidad de madera; está seguro que con su nuevo proyecto podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y está seguro que con la ayuda de su banco comunal, logrará hacer realidad sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono natural, para su cultivo de espinaca que saldrá en unos 15 días.
texts.en: Cirilo, 27, is a single father living with his 2-year-old son Jostin, who he cares for in his mother's house located in a rural area of Palcamayo.  Cirilo gets up happily early in the day because what he enjoys the most is to take taking care of his spinach, beetroot, and vegetable fields.  He sells 3 times per week in the capital; his products are the best in the area because of the care and attention he gives them, preventing diseases and pests that come into the fields when it is cool.  He takes his little Jostin on his constant travels, and because Cirilo can see a good opportunity, he plans to buy a truck within 3 years that he can use to move a large quantity of wood.  He is sure that with his new project, he will be able to give a better quality of life to his son.  This is his first loan through MFP, and he is sure that, with the help of his communal bank, he will succeed in making his goals a reality.  With this loan, he will buy natural fertilizer for his spinach crop that he will sell off in about 15 days.

loans.use: Purchase natural fertilizer for his spinach farm

loans.name: Karen Minnelly

texts.es:
Karen de 19 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Da sus servicio como estilista en su casa. 

Hace 4 años hizo una especialización en Artesanía de Belleza dirigida a estilista como le gusto quiso que esta sea una de sus profesiones que le generaría ingresos. Desde esa fecha hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Tiene su pequeño espacio de corte y belleza en su casa ya que aun no tiene un lugar fijo, hace cortes de cabellos, tinturados, alisados, tratamientos etc. 
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos de belleza, sillas y muebles para tener ya su negocio bien establecido. En el futuro quiere tener un local en su casa para ubicar el gabinete de belleza y tener una papelería para mas ingresos y así ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Karen is 19 years old and she lives in a region called Playas. It's a tourist destination in Ecuador with a huge variety of seafood. She works as a stylist in her home. 

Four years ago she did a specialized course in Beauty Arts, with a focus on being a stylist because she liked it and thought it would be a good income-generating profession. Since then she has worked from 8am until 11pm every day. She has a small space in her home where she does cuts and beauty treatments. Although she doesn't have a dedicated space, she is able to do haircuts, coloring, straightening and other types of treatments. 

With the loan she would like to buy beauty products, chairs and furniture in order to formally establish her business. In the future she would like to have a beauty parlor in her home and a stationery store to increase her income and help her parents economically.

loans.use: Beauty products, chairs, furniture

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rita, tiene 25 años, es madre de 1 niño de 1 año y medio de edad, es conviviente 5 años. Karina se dedica a la venta de ropas de vestir de varones, mujeres y ropas de niños como son pantalones jeans, polos, casacas, camisas, vestidos, etc., este negocio lo viene realizando mas de 4 años en el mercado 12 de Abril.
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha invertir invertir en la compra de pantalones y polos que lo va va adquirir viajando a Lima (Gamarra).
La dificultad que ella tiene es cuando las ventas bajan, pero esto lo superan ya que recibe el apoyo de su pareja; posee 2 puestos uno propio y el otro alquilado.
Lo que más le gusta de Finca Perú son las capacitaciones que ella recibe tanto de los especialistas que Finca Perú invita y de la promotora.
La meta de Karina es poder comprar máquinas de coser para que su esposo confecciones diversas prendas y lo venda al por mayor.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Santa Rita Community Bank. She is 25 years old, is the mother of one-and-a-half year old son, and has been married for 5 years. Karina sells clothing for men, women, and children, including pants, jeans, polo shirts, jackets, shirts, dresses, etc. She has been pursuing this activity for more than 4 years in the 12th of April market. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of pants and polo shirts that she will buy from the Gamarra market in Lima. It is difficult when sales decrease, but she overcomes this with the support of her partner. She owns one stand and rents another. 

The thing she likes most about Finca Perú is the training that she receives from the specialists that Finca Perú invites. Karina’s goal is to be able to buy sewing machines so that her husband can make different garments, which she can sell at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy pants and polo shirts

loans.name: Galo Raul

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Don Galo tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta tiene tres hijos, su mujer vende bisutería.

Se dedica al comercio de pescado desde hace 15 años, empezó  muy joven en el trabajo del papá, él era quien lo acompañaba a trabajar y ahí aprendió el negocio, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad él se independizó y emprendió su propio negocio. Trabaja todos los días, su labor empieza desde las 4 de la mañana, todos los días tiene que viajar hasta la playa de Manta a comprar las gavetas de pescado, y  una vez hecho el negocio empieza el recorrido por los sectores rurales de Montecristi se desplaza en un carro que es del papa.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado y otras gavetas que le hacen falta. Es socio del Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y dice que le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es poder comprarse su propia camioneta para trasladarse a los sectores donde el recorre, eso le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés community bank meets every two weeks in Montecrisi which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are known both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Galo is 39 years old and lives with his partner.  They have three children.  His partner sells jewelry.

Galo has been selling fish for 15 years.  He started when he was very young working with his father.  He was always the one who accompanied his father to work and there he learned the business.  When he came of age he became independent and set up his own business.  He works every day.  His work begins at 4 in the morning.  Every day he has to travel to Manta beach to buy his containers of  fish and then he starts his route through the rural areas of Montecristi.  He travels in a car belonging to his father.

This loan is to buy fish and more containers which he needs.  He has been a member of the community bank for three loan cycles and he says that he likes it because the interest charged is very low.

His dream is to be able to buy his own small truck for traveling to the areas where he makes his rounds.  This would be a great help to him.

loans.use: To buy fish and containers

loans.name: Cleide

texts.es:
Cleide es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rita, tiene 40 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos de las edades de 16 y 10 años, los cuales actualmente están estudiando. Cleide y su esposo (carpintero) se dedican ala fabricación de muebles como son sillas, mesas, roperos, cómodas, etc., actividad que lo realizan en su misma casa desde hace  más de 15 años. 
La dificultad que ha tenido en algunas ocasiones es al entregar los pedidos, ya que no cuenta con movilidad propia pero por lo demás les va muy bien.
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha emplear en la compra de Tripley, Madera, Bisagra, laca, cola, etc.
Cleide agradece a Finca Perú por que gracias a los préstamos que le han ofrecido a podido comprar su terreno, hacer su casa y formar su propia microempresa, aprendió a ahorrar y a ser puntual en todo.
Su meta ahora es poder comprar un carro para poder transportar los muebles.
texts.en:
Cleide is a member of the Santa Rita Community Bank. She is 40 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children, ages 16 and 10, who are in school. Cleide and her husband, a carpenter, make furniture, including chairs, tables, wardrobes, dressers, etc. They have been pursuing this activity in their home for 15 years. 

Delivering their orders can sometimes be difficult, because they do not have their own vehicle. Aside from this, their work is going well. They are requesting this loan to buy wood, hinges, lacquer, glue, etc. Cleide is thankful to Finca Perú for the loans that they have offered her to buy her land, build her house, and build her own business. She has learned to save money and to be punctual in her repayments. 

Her goal is to save enough so that she can buy a car to transport the furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood, hinges, lacquer, glue, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 48 años, es miembro del grupo “Los emprendedores”, está casado con Dominica, de 46 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que crían y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. Como todo un emprendedor, él se dedica al bordado de “gachacatas” (frazadas que utilizan las madres para cargar a su hijos en la espalda); hace ya 8 años que ofrece una variedad de tejidos con bordados artísticos, gracias a su dedicación y magnífica creatividad pudo conseguir clientes no solo en el país también en Bolivia; como conocedores del arte de Jorge, llegan a su casa para solicitarle grandes cantidades de estas frazadas. Gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, el puede dedicarse a otras actividades como la ganadería; donde comercializa carne, también siembra papa y productos diversos; a lo que cosecha y los envía a la capital. Ahora quiere abrir una tienda comercial donde pueda expander más sus tejidos, con lo que asegura podrá tener mucho éxito.  Es el quinto crédito con MFP y siente que su banco comunal le enseña a proyectarse y salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará materiales de Dralón (hilos de colores), con los que podrá tejer nuevas frazadas con diversos bordados; asimismo comprará abono natural para su cultivo de papa.
texts.en: Jorge is 48 years old and is member of the communal group, " Los emprendedores" ( The Entrepreneurs).  He is married to 46 year old Dominica and together they have 3 children whom they educate and raise in their home located in the rural area of Palcamayo.  Being a total entrepreneur, he embroiders "gachacatas" ( baby wraps that mothers use to carry their kids on their back ); for 8 years now he has been offering a variety of stitchings with artistic embroidery.  Thanks to his dedication and magnificent creativity he was able to not only attract clients in the country but also Bolivia; those familiar with Jorge's art arrive at his doorstep to place large orders of baby wraps.  Thanks to the support of his communal bank, he can dedicate himself to other activities like raising livestock for commercial use; he also grows potatoes and other diverse products that he harvests and then ships off to the capital.  He would now like to open up a store in order to further expand his emroidery which he assures it could be a success.  This is his 5th loan with MFP and he feels like his communal bank teaches him how to plan and get ahead.  With this loan he would purchase Dralon thread (colored thread) which he could use to stitch new wraps with diverse embroidering and also purchase natural fertilizer to cultivate his potatoes.

loans.use: Purchased colored thread.

loans.name: Brillos De Luna Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Brillos de L., el cual se encuentra en el Estado de México, se compone de 13 integrantes.
 
En el grupo se encuentra la señora María del Carmen O. ella tiene 48 años de edad; tiene cinco hijos, tres hombres y dos mujeres, a pesar de solo haber estudiado la primaria los ha sacado adelante; Actualmente solo dependen de ella dos; uno de 15 años y actualmente no estudia y  una niña de 9 años que estudia la primaria.

Desde hace 23 años ha luchado por  mantener su taller de artesanías ya que para ella su negocio es muy importante pues representa muchos años de esfuerzo y dedicación así como la oportunidad de progresar en su vida.Con el crédito quiere comprar herramienta y pintura; las artesanías que hace la señora son de madera y las decora manualmente, la mayor parte de sus ganancias  las obtiene de la venta de: tapón para lápiz, matraca, baleros, yoyos y llaveros. La clienta nos comenta que quiere hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse día a día.

La señora Concepción Francisca M. es la presidenta del grupo, de  46  años de edad, tiene una hija, a pesar de ser madre soltera desde hace ya 29 años cuenta con un taller de costura, la mayor parte de sus ganancias las obtiene de la venta de algunas prendas como son: Batas escolares, uniformes, cortinas, manteles, disfraces y en ocasiones vestuarios para bailables; con sus conocidas.

La clienta nos comenta que durante tres largos años tuvo que trabajar arduamente para poder comprar su primera máquina, a través de préstamos pudo comprar maquinaria y con ello obtener mayor calidad en sus prendas. Su máxima ilusión en la vida es que su hija pueda desarrollarse como una excelente secretaria bilingüe, y cada día tener una mejor vida con su mama e hija.
texts.en:
The Brillos de L. (Shine of the Moon) group, from the state of México, consists of 13 members.

This group includes Mrs. María del Carmen O., who is 48 years old. She has five children, including three boys and two girls. In spite of only having completed primary school, she has taken them forward. At present, only two of her children depend on her. One of them is 15 years old and is not in school, and the other is 9 years old and is in primary school.

For 23 years, she has worked to keep her craft workshop; this business is very important to her, and it represents many years of effort and dedication. It also gives her the opportunity to improve her life. With this loan, she wants to buy tools and paint. Her crafts are made of wood, and she decorates them by hand. Most of her earnings are from the sale of pencil caps, rattles, cup-and-ball toys, yo-yos, and keyrings. She wants to grow her business and offer her children the opportunity to better themselves every day.

Mrs. Concepción Francisca M. is the president of the group. She is 46 years old and has a daughter. In spite of being a single mother, she has had a dressmaking workshop. Most of her earnings are from selling garments like school coats, uniforms, curtains, tablecloths, costumes, and sometimes dance clothing.

For three long years, she had to work very hard to buy her first machine. With loans, she was able to buy the machinery, which improved the quality of her garments. Her biggest dream is for her daughter to become an excellent bilingual secretary and to have a better life with her mother and daughter.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and to make crafts

loans.name: Varónica Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Verónica, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 2 y 1 año, su marido tiene un negocio de venta de pollos.

Tiene un pequeño almacén de productos agrícolas y veterinarios, vende balanciado, vitaminas, abonos e insumos agropecuarios. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, trabaja sola y en las tardes con la ayuda de su esposo. Dice que esta muy a gusto con su negocio ya que le permite ganar dinero y a la vez estar al cuidado de sus hijos que es lo mas importante. Los productos los compra en Manta en una distribuidora.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos más que todo los agrícolas ya que se acerca el tiempo de siembras y quiere tener de todo para sus clientes. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y esta muy a gusto por los beneficios que recibe.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Aníbal San Andrés" meets every 15 days in the canton of Montechristi.  This is a place that is famous for its straw hats and for being the birthplace of former Ecuadorian president Eloy Alfaro (known as "El Viejo Luchador," or "The Old Warrier.")

In this place we find Veronica, who is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 2 and 1.  Her husband has a business selling poultry.

She has a small store where she sells farming supplies and veterinary products.  She sells balanced feed, vitamins, organic fertilizer and other farming supplies.  She works from Mondays to Fridays from 8am until 7pm.  She works alone, but in the evenings her husband helps her.  She says that she is very pleased with her business, since it allows her to earn money and at the same time care for her children, which is most important.  She buys her products in Manta from a distributor.

She will use this loan to buy products, especially agricultural supplies, since the planting season is approaching and she wants to have everything for her customers.  She has been a member of her communal bank since it started, and she is very pleased with the benefits that she receives.

Her dream is to have a store that is much larger.

loans.use: to buy agricultural and veterinary products: vitamins, balanced feed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 36 años, es un hombre muy bueno y alegre, esta casado con Maritza, de 32 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el pueblo de Yanapuquio. Él afirma con mucha alegría que, lo que más le gusta es el trabajo en el campo, “me gusta regar los sembríos”, menciona. Todos los días, cargando sus herramientas de cultivo se dirige a las alturas donde tiene sus terrenos agrícolas; ahí siembra papa, olluco y cebada (productos agrícolas). Cada temporada, Pedro viaja al mercado central de su localidad, allá; vende sus cosechas, asimismo comercializa animales que posee. Ahora está juntando capital para comprar un terreno agrícola donde podrá adquirir mayores ganancias. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y está seguro que con el apoyo de su banco comunal podrá lograr su objetivo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono natural, con ello asegurará la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Pedro is 36 years old and is a very good and happy man.  He is married to 32-year-old Maritza and they have three children and live in a rented house located in the town of Yanapuquio.  He says very happily that what he likes most is working in the field.  “I like to water the fields,” he mentions.  Every day he carries his farming tools and heads to the highlands where his croplands are.  There, he plants potato, ‘olluco’ (an Andean tuber) and barley.  Every season he travels to the main market in his area and sells his crops, as well as animals that he owns.  He is now saving money to buy a cropland where he will be able to earn more.  This is his second loan through MFP and he is sure that with the support of his communal bank, he will be able to achieve his goal.  With the loan requested, he will purchase natural manure with which he will be able to ensure the quality of his crops.

loans.use: To purchase natural manure.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía  que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Para la señora Ana la vida es muy difícil ya es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad, a sus 28 años se ha visto obligada  hacer de padre y madre a la vez.

Se dedica al comercio informal, vende ropa, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 12h00 aprovechando el tiempo que sus pequeños están en la escuela, a esa hora llega a prepararles el almuerzo y después los  ayuda en sus tareas de la escuela. Su forma de venta es  puerta a puerta deja a crédito y tiene clientes que ya son fijas, su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil  ya que allá le sale más barata y trae mas variedad al gusto de sus exigentes clientes.

Este crédito es para eso justamente, en estos días piensa ir a Guayaquil para traer más mercadería. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y siempre le ha gustado por las facilidades de pago.

Su sueño es tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts.  The handicrafts are recognized on a national and international level.  It is the place of the famous Panama hats.

Life is very difficult for Ana.  She is a single mother with two minor children.  At her 28 years of age she has had to be both mother and father to her children.

She has an informal business selling clothes.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 12:00.  She takes advantage of the time that her little ones are in school.  When they arrive home she prepares lunch, and later she helps them with their homework from school.  

She sells door to door.  She gives her customers credit because she has fixed customers.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because it is cheaper there.  She brings her exacting customers more variety according to their tastes.

This loan is exactly for that reason.  She is now planning to go to Guayaquil to bring back more merchandise.  She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she has always liked the terms of the payments.

Her dream is to have her own boutique.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Gertrudis Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Gertrudis. Tiene 40 años de edad, casada hace muchos años y tiene tres hijos dos de ellos mayores de edad, pero a pesar de eso todos viven con ella. Su esposo está desempleado, ya que desde hace mucho tiempo esta mal de su salud.

Ella es ama de casa pero se da tiempo para dedicarse al comercio para cubrir los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la venta de pescado por los alrededores de Montecristi, trabaja cuatro días a la semana desde las 5am hasta las 12 h00, desde muy temprano en la mañana se va a Manta para traer el mejor pescado para sus clientes, dice que siempre le gusta traer lo necesario para vender todo ya que el mantener el pescado hasta el otro día cuesta mucho  y a sus clientes no le gusta el pescado congelado.

Este crédito es para seguir comprando pescado para el negocio diario, esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya 4 años y le gusta por las reuniones ya que en ellas comparte buenos momentos con sus amigas.
 
Su sueño es tener un local donde poder vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés loan group meets every fortnight in the Montecristi county, where the famous straw hats are made and where the national hero Eloy Alfaro, also know as "The Old Fighter", was born.

Here we find Mrs. Gertrudis. She is 40 years old, has been married for many years and has three children. Two of them are adults but they all live with her. Her husband is unemployed due to poor health, which has been the case for a long time. 

She is a housewife but also finds the time to trade so as to cover household expenses. She sells fish around Montecristi. She works from 5am to midday four days a week. She goes to Manta very early in the morning to buy the best fish for her customers. She says she likes to bring just the right amount to sell on the same day, because keeping it overnight costs a lot of money and her customers don´t like frozen fish. 

The loan is to buy fish for her daily business. She has been with the loan group for 4 years and enjoys the meetings, because they give her a chance to share good moments with her friends. Her dream is to own her own shop.

loans.use: Buy fish.

loans.name: Jilmer

texts.es: Jilmer, de 35 años, vive en la comunidad de Yanapuquio; ahí, junto a su esposa Rosmery, de 24 años formaron una gran familia, ambos tuvieron 2 hijos; Danny de 6 y Junior de 9 meses de nacido. La agricultura es la principal actividad a la que se dedica, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en ello. Los principales productos que siembra es papa y oca (tubérculo oriundo del Perú); los cuales después de cuidarlos; los cosecha y comercializa en el mercado central de sus ciudad; como también en los diferentes comunidades de sus localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las horas que pasa con su familia; ya que trabajan juntos para poder salir adelante. Ahora él está pensando adquirir su propio terreno de cultivo y está seguro que podrá tener mayor rentabilidad en el futuro. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y gradece todo el apoyo obtenido hasta el momento, ya que asegura pudo obtener muchas cosas, gracias a su banco comunal, que le dio la confianza que requiere. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico, ya que muy pronto cosechará y quiere ver su papa fuerte y nutritiva.
texts.en: Jilmer is 35 years old. He lives in the community Yanapuquio. There with his wife Rosmery, 24, he has 2 children. Danny is 6 and Junior is 9 months old. Agriculture is his main activity. He already has 15 years of experience doing this. The main products that he plants are potatoes and oca (a Peruvian tuber). After caring for them, he harvests them and sells them at the central market in town as well as in the different communities in his area. Now he is thinking about acquiring his own cropland and he is sure that he will have more profit in the future. This is his tenth loan with MFP and he is grateful for all of the support he has had so far. He has been able to obtain many things thanks to his communal bank, which gave him the confidence he needed. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy organic fertilizer since he will be harvesting soon and he wants to see his potatoes strong and nutritious.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maitza Clemencia

texts.es:
Maritza de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Tiene con su esposo una pequeña farmacia en un local lejano a su casa. 

Empezó hace 30 años en el cantón Vinces ayudando a su mama con el negocio de una farmacia vendiendo productos farmacéuticos, después de haberse casado con su esposo decidieron vivir en Guayaquil y tener su propia farmacia para poder mantenerse. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja con su esposo desde las 06h00am hasta las el anochecer. Tiene en la farmacia aspirinas desde $ 0.25 c/u, pañales a $ 0.40 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, ladrillos y arena para construir mejor su casa y readecuar el local de la farmacia. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa propia y tener cuartos de alquiler para tener ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is 41 years old. She lives in an area called Fortín, characterized by its dirt roads and mountains. She has a husband and a small pharmacy in a locale far from her house.  

She started 30 years ago in the Vinces canton helping her mother in the pharmacy business selling pharmaceutical products. After she married her husband, they decided to live in Guayaquil and have their own pharmacy to be able to support themselves. Since then she has worked with her husband from 6 am until evening. She has aspirin at her pharmacy for from $.25 each, and diapers at $.40 each.   

With the loan, she wants to buy cement, bricks and sand to improve her house and refurbish the pharmacy locale. In the future, she wants to finish building her own house and have rental rooms to have additional income.

loans.use: Cement, bricks, sand

loans.name: Acuario Azul Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama  Acuario Azul, tiene este nombre porque ellas se identifican con él, ya que consideran que así como es un acuario es su grupo tiene la mejor gente, la cual ha sido seleccionada, y sobre todo porque así es su amistad, todas van por el mismo camino. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo, está conformado por 9 integrantes. La Sra. Norma C. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 32 años, estudió hasta la primaria, tienen 4 hijos de 9 años, 8 años, 4 años y el mas pequeño de 1 año de edad, de los cuales 2 de ellos estudian la primaria en su comunidad. La Sra. Norma se dedica a la venta de vajillas y de colchas que inicio hace 4 años, ella necesita este crédito para la compra de utensilios de cocina y de colchas ya que es la temporada en que vende más su producto, ella lo que espera de este crédito es que su negocio crezca y así poder seguir apoyando con los gastos de su casa.Otra  integrante del grupo es la Sra. Felipa Álvarez, ella es muy humanitaria es honesta totalmente leal, le gusta planificar y sobre todo que lucha por sus sueños. Tiene  55 años, estudio la primaria, no tiene dependientes económicos, ella vive en unión libre con el Sr. Álvarez Ángeles José que se dedica a la fabrica de block. La Sra. Felipa Álvarez Z. se dedica a la venta de materiales para la construcción que inicio hace 11 años. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de material como; la varilla, el cemento y el mortero en general, para así tenerlo a disposición en cuanto sus clientes lo requieran.
texts.en: The group is called Acuario Azul [Blue Aquarium]. It has this name because they identify with it. They think that like an aquarium, their group has the best people, who have been selected, and that it how friendship is, all of them on the same road. The group is located in the state of Hidalgo. It is made up of 9 members. Norma C.  is the president of the group. She is 32 and finished primary school. She has 4 children aged 9, 8, 4 and the youngest is 1. Two of them are in the community's primary school. Norma has sold dishes and blankets for 4 years. She needs this loan to buy kitchen utensils and blankets since htis is the season that she sells the most product.  What she hopes is that with this loan her business will grow and she will be able to continue helping out with the household expenses. Another member of the group is Felipa Álvarez. She is very humanitarian, honest and totally loyal. Above all, she fights for her dreams.  She is 55 years old, went to primary school, and has no financial dependents. She is in a common law marriage with Mr. Jose Álvarez Ángeles, who manufactures blocks. Mrs. Felipa Álvarez Z. has sold construction materials for 11 years. She is asking for the loan to buy materials such as: rods, cement and mortar so that she can have it at her disposal when her customers need it.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and improve business

loans.name: Betsy Lourdes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Betsy, tiene 23 años de edad y esta casada hace 8 años y de esta relación tiene dos niñas de 7y 2 años, la mayor  estudia en la escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa recorriendo  Montecristi y sus alrededores. También vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza perfumería y accesorios de damas). Trabaja los viernes, sábados y domingos. Lo que es ropa la compra en Guayaquil y Ambato, ciudades a las que viaja una vez al mes dependiendo de los pedidos y ventas que realice.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en ir a comprar sus productos a Guayaquil. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque los créditos son sucesivos.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa para que sus hijas tengan algo para el futuro.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés loan group meets every fortnight in the Montecristi county, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized craftmanship, including the well-known straw hats. 

Here we find Betsy. She is 23 years old, has been married for 8 years and has two girls aged 7 and 2. Her husband is a bricklayer.

She sells clothes in the Montecristi area and its outskirts. She also sells Avon products (beauty, perfumes and accessories for ladies). She works on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She buys the clothing in Guayaquil and Ambato, both cities where she travels once a month depending on the orders received and sales made. 

She is going to use the loan to buy merchandise in Guayaquil. She has been a member of the loan group for 5 years and likes it because she can get loans one after the other. 

Her dream is to finish her house so her children have something for the future.

loans.use: Buy clothing.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, es una ama de casa de 24 años de edad, vive en la zona rural de Yanapuquio, franja montañosa del Perú. Está casada con Alcides, de 29 años y juntos tienen una hija, Sayuri, de 9 meses de nacida. Irma y su esposo se apoyan mutuamente, ambos tiene 9 años de experiencia en la agricultura; tiempo suficiente para poder dar fe de su éxito; ya que con las ganancias que obtienen sostienen sus principales gastos (ropa, alimentos y educación para su única hija). Pero lo más importante para ellos es poder progresar y salir adelante. Con la ayuda de su banco comunal, pudieron incrementar sus sembríos de papa y ahora comercializan al por mayor, en el mercado central de la capital del país, donde cada nueva cosecha obtienen mejores ganancias, fruto de las constantes charlas y capacitaciones que reciben. Por eso más adelante con los ahorros que tiene está pensando adquirir su propio terreno de cultivo; donde esperan adquirir mayores ganancias, ya que no tendrán que pagar por su alquiler. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y está contento de poder pertenecer a la entidad más respetada de su localidad; donde aprendió a progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico, para su cultivo de papa, que dentro de algunos meses dará una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Irma is a 24 year old housewife.  She lives in the rural area of Yanapuquio, which is on the fringe of the mountains of Peru.  Irma is married to 29 year old Alcides.  They have a nine month old daughter, Sayuri.  Irma and her husband support each other.

They both have nine years of farming experience, which is sufficient time to be able to have faith in their success.  With the income they receive they pay for their main expenses (clothes, food, and raising their only daughter).  The most important thing to them is to be able to make progress and get ahead.

With the help of their communal bank they were able to increase their potato crop.  Now they sell wholesale in the central market in the capital of the country, where with each new harvest they get better earnings.  Later, they would like to use the savings they have to get their own piece of land for farming.  They plan to get greater income because they would no longer have to pay to rent.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is happy to be able to belong to the most respected financial institution in the area.  This is where she learned to make progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy organic fertilizer for her potato crop.  Within four months her crop will produce a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her potato crop

loans.name: Blanca Rita

texts.es: Blanca Rita tiene 56 años,  tiene  4 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 depende de ella. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda. Pues ha sido una persona muy dinámica la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda, este negocio surge por la necesidad de no tener un trabajo estable que le proporcione el alimento diario. Por lo que ha sido muy difícil mantener su negocio pues existen ciertas competencias que ofrecen otras cosas que ella no puede comprar. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos y otras cosas de necesidad básica.
texts.en: Blanca Rita is 56 years old, and she has 4 children of which only one is economically dependent on her. She has been working with the Fundación for a long time, because the loans have been of great help to her. Being a very energetic person, and not having a stable job that could provide her with the necessary income to face daily expenses, she established a shop in her house, where her customers come to. It has been very difficult to run her shop, because some of her competitors sell things she cannot buy. This is why she is requesting a loan, so that she will be able to buy basic grains, sweets, drinks, juices and other basic products.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Karina Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

La señora Karina tiene 21 años, está casada hace tres años y tiene un  lindo bebe de dos años. Viven en la casa de sus suegros.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de paja toquilla, para la cual viajan una vez por semana a otras ciudades tales como Guayaquil, Ambato y Esmeraldas donde sus productos son bien apreciados ya que llegan gran cantidad de turistas los cuales son buenos clientes para sus productos. Trabaja tres días a la semana en lo que es comprar, llevar y entregar sus productos. Los productos que lleva son: sombreros, servilleteros, paneras, entre otros bellos productos. Estos los compra a artesanos de Montecristi.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sus productos.  Es socia del Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Cantón Montecristi, the place famous for its straw hats and the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro the “Old Warrior.”
Karina is 21 years old, has been married for three years and has a beautiful two-year-old baby. They live with her in-laws.
She runs a business selling straw goods. She travels once a week to other cities like Guayaquil, Ambato and Esmeraldas, where the goods are well appreciated because of all the tourists who visit. Tourists make good customers for her goods. She works three days a week buying, transporting and delivering her goods. The products she carries are: hats, napkin rings, bread baskets, among other beautiful goods. She buys them from artisans in Montecristi.
She will use this loan to buy her products. She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and she likes it for the easy access to loans.
Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: Purchase of straw hats, baskets and napkin rings

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia, de 38 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora; convive con Oswaldo, de 42 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos Marilu de 18, Wilfredo de 15 y Genesis de 1 año, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vista Hermosa (sierra peruana). Para mantener a su familia ella se dedica a varias actividades; una de ellas es la agricultura; en los terrenos de cultivo que le heredaron sus padres, todos los fines de semana los dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos de papa. Pero lo que más le gusta a Eugenia es trabajar en su renovadora de calzados, que está ubicada en zona céntrica de su ciudad, ya tiene 19 años dedicándose a ello, y constantemente recibe visitas de sus clientes, ya que su trabajo es muy bueno, más adelante está planeando comparar materiales de construcción para edificar su casa; en su terreno propio, que tiene en la ciudad; para que pueda trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y como miembro activo de banco comunal, está muy contenta de poder compartir sus experiencias de éxito. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará materiales que solicita para su renovadora de calzados.
texts.en:
Eugenia, age 38, is an unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives with her life partner, 42 year old Oswaldo.  They have four children, but they only live with three of them.  Marilu is 18, Wilfredo is 15, and Genesis is 1 year old.  They live in their own house in Vista Hermosa (in the Peruvian mountains).

She does various activities to support her family.  One of those activities is farming on the land she inherited from her parents.  Every week-end she takes care of her potato crop.  However, what Eugenia likes the most is working in her shoe repair shop, which in in the central area of the city.  She has been doing that for 19 years.  She has a continual flow of customers because her work is very good.  Later, she plans on buying construction material to build a house on the land that she has in the city.  That way it will be easier for her to get about.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  As an active member of her communal bank, she is very happy to be able to share their successful experiences.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy materials for her shoe repair business.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve the efficiency of her shoe repair business

loans.name: Responsables De Jalpa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Responsables de Jalpa, porque todas las integrantes son muy cumplidas. Está ubicado en México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su elaboración de artesanías. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.

La señora Leonor C. S. es integrante de este grupo. Ella es originaria de la comunidad de San Juan Jalpa, tiene 50 años, estudio hasta tercero de secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 5 hijos, 3 dependen de ella. Ella ha vivido en esta comunidad 50 años y se dedica a la ganadería (cría y venta de borregos), esta actividad la inicio desde hace 10 años, el préstamo lo solicita para comprar alimento para engordar a sus borregos. Sus clientes comentan de propia voz que los borregos que vende la señora están bien cuidados y alimentados y les inspira confianza al comprar uno de ellos porque tienen la certeza de llevarse un producto de calidad. Al solicitar este préstamo la señora Leonor se siente contenta. Quiere poco a poco comprar más borregos y con ello tener su propia granja bien establecida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Responsables de Jalpa” (Responsible Ones of Jalpa) because all of the members are very reliable.  The group is located in Mexico.  This community is known for its handicrafts.  The group is comprised of 11 members.

Leonor C. S. is a member of the group.  She is from San Juan Jalpa, and she is 50 years old.  She went to school until the third year of high school.  She has a total of five children; three of them are dependent upon her.  She has lived in this community for 50 years.  She works with livestock (raises and sells sheep).  She started this activity ten years ago.

The loan she is requesting is to buy feed to fatten the sheep.  Her customers say that the sheep that Leoner sells are well taken care of and well fed.  This inspires confidence in buying one of her sheep because the customers are sure they are getting a quality product.

Leonor is pleased to request this loan.  Little by little she wants to buy more sheep.  Upon doing so she will have her own well established farm.

loans.use: To buy and fatten sheep

loans.name: Cristhian José

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Cristian es un joven muy trabajador,  a sus 19 años le gusta pensar en su futuro ya que él cree que antes de formar su familia es importante tener algo que ofrecer a su familia para no tener un fracaso en su vida futura, en la actualidad vive en casa de sus padres.

El en ocasiones trabaja en albañilería pero en sus días libres y cuando no tiene estos trabajos se dedica a la venta de pescado, recorre la ciudad en una bicicleta lo cual le resulta incomodo por la carga que tiene que llevar pero de igual lo hace ya que es su forma de ganarse la vida.  Trabaja los sábados y domingos  desde las 5am hasta las 14h00 y los días que no tiene trabajo de albañilería también el mismo horario. Sus productos los compra en Manta.
 
Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque permite a personas como el que puedan poner su negocio y salir adelante. Este crédito lo quiere ocupar para comprar un triciclo (bicicleta con carreta) y así recorrer sus productos con más comodidad.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa y una linda familia.
texts.en:
The Anibal San Andrés community bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture. It’s also known nationally and internationally for its handicrafts. It’s famous for Panama hats.

Cristian is a young hard-working 19 year old. He likes to think about his future. He believes before having a family that it is important to have something to offer them, in order to avoid family failures. At the moment, he lives in his parents’ house.

At times, he works in construction. However, on his free days and when he’s not building, he sells fish. He covers the city on bicycle which is uncomfortable because of his cargo load. He does it anyway because it is way to make a living. He works Saturdays and Sundays from 5am to 2pm. On the days he doesn’t have construction work, he works the same schedule. He buys his products in Manta, Ecuador.

This is his third loan with his community bank. He likes the bank because it allows people to help their business and make progress. This loan will be used to buy a tricycle ( a bicycle with a cart) so he can sell his products more comfortably.

His dream is to have a nice family and house.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle ( a bicycle with a cart)

loans.name: Carlotta

texts.en:
Carlotta F. and her husband, Daniel, started a piñata store in August 2007 after Carlotta lost her job at a car dealership. When she joined the ranks of the growing number of unemployed in Floresville, this mother of seven children realized that her dream of starting her own business was now the most practical alternative. Santana’s Party Supplies started out as a piñata store, but quickly grew into a general party supply store, renting out chairs, tables, moonwalks and water slides. 

Their current inventory is insufficient to meet the public’s demand for wedding decorations. Therefore, Carlotta and Daniel are going to use this loan to buy white chairs and tables, arches, columns, and other wedding decorations to rent out. Previously, they had sub-leased these items from party supply stores in San Antonio and barely made a profit. Now, they will be able to avoid the commute to San Antonio and have wedding decorations readily available for customers. 

A constant challenge is the competition of large big-box stores like Wal-Mart. The Fites overcome this challenge by maintaining competitive prices and building relationships with their customers. The couple eventually plans to open up more party supply businesses in southern Texas and give a business to each of Carlotta's children.

loans.use: To buy wedding equipment and decorations

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline M. graduated from the Art Institute of Dallas with a fashion design degree and was promptly employed by a company that designs cheerleading uniforms, Varsity Brands. On the side, Jacqueline was designing her own clothes, and when she tried to sell her products through a variety of outlets, she realized how difficult it is for independent designers to enter the fashion industry. So, in 2008, the 23-year-old entrepreneur spent her savings on paying programmers to build a website where she could sell her designs. However, her vision was much larger than selling her own products; she wanted to help all beginner and independent designers make their products accessible and available to a wider market. Artists can post their designs on the website and if they sell anything, Jacqueline takes a 10% commission on the sale. The website launched in July of 2009 and she currently has 15 designers and over 100 products on the website!

Jacqueline has gained many new skills in the process of starting an online business, but one area that continues to be her biggest challenge is advertising. While her website design is attractive and workable, not enough people know about it yet. With this loan, Jacqueline will be able to hire an internet marketing specialist who will assist her in establishing the best practices in online advertising of her design business website.  

Even though Jacqueline is a full-time employee and works on this website during her spare time, she still finds time to give back. She volunteers for the Texas’ Next Top Designer event by making fliers and finding sponsors. Jaqueline says, “My life is a little more stressful because I have no idea where this business will go in the future, but it's exciting and it's something I love to do for fun! It doesn’t even feel like work.”

Feel free to check out her website at www.designsociety.net.

loans.use: To hire an internet marketing specialist

loans.name: Cinthya Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

La señora Cinthya lleva en el Banco Comunal 4 años y está muy contenta, nos dice que lo que más le gusta son las reuniones ya que en ellas se divierte con sus amigas. Tiene 23 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo de dos años. Su marido trabaja de obrero. Ella tiene titulo de profesora de nivel primario.

Trabaja de docente en una escuela de la localidad, también es comerciante de productos de Avon, Esika (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja todos los días en las mañanas en su escuela ya que les vende a sus compañeras y en las tardes sale a recorrer por la ciudad de Montecristi, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente o cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar mas de su mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos para este mes.
 
Sus sueños son seguir su licenciatura y terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Cantón Montecristi, the place famous for its straw hats and the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro, the “Old Warrior.”
Cinthya has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years and is very happy. She tells us that her favourite part is the meetings because she has a good time with her friends.
She is 23 years old, married and has a two-year-old child. Her husband works as a labourer. She is certified as an elementary school teacher.
She works as a teacher in a local school, and also sells Avon and Esika products (beauty products, perfume and women’s accessories). She works at the school in the morning, selling to her colleagues. In the afternoon she goes around Montecristo, selling on credit and collecting payments every one to two weeks.
She will use this loan to buy merchandise given that she has a lot of orders this month.
Her dream is to continue and to finish her degree.

loans.use: Purchase of creams, perfume, jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Iniciadoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama INICIADORAS, porque entre todas las integrantes se motivaron a iniciar con el grupo. Está ubicado en México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.L. señora Reyna A. es integrante D. este grupo. Tiene 49 años, estudio hasta S. D. secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y 1 hombre, dos dependen D. D. elL.. ElL. lleva viviendo en L. comunidad 2 años y se dedica a L. venta D. tortillas y abarrotes, esta actividad L. inicio hace 9 años, el crédito lo solicita para comprar maíz, gas y abarrotes. Con un préstamo L. señora compró su tanque, comal y prensa para hacer las tortillas, con esto elL. se motivo a seguir adelante con su negocio.Sus clientes comenta que las tortillas que venD. L. señora están bien hechas y les inspira confianza el comprarlas porque tiene L. confianza D. llevarse un producto D. calidad. Al solicitar este préstamo L. señora Reyna se siente motivada y comprometida a seguir trabajando para poder cumplir con sus metas. Quiere este crédito para obtener más producción, consolidar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Iniciadoras” (Initiators) because the members were motivated to start the group.  The group is located in Mexico.  It is comprised of 12 members.

Reyna A. is a member of this group.  She is 49 years old, and she went to school until the second year of high school.  She is married and has a total of four children, three girls and a boy.  Two of the children are dependent upon her.  She has been living in the community for two years.  She sells tortillas and groceries, an activity she started nine years ago.

The loan she is requesting is to buy corn, gas, and groceries.  She used a loan to buy a gas tank, a “comal” (ceramic dish or metal hotplate for cooking tortillas), and a press for making tortillas.  This motivated her to get ahead with her business.  Her customers say that the tortillas that Reyna sells are well maD..  This inspires confidence in buying them because the customers know they are getting a quality product.

Upon requesting this loan Reyna feels motivated and committed to continue working in order to be able to reach her goals.  She wants this loan in order to increase production, strengthen her business, and help her children finish their education.

loans.use: To buy raw material and invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Chairs, tables, three-compartment sink, refrigerator, freezer

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason M. started a non-emergency medical transportation business, Dedicated Medical Transport, a year and a half ago. With rates comparable to a traditional taxi, Jason specializes in wheelchair, senior and special needs transportation for those customers who might need more care and comfort than a cab. Typical destinations for his customers include doctor’s appointments, clinics, dialysis centers, rehabilitation, etc.

Jason began his business as the sole employee with one van and a customer that needed transport to a dialysis center three times a week.  Since then, he has expanded his business to four vans and five employees. 

Dedicated Medical Transport works directly with individuals but, also, is contracted by vendors. It takes 30-35 days to get paid by the vendors, and Jason has a cash-flow financial crunch. He plans on using his loan for operating expenses to pay his employees to solve this cash-flow problem. He has had a difficult time securing a loan because other lenders only want to lend for capital purposes, such as autoloans, rather than loans for operating expenses.

With twins on the way, Jason is excited to eventually expand his business to other parts of Central Texas such as San Antonio and Houston. From the start, Jason knew that he wanted to start a business that was rewarding and recession-proof. His comfortable, affordable transportation services are definitely in demand and Jason is hopeful to fulfill this need. He says, “At the end of the day, I know I’ve helped people.”

loans.use: Operating Expenses - paying employees

loans.name: Angela Janet

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

E este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene 40 años de edad está casada hace mas de 20 años y tuvo tres hijos de 8 -6 y 2 años, los mayorcitos ya están en escuela. El marido es albañil.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos de paja toquilla, para lo cual viaja todas las semanas a Quito, Guayaquil y Esmeraldas  a entregar a comerciantes de allá sus productos, nos dice que en estas ciudades se queda dos días hasta que le cancelen sus productos. Luego regresa a Montecristi a comprar a artesanos de los Bajos de Montecristi para poder viajar la siguiente semana a otra ciudad. Entre los productos que mas vende están: los sombreros, chocolateras, servilleteros y otros.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos que llevar en esta ocasión a Quito. Esta en el Banco Comunal mas de 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda recibida. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The Aníbel San Andrés community bank meets every two weeks in Montecrisi which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are known both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

This is where we meet Angela who tells us something about her life.  She is 40 years old, has been married for more than 20 years and has three children who are 8, 6 and 2.  The older children are already in school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Angela is a merchant who sells products made out of 'toquilla palm' (a native plant) and travels every week to Quito, Guayaquil and Esmeraldas to deliver her products to merchants there.  She tells us that she stays in these towns for two days until she has sold her products.  She then returns to Montecristi to buy from craftsmen in Bajos de Montecristi so that she can travel to another town the following week.  The products she sells include hats, chocolate pots and napkin rings.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise since she has a number of orders right now to take to Quito.  She has been a member of the community bank for more than 5 years and she likes it because of the support she has received from it.

Her dream is to have her own home because right now she lives with her mom.

loans.use: To buy hats, chocolate pots and napkin rings made from 'toquilla palm'

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James B. comes from a long line of entrepreneurs, and more specifically, “handymen”, as he calls it. His grandfather owned a welding shop and did repairs for people on the side. His father was also a well-known handyman in the Lubbock area. After the father’s recent death, James and his wife used their savings and turned the family trade into an actual business, complete with a name and a logo, Lonestar Repair and Remodeling. Before James made this decision, he had worked for a variety of construction companies and was promoted quickly despite his young age. James says, “I’ve been in construction since I could swing a hammer”. However, following in his father’s footsteps, James was not happy working for other people and knew that his dream was to be self-employed. It was not too difficult to secure the first clients as they have been loyal customers to his family for years. James says, “I live in Lubbock, known as the biggest small town. Whenever you do something, everybody knows about it and that can be a good thing and that can be a bad thing. But, for me, it’s a good thing. Word of mouth is really what grows my company.” 

	With this loan, James will buy a paint sprayer, a job-site table saw, two nail guns and a cordless multi-tool kit that will allow him to take on more complicated jobs. James employs his two younger brothers part-time but they both have other jobs. He is excited to expand his customer base so that  he can employ people full-time. With his wife at Wayland Baptist University studying to be a teacher, the couple are on a tight budget. Lucky for James, his wife is an “extreme budgeter” and can make a dollar stretch. James’ marketing plan is to be an honest businessman with a good work ethic. He believes that through word of mouth, people will choose him because of his affordable and fair prices.

loans.use: Paint sprayer, job-site table saw, two nail guns and a cordless multi-tool kit

loans.name: Luisa Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

La señora Luisa tiene 33 años de edad y esta casada, de  esta relación bendecida por Dios tiene tres hijos de 15- 11-y 9 años, el mayor esta en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.
 
Tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo hace 11 años, en la cual a pasado duras temporadas pero que ha sabido sobrellevar, en la actualidad el negocio ha mejorado y dice que en parte gracias a los créditos que ha recibido ya que con ellos ha ido adecuando y surtiendo mas su tienda ahora nos dice que casi tiene de todo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00. Sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos para su local y un congelador para guardar: carnes, pescado y otros productos que requieren mantenerse congelados. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, le gusta por la facilidad para cancelar las cuotas y por la ayuda recibida.
 
Su sueño es tener un mini Marquet mas elegante.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, a place famous for its Panama hats and for being the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro, the “Old Warrior.” 

Luisa, 33, is married and from this union blessed by God were born three children who are 15, 11 and 9 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the two youngest are in elementary school.  Her husband is a laborer.

She has had a grocery store for the last 11 years where she has had some difficult times but that she has managed to overcome.  Currently, the business has improved thanks in part to the loans she has received with which she has been stocking and equipping the store.  She tells us that now she has almost everything.  She is open for business daily from 6am until 8pm.  She takes delivery of her products at the store.

She wants to use this loan to buy more products for the store and a freezer to store meats, fish and other products that need to be stored frozen.  

She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the ease of repayments and for the help received.

Her dream is to have a more elegant minimarket.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard M. was managing the catering sector of the Bayou Baglery in New Orleans until 2005 when Hurricane Katrina hit the Louisiana coast. Bernard, his wife, Charlene, and his six boys were separated during the extreme chaos the city experienced during the storm’s immediate aftermath. Charlene and the boys evacuated on a truck reserved for women and children with Texas as its general destination while Bernard made his way to the closest airport. Among the many long lines of people going to different cities, Bernard chose to go to San Antonio because he had heard its mayor, Phil Hardberger, announce on CNN that the city had sufficient resources to take care of Hurricane Katrina evacuees. Because the cell phone towers had shut down, Bernard and Charlene had a difficult time getting in touch with each other. After two weeks, Bernard learned from his mother that Charlene and the boys were in the Astrodome in Houston. Bernard went to Houston, found his family, and took them back to San Antonio. The Bayou Baglery had been forced to close and Bernard did not have a job or home to return to in New Orleans. The McGraws decided to set down their roots in San Antonio and Bernard found a run-down shack on the Southside of town and set up a kitchen with a hot plate, a refrigerator, and a deep fryer from the flea market, and tables and chairs from Wal-mart. Soon after, Bernard realized that his make-shift restaurant needed to make several changes in order to meet permit standards. Also, in that short amount of time, Bernard developed an incredibly loyal and gracious clientele from the close-by military base. They raised money at the base to help Bernard make all the required repairs and to obtain various permits and licenses. Since 2007, Bernard’s Creole Kitchen has won the San Antonio Critic’s Choice Award, the Blue Plate Award and the Talk of the Town Award. 

Bernard studies Biblical Theology at the Baptist University of the Americas and has been asked by them to open his kitchen in their dining area. There will be a lunch line for a guaranteed amount of 85 students a day (plus additional students without meal plans who will pay cash) and a restaurant with a seating area for his regular customers. With this loan, Bernard plans to stock the restaurant with enough supplies to handle the increased amount of customers. Supplies will include food, new menus, salt and pepper shakers, a new register system, and a safe. 

In addition to going to school and managing his restaurant, Bernard still makes time to give back. Five years ago, he started a program called “Gumbo Under the Bridge” feeding homeless people. He says, “After being homeless, you never judge a homeless person again.” Last year, he also started a job-start program that he participated in at his own high school where students work at large companies and learn how to fill out job applications and to dress and act in a professional manner.

loans.use: New register system, new menus, salt and pepper shakers, a safe, food

loans.name: Ana Carlota

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

La señora Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andes hace 6 ciclos y esta muy contenta en el ya que según nos cuenta encontró aquí mucha ayuda y ha hecho buenas amistades con las otras socias. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera de 4 hijos, tres ya mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 16 años que estudia en el colegio, todos sus hijos viven aun con ella.

Ella vende pescado en el Mercado Municipal de Portoviejo donde tiene un puestito. Trabaja de lunes a viernes y en ciertas ocasiones los sábados. Desde las 4 am ella se va a Manta a comprar el pescado para venderlo en Portoviejo. Aunque a veces mejor compra en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas, dice que sale un poco más caro que en Manta pero no tiene que gastar en transporte y se evita trabajo, ella vende hasta las 15h00 o hasta que termine lo que tenia, lo que más vende es pescado albacora por libras o en piezas.
 
Este crédito es para comprar una sombrilla grande para evitar el sol y para la lluvia ya que el invierno esta próximo y para comprar pescado.
 
Su sueño es tener un local cerrado con más comodidades.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, a place famous for its Panama hats and for being the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro, the “Old Warrior.” 

Ana has been a member of the Aníbal San Andrés communal bank for six cycles and is very happy in it because, according to what she tells us, she found much help here and has established good friendships with the other members.   She is 42 years old and is a single mother of four children, three adults and a lovely 16-year-old young lady who is in secondary school.  All her children still live with her.

She sells fish in Portoviejo’s Municipal Market where she has a small stand.  She works Monday through Friday and occasionally on Saturdays.  She goes to Manta at 4am to buy fish for later resale in Portoviejo although sometimes she buys from the local wholesalers in the same market.  She says that this is a little more expensive than buying in Manta but she saves on transportation costs and on labor.  She is open until 3pm or until she sells out her stock.  Her best seller is albacore either by the pound or the piece.

This loan is to buy a large umbrella to protect from the sun and the rain since winter is approaching and to buy fish.

Her dream is to have an enclosed locale with more amenities.

loans.use: To buy fish and an umbrella.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco D. of Rad Comics is a comic book writer and artist. As an Environmental Studies graduate student at the University of A&M Corpus Christi, environmental issues influence his two comic series: “Flatlands” and “Freaks of Nature”. With this loan, Francisco will buy a tablet, a device that allows artists to draw directly on the computer. This tablet will allow him to easily erase mistakes and edit his drawings, thus making the whole process much more efficient. Francisco has a busy schedule with being a grad student, working in the Coastal Studies department and producing comics, so Francisco appreciates anything that makes his life a little more efficient!


Francisco will also use his loan to utilize a print-by-demand online publisher from which he will sell issues of Flatlands and Freaks of Nature. Flatlands is a science fiction, futuristic comic book where the world is increasingly becoming hotter, humans are the minority, and other species have evolved with the increased heat. Freaks of Nature is a product of Francisco’s younger years and is described by his friends as “ahead of its time”. Eventually, Francisco hopes to develop a core following of his comic books, sell them in book and comic stores, and possibly even make movies based on them.

loans.use: Graphics Tablet

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
In the city that always has a reason to celebrate, people love to have fiestas! Esteban C. and his extensive family are not an exception, and what is a party without a moonwalk? The kids in Esteban’s family always wished for moonwalks at their parties but they were too expensive, not to mention the required large deposit. Therefore, he decided to buy a couple of moonwalks and rent them out at affordable prices to his family and acquaintances. Eventually, Esteban realized there was quite a demand for moonwalks and other party supplies like chairs and tables. What started as a kind gesture to make moonwalks more available to kids in his neighborhood and family has turned into a thriving business!


 His present inventory of chairs is inadequate to meet the growing demand for his party supply business. Therefore, Esteban plans to use his loan to purchase more chairs. Esteban plans to continue growing his business, and eventually to pass it on to his grandson.

loans.use: Chairs

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip L. plans to buy a new video camera with his loan. Currently, a video production company contracts him to film events, business meetings and depositions. Because he does not have a camera, he has to rent one each time he is contracted and the profit margin is lower. When he buys his new video camera, he will not have to rent equipment and he can even be hired directly, instead of through a company. 


Phillip hopes that his business will expand to the point where he can buy better cameras and employ people. He also dreams to start many more businesses like refurbishing cars to use less gas and buying homes to rent out to people. Phillip is very involved in his church and is excited to teach the youth group how to film. They all plan to make short films together as a youth group activity.

loans.use: Video Equipment

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es casada, tiene 64 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos ya independizados. Vive junto a su esposo en el anexo La Viña, distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora y cincuenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde que se casó, ella nos explica que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en este negocio debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibia como trabajador de una empresa agrícola de la zona no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Durante todo este tiempo su negocio ha sido de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante a su familia.

Juana cría aves de corral, cerdos y cuyes, para venderlos a los comerciantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Eventualmente los vende a sus vecinos. Ella ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva y nos comenta que gracias al dinero recibido su negocio pudo crecer y mantenerse, los animales que compró en aquella oportunidad ya se han desarrollado y ya han sido vendidos por completo.

Actualmente Juana se encuentra solicitando un nuevo préstamo de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales desea adquirir mas animales para seguir con su negocio de crianza y venta. Ella espera seguir creciendo como empresaria y agradece a las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Juana, age 64, is married and has five children who are already grown and independent.  She lives with her husband in the La Viña annex in the Cayaltí district.  It is 1 hour and 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been raising and selling animals since she got married.  She tells us that she had to start working in this business because her husband’s income as farm worker in the area did not cover the family expenses.  During all of this time her business has been a lot of help in getting her family ahead.

Juana raises poultry, pigs, and guinea pigs.  She sells them to merchants who usually visit the area where she lives.  Sometimes she sells to her neighbors.  

She has had a Kiva loan.  She tells us that thanks to the money she received, she was able to keep the business, and the business was able to grow.  The animals that she bought with this opportunity have developed, and they have all been sold.

Juana is now requesting a new loan for 500 soles.  She wants to get more animals to continue with her business of raising animals and selling them.  She hopes to continue growing as a businesswoman.  She is grateful to the people who collaborated with her through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy animals to expand her business of raising and selling animals

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen P. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old. Ellen is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for this activity.

In 2009, Ellen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Ellen is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: María Imelda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora María tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, el menor que es soltero vive con ella. Su marido es profesor en un colegio artesanal.

Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de pollos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 16h00  en su local en el mercado de Montecristi. Compra los pollos en pie a comerciantes que le llevan hasta su local, luego los pela y los vende por libras, tiene este negocio ya por 5 años y dice que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar más pollos y una  báscula para pesar los pollos  ya que la que tiene esta deteriorada y le ha causado molestias. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le ha gustado porque se han mantenido desde el principio con los mismos principios que son los de ayudarlas a salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank Aníbal San Andrés meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized nationally and internationally.  It is a place famous for its toquilla straw hats (Panama hats).

Mrs. María is 54, is in a communal marriage and has three children, two who are now adults.  The youngest is single and lives with her.  Her husband is a teacher in a handicrafts school.
