Maria’s business is buying and selling chickens.  She works daily from 6 am until 4 pm in her stand in the Montecristi Market.  She purchases the chickens from the merchants who bring them to her stand, then she cleans the chickens and sells them by the pound.  She has had the stand for 5 years and says that it is going well.

The loan will be used to buy more chickens and a scale to weigh them, since the scale that she has is in poor condition and has caused problems.  She has been in the communal bank since she started and she likes it because it has continued with the same principles to help the members get ahead.

Her dream is to have a bigger stand.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a scale

loans.name: Tomasito

texts.es:
Tomasito tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío San Pablo Escurre, del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga en su moto carguera, usualmente carga fruta, leña o ganado por los diversos caseríos de Olmos. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad, tanto para el como para sus clientes, ya que le provee los ingresos que necesita para solventar sus gastos personales y a la vez ayuda a sus vecinos a solucionar sus problemas de transporte, ya que la mayoría de caseríos del distrito quedan muy alejados uno del otro y no cuentan con movilidad estable.

El contínuo uso brindado a su vehículo y los accidentados caminos que tiene que recorrer a diario hacen que su unidad móvil requiera de mantenimiento continuo para que siga funcionando con normalidad. Es por ello que actualmente se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Tomasito ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado anteriormente por el fondo Kiva. Con ese crédito pudo asegurar el buen funcionamiento de su actividad durante algunos meses, y por ello se encuentra agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el a través del fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Tomasito is 30 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the community of San Pablo Escurre, of the Olmos district, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He offers a cargo service with his cargo motorcycle. Usually he hauls fruit, firewood or cattle from the different communities of Olmos. This business is very profitable for him and his customers. It provides the income he needs to pay for his personal expenses and at the same time help his neighbors with their transportation problems. Most of the communities of the district are very far from each other and don't have reliable transportation.   

The continuous use of his vehicle and the poor roads he has to drive over daily require continuous maintenance so that it can continue working normally. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that he is planning on investing in the maintenance and repair of his vehicle.  

Tomasito has previously had a loan financed by the Kiva fund.  With that loan he was able to assure the good function of his activity for some months. Because of that, he is grateful to the people who cooperated through the Kiva fund.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and repair costs

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita J. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Melita is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell, like eggplant, okra and others. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $355 a month for these activities.

In 2003, Melita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 38,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Melita is requesting a new loan of 38,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 20th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su ultima hija en un caserío del distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a mas D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado ovino. Ella cría estos animales en su domicilio alimentándolos D. pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. vive. Con los ingresos que le brinda este negocio ella ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Clorinda desea ampliar sus corrales y adquirir alimento D. modo que sus ovejas puedan desarrollarse en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales desea lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquila y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Clorinda, 51, is married and lives with her husband and youngest daughter in a hamlet in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area located in the province and region of Piura, more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. 

She earns a living raising and selling sheep. She raises these animals at home, feeding them with natural grasses. Once they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the merchants who often visit the area where she lives. With the income this business brings her she helps her husband, who is a farmer, with maintaining the household economy. 

Clorinda wishes to expand her pens and purchase fodder so that her sheep may develop in better conditions. Thus she felt it was a good idea to seek for the first time a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which she hopes to achieve her goal. 

She is a highly responsible woman and dedicated to her family. Those who know her consider her to be someone level-headed and trustworthy.

loans.use: To cover expenses for improvements in the housing and fodder of sheep for sale

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Anunciacion M. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Anunciacion is a widow and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling blankets, pots, pillow cases and similar products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anunciacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Anunciacion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she provides school services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $470 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units office covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos is sixty-seven years old.  She lives with her husband in the district of Tambogrande, a rural area which has a high level of agriculture.  They manage a stable home and are happily married.

Santos raises sheep in the back yard of their home.  Her husband manages two agricultural plots, one which the family owns and plants in lime and mango, and another which is owned by a friend who is unable to take care of the property and therefore pays him to care for it.

Santos is requesting the loan in order to purchase additional feed for her animals.  She hopes to be able to realize a good price due to the bulk price and be able to promote their growth.  This business is a significant portion of the familial income and a good method of stabilizing their income throughout the no-harvest months.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for her sheep

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry E. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old. Jerry is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for this activity.

In 2010, Jerry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his 1st loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Eliterio

texts.en:
Eliterio is fifty-five years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and young daughter in their own home.  Their home is located in the village of San Martin in the region of Tambogrande.  It is a rural area in which the majority of the population participates in agricultural activities.

The family raises cattle on their property.  They raise these cattle both for their meat and for their dairy products.  Eliterio sells their milk in the city of Tambogrande.  He sells a quantity of approximately twenty liters daily.  In addition to these activities, Eliterio has a small property on which he raises limes and mangos.

The loan will be used to purchase additional feed and make improvements to the infrastructure of his farm.  He hopes to be able to realize a bulk purchase of feed and improve the efficiency of his farm.

Eliterio is a dedicated father and husband.  He is very hard working and dreams of his daughter becoming a professional.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed and repair his corrals.

loans.name: Mirian Janeth

texts.en:
Mirian is twenty-one years old.  She is single and has no children.  She lives with family members in Pedregal Grande in the region of Piura.  This is an agricultural region.  The majority of the population are low income agricultural workers or farmers.

For the last two years Mirian has sold clothing and beauty products from her home.  She makes sales either by anticipating the demand or by sharing the company catalog with the potential buyer and taking orders.  She feels confident in her ongoing ability to anticipate her client’s needs and continue the business.

She is therefore requesting a ten month loan of 800 PEN in order to expand her inventory and fill the additional orders of her customers.  She has a number of loyal customers and she hopes to expand her clientele.

Mirian has one outstanding credit with another institution, which the credit analysis of Alternativa deems to be reasonable and within her ability to repay.  She has a good level of liquidity and business capital which she will use along with the new loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional beauty products and clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José Vicente es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad, que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral. El cría estos animales en unos corrales ambientados cerca de su domicilio alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente posee una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde siembra mango y limón. Con los ingresos que le brinda este negocio el se encarga de sostener la economía de su familia.

José desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta adquiriendo mas animales y alimento balanceado para lograr que se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a un mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales desea lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar gradualmente la calidad de vida de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Jose Vincente is a 28 year-old father who lives with his wife and their two children in a rural settlement in the agricultural area of Tambogrande.   This area is located in the Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than 3 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lamabayeque region.

He raises and sells livestock (sheep and barnyard fowl.)  He raises these animals in pens that are near his house, feeding them grain and natural grasses.  Once the animals have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the traders who often visit the area where he lives.  In addition, he has a small parcel of land where he cultivates mangoes and lemons.  With the income he earns from these businesses he supports his family.

Jose wants to expand his livestock business by purchasing more animals.  He will also buy nutritionally balanced feed that will promote optimal growth so that he can sell the animals for a good price.  To do this, he is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles.

His main desire is to continue to grow as a businessman and to gradually improve the quality of life of his family.  The people who know Jose consider him to be a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand his livestock business

loans.name: Claritza

texts.es:
Claritza tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su hija de 14 años de edad en casa de su madre ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella trabaja en base a pedidos, mientras más pedidos realiza más dinero gana, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y familiares. Asimismo vende zapatos por pedidos y  se encarga de administrar un negocio de venta de comida en el mercado del distrito desde hace casi cinco años.

Claritza ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva. Con ese préstamo ella pudo incursionar en la venta de zapatos y gracias a ello ya puede generarse ingresos adicionales. Actualmente ella desea seguir ampliando su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Por ello se encuentra solicitando un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles.

Claritza se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que han colaborado con ella a través del fondo Kiva. Ella planea seguir trabajando y creciendo como empresaria para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Claritza, 35, is single and lives with her 14-year-old daughter in a house with her mother located in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, an area of regular business activity which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells beauty products by catalog based on customer orders. The more orders she takes the more money she earns. Her primary customers are her neighbors and family members. At the same time she sells shoes in the same manner and for almost five years she has managed a business selling food in the district's market.  

Claritza has already worked previously with one loan financed through the Kiva Fund. With that loan she was able to delve into shoe sales thanks to which she now is able to generate additional income. Currently she wishes to continue growing her business in cosmetics sales and so is seeking a loan of an additional 500 soles. 

Claritza is highly appreciative towards the people who have contributed to her success through the Kiva fund. She plans to continue working and growing as a business owner in order to get ahead.

loans.use: Expansion of a business selling cosmetics by catalog

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito V. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Angelito is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Angelito owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $463 a month for this activity.

In 2009, Angelito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Angelito is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his 3rd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

texts.en: Chuluunbaatar D. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters, aged 16 and 18, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local high school and Chuluunbaatar operates a used clothing and shoes retail business with the help of his wife. He has been engaged in this business since 2007 and has gained much experience since then. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by selling more and different kinds of used items through his stall. Chuluunbaatar is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more quality used clothing and shoes in order to increase his product lines.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Ms. Lorna J. is from the Barangay of P4 Digson, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, single and has no dependants. To make a living, she is presently engaged in computer encoding activity. She’s been engaged in this kind of service business for two years. She is earning an average amount of not less than 5,200 PHP from providing encoding services.
Just this year, Lorna joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC, Lorna is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP under the Regular Loan Program as her first loan. This will be used to purchase piglets and starter feed for her new hog-fattening business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments and possible business expansions.

loans.name: Chuluubat

texts.en:
Chuluubat C. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a house. His two children, aged 15 and 12, both attend secondary school while his wife works in the agricultural sector.
Chuluunbat owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 1990 and has gained a lot of experience as a driver. He has a good, moral character. Chuluunbat needs more funds to build a new garage that will be useful for his car during the cold and extreme winters. Therefore, he is requesting a 950,000 MNT loan.

loans.name: Por

texts.en: Mr. Por V. is an old man whose wife appears on the photo above, and they are local villagers living in Kampong Tom Province. This couple is married with seven children, six of whom are single and one is married. Por V. is a village consultant adviser, while his wife is currently a recycling seller. Two of Por V.'s daughters have been providing an embellishing service for new couples many years, and they are also hired from people who will marry. Now, his daughters still require more materials to support their service. So that is why Mr. Por V. requests a loan for his children use to buy more wedding decorative materials.

loans.use: To buy more wedding decorative materials.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren D. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Tuv province, central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her husband works as a bookkeeper while her daughter helps out with the business. Dolgorsuren graduated from vocational training as a tailor and worked in a sewing factory from 1989 to 1995. She gained more experience working in a tailoring factory from 2000 to 2007, and has been sewing in her home since 2002, when she moved to her current town. She makes tailored clothes according to her customers' requests and has gained a lot of experience. In the future, she plans to establish her own tailoring factory. Dolgorsuren is a modest, honest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to purchase materials and a steam iron for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a steam iron

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Battur B. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently they live together with Battur’s parents in his parents' two-bedroom apartment. Battur’s younger brother lives there with his wife too. 

Since 2008 Battur has been running a retail clothes business. He rents a place in Altai Center and sells a variety of wool and cashmere hats, scarfs and gloves. Mongolia is famous for its cashmere and wool products and they are in big demand, especially during the wintertime. Battur adopted this business from his mother, who used to work as a salesperson of wool products in a state department store. Normally, he buys his products from the factory’s wholesale points. 

Next year, Battur is planning to buy a one-room studio apartment for his family. Therefore he is trying to save some money by increasing his business profit. He is one of our reliable customers. This will be his second loan, and he wants to use it to increase his working capital and buy more products before the winter season.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and buy more products before the winter season

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan D. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Two of his children attend a local school. His eldest son mainly operates Jargalsaihan's coal trading and transportation business and his wife helps with this business.
Jargalsaihan works and lives in the countryside as a herder. He owns around 300 livestock. He runs his transportation business during winter months and herds livestock in the countryside in the summer months. He first went into business in 2007 by transporting and delivering coal and firewood using his own van in order to increase his family's quality of life. Over the years, he has built a stable and successful operation. For the future, he says, "I am trying hard to earn enough money to build a house and fence for my family". Jargalsaihan is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to use to purchase necessary spare parts for his car (480,000 MNT) as well as more coal (1,120,000 MNT) for resale.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car, and coal for resale

texts.en: Sarantuya A. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son is a student at the university while her younger son attends elementary school. Both Sarantuya and her middle daughter receive pensions for disabilities. Sarantuya has been operating a small boot-making and repair business in their home, with the help of her husband, since 1990 and has gained much experience. She successfully participated in the program of providing services to disabled children at home, implemented by World Vision, NGO, and was named "Best Volunteer-2008" in Huvsgul province. Her business earnings have enabled her not only to pay her daughter's tuition fees but also to provide for her entire family. Sarantuya is a modest, helpful, and open-minded business woman and is requesting a 250,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and supplies to make a wider variety of shoes and boots.

loans.name: Tumendelger

texts.en: Tumendelger C. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son, age 12, attends a local secondary school while his youngest son goes to kindergarten. His wife works as a salesperson in a clothes retail shop and Tumendelger operates a transportation service business in his province. Tumendelger purchased his own van and started his transporting business after living and working in the countryside as a herder between 1994 and 2008. In the beginning of 2010, he moved to the capital city of the province and transports locally. Also, he purchases and transports livestock from Munhhaan sub province to sell back to the meat traders. Tumendelger is a very modest, helpful man and says, " Before gets cold, I want to build a new fence surrounding my home." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase and transport livestock which he will sell in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and buy a wood for a fence from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut P.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya, Bali. Ni Ketut P. is married and has one school-aged child. Ni Ketut P. has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 250,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2010, Ni Ketut P. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,300,000 IDR from MUK which was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,300,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from MUK. Ni Ketut P. plans to use additional income to financially support immediate members of her family. Ni Ketut P. is the leader of an 18 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Kucup Mekar (PK-10337). About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Ni Ketut P. 0 (0) merupakan 49 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut P. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 18 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kucup Mekar (PK-10337). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut P. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut P. menghasilkan sekitar 0,250 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut P. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut P. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.300.000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.300.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam is 53 years old, married and the father of two daughters. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in ger a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter Otgonsukh is a beautician at soyol beauty salon. His wife operates a  grocery store on their plot of land.

He started his taxi business in 2007 then purchased another taxi to rent for  10.000 MNT per day.  His family is the most important thing for him and he says, "as a father, I would like to buy a ger(a traditional nomadic tent) for my oldest daughter, Otgonsukh.

He is very hardworking and energetic person and is requesting 1.200.000 MNT to purchase a ger for his beloved daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a ger for his eldest daughter.

loans.name: Shafaqat's Group

texts.en:
Shafaqat, age 53 (with hand raised in the photo), runs a boutique business from her home. She purchases cloth from different textile firms and provides it to different tailors and embroidery experts, with whom she has contracts. Their task to complete finished products from the cloth for her to sell in her shop. 

She is very active and gives the maximum time to her business every day, which is why her business is going well. She contributes to her family's finances from the proceeds of her business. She has 10 years of experience in her business and is very confident about its growth.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to apply toward her boutique business. With the loan, she will purchase cloth in bulk to fulfill larger orders on time and to add variety to the display in her boutique. This is her second loan application from Asasah. Over the previous loan year, she has proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.
 
Shafaqat lives in the city of Faisalabad, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its textile industry. She lives with her parents in a three-room house in an area named Islamia Park.

loans.use: To buy cloth in bulk for her boutique business

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mak S., age 40, is a farmer who has run a farming business for many years. She and her husband, Mr. Khoeun, age 48, have five children, two of whom are grown and employed in an industrial factory, where they earn their own salaries. Mak S. and her husband, who is presently employed in a construction project, normally earn an average of $7.50 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. 

In addition to her farming endeavors, Mak S. is currently working as an ice-cream vendor in and around her community in order to earn extra income. She exerts herself a great deal by pushing her cart such distances every day, and she dreams of having a vehicle with which to pick up and sell her product, but she has no financial means to do so at present. Therefore, Mak S. would like to take out a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle, which she plans to attach to her existig ice-cream vending cart.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle to connect to her ice-cream vending cart

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita G. is from the village of Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a business selling fish in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Clarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Clarita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. loans.name: Mayleen Malana's Group

texts.en:
Mayleen M. is 21 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. She is from Cataggaman Nuevo in Tuguegarao City, Cagayan province in the Luzon islands. Mayleen is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mayleen makes and sells primarily fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mayleen joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Mayleen is requesting a loan, her first from ASKI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional foods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products to sell

loans.name: Kom

texts.en:
Mrs. Kom Y. is a 45-year-old resident of a local village in Kompong Tom Province. She is a mother of five children, four of whom are single. Her husband Krin is a fisherman, while Kom owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, and her crops are growing well.

Kom presently earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house, selling their eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. She is now applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional ducks to produce eggs for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional ducks to produce eggs to sell.

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria S., from the village of Old San Mariano, is the 55-year-old group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Maria S..

Maria, who is married and has five children, runs a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her sixth loan for 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. Maria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano, Isabela

texts.en: Jennifer A. is from the village of Bungad. She is 37 years old. Jennifer is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Jennifer makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream to the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,400 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city of Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She is 36 years old and married to R. M.. She has two sons. Her eldest son is 4 years old and youngest is 6 months old. Both of them are too young to go to school. She is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her family, particularly her youngest son, who needs her full attention. 

Her husband has a plant-selling business. He has a small plant shop from where he sells different plants, plant pots, seeds, etc. He has good number of customers due to his good knowledge of plants. He has a good reputation among his customers and enjoys regular sales.  

Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy plants, seeds and pots and increase his sales. Nazia is hopeful that her husband’s business will surely improve with the help of this loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never missed any meetings and paid her installments on time. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady who has dressed up with an orange color is Nazia and the next to her who is raising her hand is her group member Shahnaz".

loans.use: To buy plants, seeds and pots for the plant shop

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en: Maria Cristina L. is from the village of Guinatan. She is 41 years old. Maria Cristina is single. To make a living, Maria Cristina sells clothing and shoe products in the local community. Maria Cristina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Maria Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maria Cristina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Maria Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en: Ulziijargal D. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter in a ger (traditional Mongolian housing tent) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her daughter attends university while she operates a business making concrete blocks with the help of her husband. They have been in this business since 1996 and have gained many years of experience. The demand for this product is usually high during the spring and autumn seasons. Ulziijargal says, "All the blocks I produce are made by hand, so I am planning to buy a mechanical block-making machine in order to increase my productivity." She is requesting a 600,000 tugrik loan to produce more blocks.

loans.use: To produce more blocks

loans.name: Naseem Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhter lives in Faisalabad which is an industrial city in Pakistan. She has been living in a two-room brick house with her family in the Malikpur housing colony for five years. Naseem is a 47-year-old housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household works. She is married to N. A. who runs a barber shop in the market. He is very famous among his clients and people prefer his services because of his ability to do different kind of haircuts. Naseem has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her elder son and daughter are working in a textile mill and her youngest son is studying in 7th standard. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy scissors, hair creams, gels and hair colors. Naseem is hopeful that with his 25 years of experience in this business, her husband will successfully improve his business and increase his income as well. 

Naseem is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never misses any meeting and pays installments on time. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem Akhter.

loans.use: To buy items for a barber shop

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a 52-year-old housewife who lives with her family in a three-room brick house in Faisalabad, an industrial city well known for its textile products. She is married to M. R. who has a business selling stamp papers (used for legal documentation). He has been operating this business for the past five years. 

Rasheedan is the mother of two sons who work in a textile mill. Rasheedan couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions – that’s why they are unable to find good jobs and work for very little income. 

Rasheedan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, her husband will buy stamp papers in larger quantity for reselling. She is hopeful that her husband will get a good outcome from this loan investment and his income will improve. 

Rasheedan is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting. In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Rasheedan.

loans.use: To buy stamp papers in larger quantity for reselling

loans.name: Phork

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 48-year-old Phork S.’s daily activities, which she does in order to generate profit to support her family. She usually makes US $4 each day and has been in the business for over ten years. Phork S. provides this service to her neighbors: sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. Phork S. is married to Mr. Chhey, 50, a local farmer, and they have three children. One of their daughters sells secondhand clothes in the local market. Currently, her daughter’s business is running well and she wishes to add more inventory to her stock. Phork S. is looking for a loan to purchase secondhand clothes for her daughter to sell.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes for her daughter to sell

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar S. lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent) in Uvs province, Mongolia. His two oldest children, ages 16 and 14, attend a local high school and his youngest child stays at home with his mother. Ganbaatar operates a raw materials trading business in his town selling things like sheep and goat skins. He started this business in 1997. During the winter, he purchases meat, skins and leather and during spring, he buys goat's wool. He usually purchases his raw materials from neighboring sub provinces and sells at the meat traders in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After many years of successful operation, his business has reached a sustainable level and he has expanded his business as well. Ganbaatar is a modest and honest man who hopes to buy his own small truck for his business in the future. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrik loan in order to operate his meat trading business.

loans.use: To operate a meat trading business

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa T. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her children attend a local kindergarten and her husband is a taxi driver in their town. She graduated from Agricultural University as a hairdresser in 2003 and began to cut men's and women's hair in a beauty center.

Bayarmaa now works as a hairdresser in a rented space at a hair salon. She has been working in a rented space in Image Salon and has built a successful operation with many permanent customers. She pays a 100,000 MNT each month for a rented chair.

Bayarmaa is a very modest person and hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase equipment and tools for her hairdressing business. In the future, she plans to open her own hair salon.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and tools

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S., 44, is married to Mr. Keur, age 54. They live together in Kompong Tohm province with their one child. Mr. Keur shares responsibility for his family by driving a motor taxi.

Meas sells various kinds of vegetables in Trang Kork market and earns approximately $3 a day. Mr. Keur runs his business very well because he has communication skills which are useful with his customers.

Unfortunately, Meas’ husband’s motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Meas has decided to seek a loan of $300 from HKL, a Kiva partner, which she will use to purchase a used motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle

loans.name: Lumumba

texts.en:
Lumumba Achieng' is 48 years old, married and has one child who is fourteen and attending school. He is a dairy farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for six years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk which he sells to the local market. He is also a lecturer in animal husbandry and treats animals in his area. His biggest challenges in farming have been the lack of enough animal feed, stiff market competition, loan facilities being rare and the purchasing power of clients being very low.

Lumumba has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. (He comments that Juhudi should widen the loan products available to individuals and keep up the spirit of lending to the low-income groups in society.) The extra income from this loan will improve his income and his living standards. In future, he would like to increase the number of his dairy cows, improve his artificial insemination service and open a small agrovet.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 40 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces sorghum, beans, cassava, potatoes and mangoes, which are all sold to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of clothes to the local market. Hellen is 61 years old. She is married with five children who are all adults. One of her children is currently attending school. Her primary challenge in farming has been lack of finances to expand her activities.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of her family. She comments that she has heard good benefits from those already granted the loan, and it has inspired her to take one also.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Suyarbek

texts.ru: Шамуратов Суярбек проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Суярбек высшего образования не имеет. Занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. В этом году он хочет, посеет пшеницу.
texts.en: Suyarbek S. lives in the Shahrituz Region. 41 years of age. Married, with three children. His wife works at a cooperative farm. Suyarbek does not have a college degree. He is a farmer. He has a big land plot next to his house and grows vegetables. He has a lot of experience in this area. He is taking out a loan to purchase seed and mineral fertilizers. This year he would like to plant wheat.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lucia Tuppal's Group

texts.en:
Lucia T. is from the village of Lemu Norte, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Lucia is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lucia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Кобилова Озода жительница Шахритуского района. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает вещи нужные для хозяйства (веревка, ремень). В бизнесе ей помогает дочь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Ozoda K. lives in the Shahrituz region. 41 years of age. Married, with three children. Education: secondary. She has been a market vendor for over five years. She rents a stall where she sells households goods (string, belts etc). Her daughter helps her in this business. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita V. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 43 years old. Lelita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lelita owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2009, Lelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Lelita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
