loans.use: To buy a special textiles offer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 47 years old. Erlinda is married and has nine children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector providing motorcycle transport. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled) transport services. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair existing vehicle for better service. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Одинаева Мехринисо проживает в городе Сарбанд. Возраст, 54 года. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке города. Имеет небольшую столовую, где работает поваром. Работа приносит доход, который дает возможность обеспечить себя и своего ребенка. Кредит берет для ремонта столовой.
texts.en: Mehriniso O. lives in the city of Sarband.  She is 54 years old, a widow, and has one child.  She has a high school education.  She works in the central market of the city. She has a restaurant where she works as a cook.  Her work brings in an income which allows her to provide for herself and her child. She is taking out a loan to renovate the dining room.

loans.use: Renovate a restaurant

loans.name: Awatif

texts.en: Awatif L. is currently in the business of selling clothes  and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Awatif is 45 years old and is widowed.   She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 31 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 5 months. Two of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband is a driver. Claudine sells various items in her shop. She has had this business for four months. With this loan she will buy more soap, sugar, and salt to sell. With the profit from the business she will pay school fees for her children. In the future she would like to own a big shop selling a variety of consumable goods.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, and salt to sell

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a resident of Gujranwala which is famous in Pakistan for its dairy industry. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Khiyani Bi-Pass. She moved here with her family eight years ago. She is 38 years old, married to R., and has three sons and a daughter. Her children can’t read and write as Perveen was unable to educate them due to poor financial condition of her family. 

Now her two elder sons work to contribute financially to the family. Her eldest son has an auto spare parts shop and the 2nd one works in a factory on monthly wage.  Her husband is a laborer and works for a meager income so Perveen helps him financially by doing embroidery work for her neighborhood clients at her home.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the financial assistance of her eldest son who wants to improve the condition of his spare parts shop. With the loan, he will buy spare parts for different vehicles such as motorbikes and cars that will help him get an edge over his competitors and help him making more sales and income. 

Perveen is a new loan user of Asasah and she is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for spare parts business

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar M. is a 47-year-old mother of seven children. She is a teacher of the Kyrgyz language in a school in Kara-Balta town and her husband also works as a teacher in a medical college.  They have a very united family and support each other in all activities.  Unfortunately, the salaries of teachers are very low and Gulnar’s family needs an additional source of income. 

In 2000, they decided to engage in cattle breeding with initial capital of 5,000 KGS. Everyone in Gulnar’s family works hard and they have managed to develop their farm and expand their herd to 15 sheep.  With the revenue, Gulnar was able to reconstruct her house. 

Now, Gulnar plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to further expand her herds for fattening and resale. In the future, Gulnar plans to by a car for her beloved family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose L. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread (mandazi) and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Rose is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en:
Loeb M. is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She stays at home to care for three school-aged children and cooks for her family. Besides her housework, she is also a clothes seller around her community. The family income is contributed to by her husband who works in construction building. Her husband appears in the photo. 

Presently, Loeb M. has been planning to expand her business because she thinks that it is a profitable one for her family. That is why she requested a loan that will enable her business to purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline W. is thirty years old. She is single and has one child aged seven years old whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. Her business is located in the Central Business District of Nairobi. She has a salon which provides hair and beauty services to the local women. She has been in this business for four years now and has one employee. 

Seline says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more hair extensions, treatments and other cosmetics to expand her business and meet her customer demand. In future, she hopes to open more salons in different towns in Kenya. She says that she wants to be very rich through her business. She describes herself as a hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: Hair extensions, treatments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. L. is forty-two years old and married. Her husband is a mason and they have five children aged between twenty-one years old and five years old. Her business is located at Mariakani market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attractions not, forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

Evelyn has been providing tailoring services for the last fifteen years to the local people and has two employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is creditors who don't pay their debts at all and don't even come to pick the clothes made as per their request. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more materials to meet the customer demand. She hopes to grow her business and build her own premises where she will be running her business. She sees herself being able to export clothes in future. She describes herself as sociable and God-fearing.

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Ghafooran's Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran lives in Gujranwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its dairy industry. She is a housewife and prefers to stay at home. She is very active in her household responsibilities and manages them well. She lives with her family in a 3 room brick house. Her husband, M. Y., is a vegetable seller by profession. His shop is in the market, where he offers different fresh vegetables to his clients. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years.

Ghafooran has given birth to 4 sons. Her first two sons work at different jobs. The eldest son has a business of hosiery and second one works in a factory. Her two youngest sons are enrolled in a school and are getting their education.

Ghafooran has applied for a loan for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will put a variety of fresh seasonal vegetables in his shop for reselling. Ghafooran is hopeful that this loan investment will be profitable for her husband’s business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first experience of taking a loan from any MFI.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Martin Karanja

texts.en:
Martin is married, and he and his wife are blessed with two children.  

Martin was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He has never borrowed from any other MFI, so this will be his first loan. He has been in the transport business for two years. With the loan, Martin will purchase another motorbike to assist in enlarging his business. 

Martin's business is located within the town center, and he operates from Kiserian, just few kilometers from the capital city, where he gets a lot of customers, as many people prefer the motorbike because it's faster.  

With the profits, Martin will expand his business to other areas and buy a piece of land on which to build rental homes, thus becoming a landlord, as he believes he is hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mrs. El M., a 37-year-old married mother, lives with her husband and children in a small house located in the city of Phnom Penh. Mrs. El M. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead. Mrs. El M. has rented a market store where she sells chicken to earn a living. She and her husband usually go to buy chicken in bulk at the cheapest price possible from rural people whose houses are full of poultry they raise for meat. Recently, Mrs. El M. ran out of chicken to sell, and she thinks that it is the best time for earning extra profit in order to support her family. Therefore, Mrs. El M. would like a Kiva loan in order to buy additional chicken to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional chicken for expanding her business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon M. is from the village of Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Corazon is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Corazon runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products like milk, coffee, soft drinks breads and other food products in the local community. Aside from that, she also has a karaoke machine that will play song for customers who wants to sing for only 5 PHP. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000  (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye Dembélé est un homme marié de 31 ans et père de 4 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, dés son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Il tenta différentes activités mais sans succès. Alors il finit par apprendre auprès  de son ami l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique. Avec une expérience de plus de 3 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de commerce consistant, il décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il compte acheter une quantité importante d’articles divers de boutique. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni.  Il est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Dembélé is a 31-year-old married man and father of four children. He lives with his wife and children in the Northern Hérémakono district of the city of Bougouni.

He never attended school, starting instead to earn a living at a young age. He attempted several activities without success until he learned from a friend how to run a shop buying and selling various merchandise. With over three years of experience, he now has a good command of his work.

In order to achieve stability in his business, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution.

He plans to buy a large quantity of miscellaneous items. He gets his stocks in Bougouni. This is his third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been fully repaid. His clientele consists of local residents.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 65 000FCFA, which he will use to enhance his shop.

loans.use: Purchase of various merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 37 years old and a single mother of a 9-year-old who attends school. She has been farming for the last year and employs one farmhand. Her farm currently produces eggs, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of horticultural products to the local market. She says the poultry farm is time-consuming and needs a lot of attention and this has been her biggest challenge. Her other challenge has been diseases, which are too costly to treat. She has requested this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farm. She says the proceeds from this project will assist her in paying school fees and providing for the basic needs of her family. In the future, she would like to purchase a hatchery that produces 100 chickens since the potential is high in the region. She is happy with Juhudi and says that she wants Juhudi to diversify its loan offerings to include school fees and biashara (business) loans to enable her to obtain her needs under one roof.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Sidibé est un homme marié de 38 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de  Bougouni.
Monsieur Adama Sidibé a fait des études, en langue Arabe, après lesquelles, il décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités  comme la vente des céréales, mais sans succès. Après une longue réflexion il finit par apprendre auprès de son ami la vente des articles divers tels les habits, chaussures, radios...
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Sa boutique de prêt à porter est située en plein cœur du grand marché de Bougouni.
Pour renforcer son activité, il décide rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, des habits, chaussures, radios et autres petits articles.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako. Il est à son deuxieme prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent ont été correctement bien remboursé.  Sa clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA
texts.en: Adama Sidibe is married, 38 years old and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.  Mr. Sidibe was educated, in the Arabic language, after which he decided to earn a living. He spent years trying different businesses, such as selling grain, but without success. After much thought, he decided to learn from a friend how to run a business selling various items such as clothes, shoes, radios ...  After more than 5 years of experience, he has mastered his business.  His ready-to-wear shop is located in the heart of Bougouni's large market.  To bolster his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy clothes, shoes, radios and other small items. He gets his supplies in Bamako. This is his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loan has been fully repaid. His clientele consists of all social classes.  He expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth S. is from the village of Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Lilibeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and native delicacies like sweetened coconut candy and rice cakes. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. Hean V. is 23 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia (Mrs. V.'s husband appears in the photo). Mrs. Hean V. is married to Nara, a 30-year-old machinery repairman. This couple has four children, and two of whom are students in school, and the other two are still not enrolled in school yet. Mrs. Hean V. is a chicken seller in the busy market. She also buys chicken in bulk at a low price from rural people and then sells them at retail in the market for a profit, earning about $5 a day. Recently, Mrs. Hean V. received orders from her customers for a large amount of chickens, but she lacks the money to purchase enough chickens to fill her customers' orders. So that Mrs. Hean V. is applying for a loan to purchase more chickens for selling.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for selling.

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Otgontuya P. is a 31-year-old single mother who lives with her mother and two children in Uvs province in Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling, in a rented yard. Her oldest son, aged ten, attends a local secondary school while her youngest daughter, aged five, goes to kindergarten; her mother is retired.

Otgontuya has been working in a shoe factory for three years after graduating in 2007 from Ulaangom College with a major in shoemaking. She is planning to sew a variety of shoes in her home to sell to her relatives.

Otgontuya is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials used in making shoes with white soles. In the future she hopes to make a large quantity of shoes and boots in her home. Otgontuya says, "I want to provide a good education for my children."

loans.use: To purchase shoemaking materials

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie S. is 53 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Minlagas, a part of the barangay of San Luis in Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Rosie makes and sells food, primarily snacks and native delicacies like conchita, banana-cues and sweet potato-cues to the local community. Rosie has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Rosie is requesting a new loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make her snacks to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients needed to make her snacks for sale

location.town: Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en: Enhbold C., age 35, lives with his family in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling. His wife stays at home to watch their young children. Since 2007, Enhbold has been transporting loads using his own big truck between towns and has gained much experience. Now, he is planning to transport harvests from the countryside. Enhbold is a modest and hardworking man. He wishes to improve his truck. Therefore, he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To improve his truck

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly M. is 50 years old. Her husband’s name is Ly Smael. He is 53  and is shown in the photo above. To earn a living, this couple owns decorating equipment which they rent to people who need to decorate for their wedding or other ceremonies. The family typically generates revenue of US$8 each day and has been in their business for seven years. Presently, Mrs. Ly M. is running her service very well and has a lot of clients who recognize the good service she provides. Therefore, Mrs. Ly M. will use the loan to accumulate a bigger quantity of her decorating materials in order to better satisfy her customers’ desires.

loans.use: To accumulate a bigger quantity of decorating materials.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby V. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Ruby is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She is also into making and selling foods for viands (fancy dishes) for different meals like sotanghon and pancit guisado. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy  Mbatha

texts.en:
Lucy Mbatha K. is married and has three children. She has been in the catering business and at the same time has been a green grocer for seven years.

Lucy was introduced to KADET by a credit officer (she has no prior history with any MFI). She is servicing her second loan, having paid off the first loan successfully. With the loan Lucy will purchase dishes, plates, sufurias (deep-sided, flat-bottomed metal cooking pots) and expand her shop.

With the profits, Lucy will save money, then in the future add stock or look for another business to open. Lucy hopes to make her family financially stable and donate to the unfortunate. She also wants to grow spiritually.

loans.use: To buy dishes, plates and sufurias

loans.name: Mahmadjoni

texts.ru: Махмадчони Абдушукур проживает в городе Сарбанд. Возраст, 21 год. Женат, детей не имеет. Образование среднее. Занимается перевозкой людей, то есть предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области уже 3 года. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Mahmadjoni A. lives in the city of Sarband.  He is 21 years old, married, and has no children.  He has a high school education.  He works transporting people.   In other words, he renders a service by driving a taxi. He has been doing this for three years. He is taking out a loan to buy a new vehicle.

loans.use: Buying a new vehicle

loans.name: Gladys Wanjiku

texts.en:
Gladys Wanjiku N. is married, and they have three children to support. Gladys has been in the health business for two years. She has a clinic that holds medicine and lab equipment. Gladys operates in a busy market in town.

Gladys joined KADET with the help of a credit officer, and she is servicing her first loan (she has never borrowed from any other MFI). With the loan she intends to add stocks of medicine and buy lab equipment for her office. With the extra profits, Gladys plans to send her children to a university; she also is hopeful that she can open a nursing home and take care of patients, as she believes she is enterprising.

loans.use: To increase stocks of medicine and buy lab equipment

loans.name: C1166 Intambwe Group

texts.en:
Theresphore was born in 1981. He is married with two children. One of the children is 5 years and other one is 7 years old. Theresphore is a farmer as is his wife. They both work hard to develop their family. Theresphore is the group leader of 11 people, all farmers. Theresphore is known for his agriculture business. He has four years of experience and he works every day except on Saturday. The hours of his daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 12 AM.

Theresphore and his group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their daily activities through buying fertilizer and seeds. With this loan, these farmers will be able to earn more profits from their agriculture. With the profits expected, they will be able to sort out their family problems.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A. is 45 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Agay-ayan, a part of Gingoog City in Misamis Oriental province on the islands of Mindanao. Marina runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products like coffee, biscuits and dried fish to the local community. She also makes and sells snacks like rice cakes and fruit ice candy. Marina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine V. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Katherine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Katherine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling biscuits, instant juice & daily use products like bath soaps and dishwashing liquids in the local community. Katherine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Katherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Katherine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Katherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Violet Wawuda

texts.en:
Violet is married and has two children whom they support. 

Violet was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and she has no history with any MFI.  She is applying for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000. She intends to add more stock of clothes as she prepares for the high season of Christmas. She has been in the hawking business for nine months and makes a good profit.  

Violet's business is located within the area in which she resides and her customers are residents of the area. 

With the profits, Violet will expand her business to other areas and open up a boutique. Her hopes are to own a salon and a boutique.

loans.use: To add more stock.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Gina is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling both food like canned goods & instant noodles & daily use products like candles and bath soaps in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn J. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Jocelyn is separated from her spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business making and selling a variety of food especially for viands (special dishes) for different meals like pork and chicken adobo and boiled beef spare ribs in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sles

texts.en: Sles K., 43 years old, owns a small shop in Phnom Penh City where she sells sausage. She typically makes around $3 profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She has been married for many years to Mr. Koeu, 41 years old. He is a car taxi driver who goes to all provinces. Her husband appears in the photo. Sles K. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. Presently, Mrs. Sles K. has been paying money for a taxi to pick up her products because she doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, she is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for transporting her items.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for transporting her goods

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been farming for five years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans and milk, all of which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of clothes to the local market. Her primary challenges in farming are the lack of enough funds to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, the lack of a ready market for her products and diseases which affect her farm products and animals.

She has requested this loan of 30,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her to pay the school fees of her children and improve the livelihood of her family. In the future, she would like to buy a lorry to transport her products to the market. She also plans to buy more land and increase the number of her dairy cows to five.

Florence is 49 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 4 children who are all adults. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bobo

texts.ru: Саидалиев Бобо проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Арендует торговую точку, где в основном продает мужскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимаются уже 3 года. В продвижении бизнеса ему помогают жена и дети. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Bobo S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  He is 49 years old, married, and has two children. He has a high school education.  He works trading in the city’s central market.  He rents a shop where he primarily sells men's wear.  He has been doing this kind of work for three years.  His wife and children help him with his business.  He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 41 years old and married with four children aged between 3 and 12. Eugene is a businessman and he is the only one who works in his family. That is the reason why he has to work hard in order to provide everything necessary for his family. Eugene owns a small business of selling products made in wood for decoration. He has 15 years of experience in that kind of business. The hours of his daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Eugene is now requesting a Kiva loan Via Vision Finance Company in order to buy raw materials to be used in his transformation of decoration materials.	With the extra money expected, Eugene will be able to sort out his family problems and his business problems as well.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Kimyo

texts.en:
Kimyo sells women’s clothing in the local market. She is married with 4 children. She was forced to launch her business 15 years ago in order to be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Kimyo is seeking a loan of 7500 Somoni to diversify her clothing merchandise. She believes the current loan will help her meet her customers’ demands and increase her selection of merchandise for the coming cold season. Kimyo realizes that at all stages in her business development it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to maintain a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina, Firdousi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To diversify her clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en: Arayik T. is married with two children. The family lives in near Dashtadem village, Aragatsotn region of Armenia. Arayik was injured during the war. When he came back to his home, he vigorously started setting up an agricultural business to start a family. Now the family’s main income comes from farming and land cultivation. Arayik’s dream is to give his children the opportunity to have a good education and bright future. Arayik has applied to SEF International for a loan to purchase cattle and feed.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling flowers in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional flowers to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old, widowed, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling food products like milk in sachets and snack foods in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1998, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has a mixed farm that produces maize, milk, sorghum and bananas, all of which are sold to the local market. She has been farming for 10 years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. She also earns income from the sale of clothes to the local market. Her major challenge in farming has been drought, which affects her crops and stock of animal feed. 

Josephine is 40 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three school-aged children, who all attend school.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying school fees for her children and improving the livelihood of her family. In the future, she would like to buy more land and expand her farming by increasing the number of her dairy cows to five.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi lives with his wife and four children. He runs a small business selling clothing for kids. He has been in this business for several years and has been quite successful. Sadi is a very polite and affable businessman. He offers a variety of good-quality inventory for reasonable prices and his willingness to make sure that his customer’s needs are met help him stay competitive and maintain repeat clientele. A nice, convenient location for his business also adds to the success of his trade. Sadi is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase additional inventory. He believes that financial assistance, in combination with his hard work and perseverance, will help him keep up with competition and contribute to the successful growth and increased profitability of his business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique was born in 1982. She is single and takes care of one child who is 3 years old.  Angelique has owned a small shop where she sells different goods as her picture indicates.  Among these goods, it includes juice, cosmetic goods, cooking oil etc.  Angelique has been in this business for about eight years and her shop is open from 7 am until late in the evening. 

Although Angelique has been in this business for such a long time, her capital is too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  If given this loan, she will purchase a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.  With these additional goods for sale, as they are highly demanded by a large number of customers, Angelique hopes to help her husband building their own house and continue building a secure future for their families.

loans.use: a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans, etc

loans.name: Rahmonberdi

texts.en:
H. Rahmonberdi is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. Rahmonberdi works raising cattle and sheep and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he would need to purchase a better breed of livestock and these animals are very costly. 

Rahmonberdi is requesting this loan  as he needs an additional operating capital of 6500 Somoni.  Rahmonberdi hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
H. Nemat is 48 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Nemat is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells at commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him because raising animals is what he enjoys most. Nemat requires an additional amount of money to increase the number of his cattle. His goal is to increase his production and thereby increase his household income in addition to remaining solvent in order to continue working at buying and selling animals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Upendo A. is in her mid thirties and is married with three children. Over the past year she has been running her own charcoal business. The business is open between 8 am and 6:30 pm daily and earns Upendo a small monthly profit.

This will be Upendo's 1st loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use the loan to increase her stock of charcoal so she can meet the increasing demand for her product. Upendo's dream is to one day open up her own shop from which she can sell the charcoal.

Upendo will share this loan with her loan group Mbogo, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Upendo is seen on the far left in the middle row.

loans.use: To increase the stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Benrogous Mulongo

texts.en:
Benrogous is married and they have two children who attend school. They live in Kibera, an suburb of Nairobi City, and this where he sells the shoes to his customers who are mostly within his area residence and  to passerbys.  

Benrogous was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He has no history with any other MFI. He is servicing his first loan of Kshs .20,000. 

Benrogous has been in this business of shoe selling  for twenty years and has made a good income. With the loan he intends to add more stock of shoes in preparation for the Christmas season. 

With the profits, Benrogous will expand his business to other areas and start selling second hand shoes wholesale. His hopes are to educate his children, have a boutique and own rental houses.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for 15 years. His mixed farm produces tea, maize and beans which are sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the needs of his family. His primary challenges are drought and diseases which affects his crops and animals.

He has requested this loan of 40,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and feed a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. The health of his family will improve since the family will have enough milk for consumption. In future, he would like to expand his tea farm and increase the number of dairy cows to 4.

Charles is 47 years old. He is married with 5 school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
For the past 10 years Abdukayum, who is married with three children, has owned a small business selling various home products including shampoo, soap, a variety of cleaning agents, etc. Located in the central market and offering good prices, his store attracts many customers. Abdukayum is a very responsible and disciplined person, always repaying his loans on time. He is now requesting a loan of $3000 USD to purchase additional inventory, hoping to thereby increase sales and develop his business further.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to increase the range of goods sold

loans.name: Neli Francisco Paia

texts.pt:
Neli Francisco paia S. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de 11, 15 e 18 anos de idade, os dois mais novos vão a escola. Fez a 6ª classe não continuou devido a gravidez indesejada. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, possui um negócio próprio de venda de frangos ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado conta com ajuda dos seus filhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por cada lote de produção que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que já teve empréstimos nesta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos e raçoes para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro credito para fazer criação em grande escala.
texts.en:
Neli Francisco Paia S. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of three children, who are eleven, fifteen, and eighteen.  The two youngest are in school.  She finished sixth grade and didn't continue due to an unwanted pregnancy.  She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't financially support anyone outside of her family.

She never left the city of Maputo.  She has had her own business where she has sold chickens for more than four years.  She doesn't have any employees, but she has the help of her children.  She makes an income of 20,000 meticais for each lot that she produces, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some through a system known as Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system).

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who already had a loan with the institution.  This is her first loan in the amount of 16,000 meticais, which she will use to buy chicks and feed to increase the quantity of her stock.

She is confident that she will make her payments before their deadlines and will then ask for another loan to raise chickens on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 29 years old and single. Theogene lives with his family and he has to contribute to his family to provide for the necessities. In fact, Theogene is a businessman. He sells timbers. This business is profitable in the city just because timbers are some of the materials used in construction activities. Theogene is seasoned in his business. He has seven years of experience and the hours of his daily activity are from 7 AM to 7 PM every day.

Theogene is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more timber. With this expansion, Theogene will be able to satisfy his customers, which will be the best way of earning more profits to be used in his business and in his family as well. He will reinvest extra money in his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional timber

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
Abdurasul K. has been offering transportation services in Kanibadam in Northern Tajikistan for the past eight years. He has a beautiful wife and four adorable children. Having already benefited a great deal from IMON International financial services, Abdurasul is now requesting a loan of $1400 USD to cover some maintenance costs and to repair the running gear of his vehicle. He is always trying to find ways to reduce costs and increase his profits.

One of Abdurasul’s main goals is to provide for his family of six. We believe Abdurasul’s perfect credit history with IMON International and focused approach as a businessman will secure prompt loan repayment of the loan to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Marta Chadreque

texts.pt:
Marta Chadreque P. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique é viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de idades entre 23 a 35 anos de idade os dois mais novos vão a escola. Fez a 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu sobrinho que vive com ela.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para o Distrito de Namaacha com a sua família procurando melhores condições de vida. Trabalha como camponesa ha mais de 30 anos, produzindo hortícolas e cereais para a venda. Possui um empregado que tem auxiliado nos trabalhos de produção onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa. 

Ja teve empréstimos na Procredit e decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através das mobilizações feitas na sua zona de trabalho. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos agrícolas para aumentar as suas áreas de produção.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito para aumentar ainda mais a sua área de produção e adquirir uma motobomba para o regadio.
texts.en:
Marta Chadreque P. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of 6 children who are between the ages of 23 and 35.  The two youngest are in school.  She finished 4th grade and did not continue due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home and also supports her nephew that lives with her.

She left the city of Maputo for the district of Namaacha with her family in search of better living conditions.  She has worked as a simple farmer for more than 30 years, producing crops and grains to sell.  She has one employee who helps her in her production.  She makes an income of between 3,000 and 4,000 meticais per month, which she puts towards her living expenses.  She also saves a little in her home.  

She had already had loans with Procredit and decided not to continue with them.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through mobilizations they did in the area where she works.  This is her first loan in the amount of 20,000 meticais, and she will use it to buy agricultural supplies to increase her production.

She is confident that she will make her payments before the given deadlines so she can ask for another loan to increase her production even more and to acquire a pump to use for irrigation.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf N. is 31 years old and lives in Isfara town. He is married and has two children. Maruf processes and sells dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making dried apricots. He purchases dried apricots from local farmers wholesale, and after processing sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Maruf to make his business quite successful and it provides a stable income for the family. Currently, he needs a loan of $1,500 USD loan to buy supplies so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Maruf expresses his gratitude for everyone's support.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
Davlat N. is 25 years old. He has 9 years of experience in the beef business. His wife is a housekeeper and Davlat is the sole breadwinner in his family. Due to this way of life, this father works hard every day to support his family with the best quality of life he can afford. His butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the population that reside in their region. Davlat buys cattle in the market and sells their fresh meat daily to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan of 5000 Somoni to invest in more cattle so he can have enough meat to satisfy all of his customers' demand.    
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.
