loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Reuben Mwilu

texts.en:
Reuben is married and has four children whom they support.

Reuben was introduced to KADET by a credit officer, he is not with any other MFI, and he is servicing his first loan. Reuben has owned a general store  for two years and he is a driver as well. With the loan he intends to add more stock to the store, as believes that sales will be good because the high season is approaching.

His business is located in Kwan-Njega, a few kilometres from Nairobi City, and his customers are residents of the area. With the profits, he plans to develop his  business and in future to open up a wholesale shop.

Reuben believes he is an active businessman and hopes to do better in future.

loans.use: To add more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, frozen meat, bags of rice, beans, pepper, salt and seasoning.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 29 years old and married with 3 children who are between the ages of 4 and 6. Two of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 5 years. His mixed farm produces tea, maize, tomatoes and vegetables which he sells to the local market. He depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 30,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help him pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. His biggest challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and lack of enough animal feed. He hopes that in future he will be able to expand his farming activities by acquiring 3 more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter  Mutua

texts.en:
Peter is married and they have three children who they support. Peter was introduced to KADET LTD through a credit officer and he is not in any other MFI.

Peter has been in the tree planting business for three years and he also does sales of clothing as a secondary business.  With this loan Peter plans to  buy seeds for tree planting and increase his clothing business.

Peter's business is located in an open air market in Tala and he has many customers. With the extra profitshe desires to grow his business and improve the standard of living to the family.

Peter hopes to diversify in tree planting country wide as he believes he is hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to  buy seeds for tree planting.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak has graduated from Economics school.In 2005 he sold his summer house and invested in setting up his own business to be financially independent and have a stable income.  Hesells women’s clothing and cosmetics.  The large variety of quality goods that he has available attracts a large women clientele. Recently the demand for his goods has increased, and Spartak must bring in more variety. He has applied to SEF for a loan to purchase new inventory stock.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, and hair grease

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar S.  est un marié de 36 ans qui habite à Yoff. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 10 ans. Monsieur S. est actuellement commis de chambre a l’hôtel  Ngor Diarama  par l’intermédiaire d’une de ses sœurs qui l’a recommandé .Mais auparavant il a exercé l’activité de pêche.  L’objectif  visé par Monsieur S. est  d’être  actif et de  gagner sa vie à travers la qualité de son travail. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2007. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de s a maison maternelle afin d’améliorer le cadre de vie familial.
texts.en:
Mr. Matar S. is a 36-year-old man who lives in Yoff. He is married and has four children whose ages range from 2 to 10 years old. 

Mr. S. currently works as a clerk at the Ngor Diarama hotel following a recommendation by one of his sisters. Previously, he had been a fisherman. 

Mr. S.’s goal is to remain active and earn a living through the quality of his work. He has been a member of Yoff credit union since January 2007. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to repair his maternal home and improve living conditions.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more shoes and slippers

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar N. est un menuisier de 41 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3ans et demi et 13 ans. Apres l’école primaire Monsieur N.  a choisi l’activité de menuiserie par passion. Cette passion est orientée vers la fabrication de meubles de maison, de lits, armoires, etc. Ce qui l’intéresse aussi le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de l’activité. Parallèlement  a la menuiserie, il pratique  le commerce d’appareils portables qu’il va se procurer en Mauritanie et revient les vendre a Dakar. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis septembre 2008.Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000frs prévu pour le financement de son voyage sur la Mauritanie. Ce montant sollicité sera destiné  à l’achat de portables. Son souci est d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer  les conditions de vie  sociale de sa famille pour une meilleure prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne et des frais médicaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar N. is a 41-year-old furniture maker. He lives in the town of Yoff. He is married and the father of two children who are three and a half and 13 years old.

After primary school, Mr. N. chose the activity of furniture maker by passion. This passion is oriented towards the building of house furniture, beds, wardrobes etc.
He is most interested by the money-making aspect of this activity. He is making furniture and at the same time selling mobile phones. He gets the mobile phones in Mauritania and comes back to sell them in Dakar.

He has been a member of the Yoff Branch since September 2008. He is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs to finance his trip to Mauritania. The requested amount will be used to buy mobile phones.

His concern is to increase his income and improve the living and social conditions of his family, to better provide for the daily expenses and medical costs.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Lapot

texts.en:
Lapot is married and they have three children who they support. Lapot joined KADET through the marketing awareness meeting, which was arranged by World Vision. She is taking her first loan and she has never borrowed from any other MFI. 

Lapot is a livestock trader and has been in the business for 10 years. With the loan, she will buy more livestock to raise and sell later during high season. Lapot operates in a busy open-air market and for sure, she gets many customers.

With the extra profits, Lapot will pay school fees for her children and take care of her family needs. Lapot is hopeful that she will become a big livestock trader, as she believes she is hardworking and ready to grow.

loans.use: To buy livestock to raise and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: Madame Mareme G. est une femme de 45 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 et25ans. Depuis plus de plus de 25 ans elle exerce l’activité de commerce de tissus. Elle a fait ce choix parce que c’est une activité qui procure beaucoup de bénéfices. Aussi  en même temps elle est employée comme femme de ménage dans le projet  du programme de développement  de l’enfant et de la famille à  Diamalaye. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis février 2006. Elle  sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de marchandises qu’elle va placer à ses clients. Son souci est d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Mareme G. is 45 years old. She lives in the township of Yoff. She is married and the mother of three, from 6 to 25 years of age. For more than 25 years she has been in business selling fabric. She selected this line of work because it is a profitable activity. In addition, she is employed as a housekeeper within the framework of a program for child and family support services in Diamalaye. She joined the Yoff mutual fund in February 2006. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 West African francs in order to purchase merchandise for reselling to clients. Her goal is to increase her revenues and to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: Bolstering working capital

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en:
Mary Wambui G. is a 62-year-old married lady. Her husband and she are blessed with five children aged 34, 32, 28, 24 and 20 years old. They live in Eldoret, Kenya. Mary owns a butchery from which she sells meat at a profit. She has been in this business for the past three years with an income of 4,000 KES per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET by a friend, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET of 30,000 KES. With this loan she plans to buy more cows to rear and sell their meat to her clients. She hopes to operate and open many branches in town, whereby she would be able to supply more meat to hotels and cafes.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Samuel Kimosop

texts.en:
Samuel Kimosop I. is 49 years old, married to Nelly Chebet and has four children aged twenty-two years, eighteen years, twelve years and two years. He has been in the public transport business for ten years in Kapsowar, Eldoret, Kenya. His wife is also a business lady who adds to the family’s income. From his transport business Samuel earns a profit of 50,000 KES per month.

Samuel is applying for a second loan from KADET after having successfully paid back his first loan. He plans to use this loan to buy cereals for resale as a secondary business. From the anticipated profits he plans to establish a hardware shop for his wife.

In the future Samuel hopes to own a bus with a capacity of eighty seats, the profits from which will enable him to provide for his family’s basic needs and also see his children become enlightened through education and be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Mbathio

texts.fr: Madame Mbathio N. est âgée de 53 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 14et 32ans. Madame N. a choisi le commerce pour  améliorer sa capacité financière et assister sa famille sur le volet social. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et d’appareils portables depuis 1990.Madame N.  est salariée car elle est assistante depuis 1997 dans un centre  de santé de la zone. La réalisation de profits que lui procure son activité lui permet de trouver une solution pour son niveau de salaire insuffisant. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mars 2009 et a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. L’objet de ce prêt est de renforcer son capital pour l’achat de tissus et de portables pour les besoins de son commerce.
texts.en: Mrs. Mbathio N. is 53 years old. She lives in the township of Yoff. She is married and the mother of five, from 14 to 32 years of age. Mrs. N. decided to go into commerce in order to boost her financial resources and help her family improve its social standing. She has been selling fabrics and cell phones since 1990. Mrs. N. has been employed as an assistant in the local health center since 1997. The additional income brought in by her business is a solution to the problems created by her insufficient salary level. She joined the Yoff mutual fund in March 2009 and already had a loan in the past. The purpose of the current loan is to bolster her capital to purchase fabrics and cell phones for her business.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Suubi Development Association-Kampala Group

texts.en: It may seem like a recycled cliche, but most business owners in Uganda attribute their start-ups to inspirational pep talk from close family or friends.  Thirty-two-year-old Margret S. is no exception as she says what spawned the idea for her rentals and poultry businesses was motivational talk from friends.  Margret is happily married with 5 children and says it was about 6 years ago when she started this business. Margret is a dedicated, hardworking, and steadfast woman.   Her business generates 25,000 shillings for her a week. She says she will buy more broilers for her poultry business. She belongs to Suubi Development Association-Kampala.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for her poultry business

loans.name: Deolinda Tomas

texts.pt:
Deolinda Tomas F. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique é viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de idades entre 18 a 27 anos de idade. Fez a 4ª classe não continuou devido a casamento prematuro. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para cidade da Matola quando começaram a constituir seu lar com o marido. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 20 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 14.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria. (Barclays). 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma conversa com um cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (panos, lencois, cortinas e produtos alimentares) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para melhorar as condições de habitação em sua casa oferecendo mais conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Deolinda Tomas F. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of six children, who are between 18 and 27-years-old.  She finished through fourth grade but didn't continue because she got married early.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.

She left the city of Maputo for the city of Matola when she and her husband began to build their home.  She has had her own business selling basic goods for more than 20 years.  She doesn't have any employees and makes a monthly income of around 14,000 meticais.  She puts this towards living expenses and also saves some in her bank account at Barclays.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a conversation with another customer of the bank.  This is her first loan in the amount of 10,300 meticais, which she will use to buy merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, and food) to increase her amount of merchandise.

She is confident that she will make her payments before their deadlines so she can ask for another loan to improve her home's living conditions and offer more comfort to her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, and food).

loans.name: Ndeye Binta

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Bineta N. est une femme de 44 ans qui habite à Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 et 18 ans. Elle évolue depuis 2003 dans le commerce de  boubous, de tissus et de chaussures. Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par passion mais aussi dans le but de  s’impliquer dans la vie active afin de participer a la satisfaction des besoins de la famille grâce  a l’aspect lucratif de cette activité. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2010 et n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destiné  à l’achat de boubous pour enfants, de tissus et de chaussures  pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus périodiques et d’améliorer les conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndeye Bineta N. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Yoff. She is married and the mother of five children whose ages range from 6 to 18. Since 2003 she has been in business selling « boubous » (dresses), fabrics, and shoes. She chose the business because of her passion for it, but also with the goal of staying active and participating in meeting her family's needs thanks to her profits from the business.

She has been a member of the Yoff branch of UIMCEC since July 2010 and has never received a loan through the institution. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase children's boubous, fabrics, and shoes to build up her stock. Her goal is to increase her seasonal income and to better her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose T. is 33 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. They have six children, three of whom go to school. Rose is currently in the business of selling various items from her shop such as cartons of salt, bags of beans, etc.

Rose is requesting a loan to stock more items in her shop to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to work on building a house.

loans.use: Stock more items in her shop to sell

loans.name: Kisakye Group-Rubaga,kampala

texts.en:
40-year-old K. Berna has a 15 year track-record of hard work in her retail business to maintain. Resting on any kind of laurels is not a proposition she is likely to stoop to, given what is at stake. She has 5 kids and other dependants for whom to provide welfare. She also has to pay for their education. Originally, this happily married mother of 5 was operating a restaurant. 

In a week, her business generates 60,000 shillings. With this loan, she is talking of expansion. This expansion, she says, will be in the form of substantial purchases of more stock for resale.

Berna belongs to K. Group Rubaga.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Nkooyio

texts.en:
Nkooyio is married and they have four school-going children. He joined KADET through a Credit Officer and is taking his first loan, He never borrowed from any other MFI. Nkooyio is a livestock trader and has been in the business for nine years. With the loan, Nkooyio will add livestock to his business. Nkooyio operates in a busy market in a town where he interacts with many customers.

With the extra profits, Nkooyio will hold a party for his family and take care of his family needs. Nkooyio is hopeful that he will become a big livestock trader, as he believes he is ambitious, hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase cows and goats to raise and sell later at a profit

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La señora María Cañete es la presidenta del comité y se dedica a la venta de ropas, mediante esta actividad ella logra obtener un ingreso para su familia, asi puede brindarle mejores bienestar a su familia.
Ella comenta que el comité que integra es muy unido y todas se ayudan mutuamente y de esa manera salen adelante todas juntas.
Cada integrante retira el crédito para invertir en su actividad o para algunos gastos importante que tienen sus familias.
La señora María solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas, como camisa, remeras, y otras prendas de vestir para contar con variedad de mercaderías.

Ella forma parte de un comité muy unido y cada integrante como ella tiene una actividad independiente que le genere ingreso y lo van mejorando con la ayuda de las capacitaciones y los créditos que recibe de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Señora María Cañete is the president of the group and makes a living by selling clothing.  Through this activity, she makes an income for her family so she can offer them well-being.

She told us that their group is very united, and they all help each other mutually.  In this way, they all succeed together.  Each member is withdrawing the loan to invest in her business or to help with some important expenses that her family has.

Señora María is requesting a loan to buy clothing like shirts, t-shirts, and other garments so she can have a larger variety of merchandise.

She is a member of a very united group, and each member has an independent business that generates income.  They are improving their group with the help of training courses and the loans that they receive from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts, shirts, dresses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Peter Gitungo

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Olkalou town since 1982.  He is 40 years old, married to Rahab Wanjiru and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Peter hopes to buy another piece of land for farming, thus increasing his output.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rabbcan

texts.en: Rabbcan R. is currently in the business of selling food items at the market. She sells onions, tomatoes, cassava etc and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of onions to sell.  Rabbcan is 22 years old and widowed. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth K. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has six children, three of whom are in school.  Ruth has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Ruth sells her products at the market at retail. Ruth has requested  for a loan of 600,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenge(s) for Ruth include transportation and market dues.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start selling at wholesale only. Ruth lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include market dues and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Jackson Mwaniki

texts.en:
Jackson has practiced farming in Olkalou town since the year 2001.  He is 51 years old, married to Margaret Mugure and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy potato and maize seedlings for planting. 

In the future, Jackson hopes to open a clothes shop in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy potato and maize seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Wofunira Women's Group 1-Zzana, Kampala

texts.en: 51-year-old Harriet N. was previously in the poultry business. With time, however, her priorities changed. About three years ago she began selling charcoal, bananas, tomatoes and onions in Zzana, Kampala. To reach where she is today, she had to summon a lot of diligence to face both trying and flourishing times. Harriet comes across as a happy-go-lucky woman who speaks very highly of her four kids, who she cares for very much. Harriet says that she owes it to herself to see that her kids get a good education. In a week her cash inflows are approximately 50,000 shillings. Harriet is requesting this loan to buy more lucrative cash crops like pineapples and cabbages to resell primarily to restaurant owners. She is affiliated with the Wofunira group-Kampala.

loans.use: To purchase more lucrative cash crops like pineapples and cabbages to resell

loans.name: Luisa Alberto

texts.pt:
Luísa Alberto G. nasceu na cidade da Beira, província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique solteira mãe de 3 filhos de 14, 21 e 23 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Fez a 12ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras para ingressar a faculdade. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta seu sogro que vive com ela.

Saiu da Beira para Maputo através da transferência dos serviços. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 30 anos é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Também possui um negocio de venda de frangos onde faz um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimo no Millenium Bim, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos e raçoes para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro credito para aumentar ainda mais a quantidade da sua criação.
texts.en:
Luísa Alberto G.  was born in the city of Beira in the province of Sofala in the center of Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 3 children, who are 14, 21, and 23.  They youngest one goes to school.  She finished through 12th grade and didn't continue because of the lack of financial resources for college.  She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her father-in-law, who lives with her.

She left Beira for for Maputo due to a job transfer.  She has worked as a teacher for more than 30 years for the Ministry of Education.  She also owns a business where she sells chickens.  She makes a monthly income of around 15,000 meticais, which she puts towards her living expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account.

She has already had a loan with Millennium Bim.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through her work colleagues who are also clients of this organization.  This is her first loan in the amount of 20,000 meticais, which she will use to buy chicks and feed so she can increase her amount of stock.

She is confident that she will make her payments before their deadlines so she can ask for another credit and continue to increase the number of chickens she raises.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, three of whom are in school.  She changed her business enterprise from selling fruits and vegetables to bananas. She has been in this business for a few months and she works 7 days out of every week. Deborah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Deborah has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and market dues. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also start selling on wholesale only. Deborah lives in a home where she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Maria Clara Da Assuncao

texts.pt:
Maria Clara da Assunção Z. conseguiu comprar todo o material acordado com a Hluvuku e aplicou para o uso planificado no acordo. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra sem nenhuma dificuldade, pois a sua renda ainda tem ajudado bastante no sustento da familia.

A obra de construção da sua casa que esta neste momento na sua fase terminal, com o presente empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt pretende comprar o material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, porta e outros) para concluir a sua casa, oferecendo assim melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.

No futuro pretende solicitar outros empréstimos para o apetrechamento da casa e garantir uma veada melhorada a sua família.
texts.en:
Maria Clara da Assunção Z. bought all of the materials she agreed on with Hluvuku and used them according to plan.  She paid back her debt without any difficulty.  Her income has helped her support her family a lot.

The construction of her home is now in its final phase.  With the current loan of 25,000 meticais, she will buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, a door, etc) to finish it.  This will provide her family with better living conditions.

In the future, she hopes to request other loans to make improvements to her home and to guarantee a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, a door, etc.)

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen M. is a maize vendor and is requesting a loan to stock more maize to sell. Ellen is 40 years old. She and her husband have seven children, three of whom attend school.  

With the extra profits she expects to gain from her loan, she hopes to be able to start building a house for the family.

loans.use: To stock more maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta T. habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est âgée  de 46 ans. Elle  est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 14 et 28 ans. Madame T. a démarré  l’activité de commerce depuis plus de six ans maintenant. Elle l’a choisi par passion mais aussi dans le souci de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son activité de commerce est très diversifiée car en même temps qu’elle vend des tissus, draps, thioup  elle s’active aussi dans le petit commerce en vendant des bonbons et du petit déjeuner.  Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis février 2005. Elle a déjà remboursé trois prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs qui sera destiné à renforcer son fond de commerce. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices avec ce financement pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle souhaite vivement accroitre son activité de commerce et disposer d’un grand magasin de tissus dans le futur.
texts.en: Mrs. Bineta T. lives in the town of Yoff. She is 46 years old, married and mother to seven children, whose ages range from 14 to 28 years old. Mrs. T. began her commercial activity more than six years ago. She chose it because she liked it, but also because she was anxious to procure an income which would allow her to improve her family's living conditions. Her business is very diversified, since while she sells fabric, sheets and "thioups" (dyed pieces of fabric), she also sells sweets and breakfasts. She has been a shareholder member of the Yoff bank since February 2005 and has already paid back three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs which will be used to strengthen her business. Her goal is to increase her profits with this loan in order to improve her family's living conditions. She is very keen to expand her business and to have a large fabric shop in the future.

loans.use: To boost working capital

loans.name: Wofunira Women's Group 2-Zana,kampala

texts.en:
Betty S. is 20 years old and happily married with four children. She has a successful business selling bananas in Zana, Kampala. For the last four years, Betty has worked hard to expand her business. Her week profits can total up to 90,000 UGX. Betty describes herself as self-directed and diligent. She plans to buy more bananas for resale.

Betty belongs to the Wofunira Women’s Group of Kampala.

loans.use: To purchase bananas

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 12 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces bananas, tea, maize, and eggs, all of which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his lumbering business. His biggest challenges have been the diseases that affect his crops as well as the lack of a ready market for his products.

He has requested this loan of 25,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying school fees for his children and improving the livelihood of his family. In future, he would like to expand his farming by purchasing more land and acquiring at least three more dairy cows. 

Thomas is 47 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children who are between the ages of 17 and 27. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La  Sra. Águeda  es separada, tiene un hijo  en edad escolar.
 .
Ella  se dedica al alquiler de casa y piezas  en la zona de Ciudad del Este,  siendo un negocio de acceso a una clientela constante, lo que colabora con que sea rentable.

Es una persona destacada por su responsable conducta en cuanto al cumplimiento de sus obligaciones, tanto en el ámbito familiar como laboral.

El préstamo al cual ha accedido le mejorar las piezas que ella alquila, y esto le ayudo a mejorar el servicio que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Ms. Águeda is a separated mother with one child of school age.

She rents out houses and rooms in the Ciudad del Este area: it is a profitable activity that can count on recurrent customers.

She is a person known for the respectable way in which she fulfills her tasks, both in the family and in working field.

The loan she is requesting will be used to make improvements to the rooms she rents out, as this will help her improve the service she offers.

loans.use: To make improvements to the houses and rooms she rents out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To puchase construction material (cement, sand, stone, metal sheets, bricks, etc.)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose T., age 22, prepares and sells tea at the local market. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more sugar, coffee, and tea leaves.  Rose's husband is a soldier. They have four children, three of whom attend school. With the extra profits she expects to gain from her loan, she hopes eventually to be able to buy a bus.

loans.use: To stock more sugar, coffee, and tea leaves

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu N. is a banana vendor who sells her wares at retail prices at the market. She works every day of the week. She also generates additional income through her small grocery shop. The main business challenges for Nulu include seasonality and defaulters. 

Nulu has requested a loan of 400,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale. Her primary aspiration for her business is to start going to farmers directly with her wares.   
 
She and her family live in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. Nulu and her husband have four children, none of whom attend school. She and her husband own their home and have access to electricity, although not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses involve providing food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas to offer for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a street vendor who sells blankets, sheets, towels, and some clothing items. She started a few years ago with very little to sell while she was still married. She is now divorced and has two daughters in elementary school. Her stock grew steadily over the next several years, and now she has a good variety of products and has up built a client base. She divides her time between her home product sales and a food stand that she runs in the downtown area.
 
Juliana is a responsible person who wants to improve the life of her family. She has an upbeat attitude and an entrepreneurial spirit that will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy blankets, sheets, clothing, and food and drink items to offer for sale

loans.name: Jose Jorge

texts.es:
Jose Jorge F. A. tiene 53 anos. Es soltero y vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos de 28 hasta 11 anos.  

Jose es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios. 
 
A Jose se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva soya y cacao. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en la provincia mismo. Solicita el crédito para comprar chanchitos. Ya tiene 2 chanchos, pero le gustaría ampliar un poco más. Con el apoyo del préstamo, podría tener más chanchos. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es mantener el hogar y que su hijo estudie. 

Se dedica a ayudar en la casa y le gusta jugar el fútbol.
texts.en:
Jose Jorge F. A. is 53.  He is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.  He has 4 children whose ages range from 11 to 28.

Jose is a member of the communal bank "El Placer de Ser Amigos" (The pleasure of being friends), which is located 20 minutes from the San Jose del Tambo parish.  There are 15 members total in the group, and the majority makes a living by either growing cocoa or by owning their own small businesses.

Jose makes a living through agriculture.  He grows soy beans and cocoa.  He buys and sells his products in his same province.  He is requesting this loan to buy piglets.  He already has 2 pigs, but he would like to expand his business a little more.  With the help of this loan, he could have more pigs.  His dream for the next 5 years is to support his home and to have his son go to school.

He also helps around his house, and he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Malita

texts.en:
Malita N. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Malita has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Malita sells her products from home, by means of retail.   

Malita has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Malita include  transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and start selling on wholesale only. 

Malita lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent,  school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
VIRGINIA MACHAIANA nasceu no Distrito Municipal da Catembe, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique mae de duas filhas  de 12 e 14 anos de idade ambas vão a escola. Fez o nível básico não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa dos pais e sustenta suas filhas que vivem com ela.

Nunca saiu da Catembe, apenas faz algumas viagens a Republica da África do sul, quando vai a aquisição da sua mercadoria. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de roupa diversa para homens, mulheres e crianças, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus irmãos que também são clientes da Instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, blocos, tintas e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa, o empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 8.000.00mt e foi aplicado no comercio. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros no futuro e concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
VIRGINIA MACHAIANA was born in the municipal district of Catembe in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is the mother of 2 children, who are 12 and 14.  They both go to school.  She finished the basic level of education but didn't continue due to an early pregnancy.  She lives in her parents' home and supports her children, who live with her.

She never left Catembe.  She does make some trips to South Africa to acquire merchandise.  She has her own business selling clothing for men, women, and children.  She makes a monthly income of around 5,000 meticais, which she puts towards living expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through her siblings who are also customers of the organization.  This is her second loan in the amount of 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, metal sheels, bricks, paint, etc.) to continue building her home.  Her previous loan was for 8,000 meticais, which she used for her business.

She promises to pay back her loan on time so she can request more in the future to finish her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction material (cement, metal sheets, bricks, paint, etc.)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a widow and lives with her son now a grown up and an independent person. She is a street vendor and sells men and women’s clothing in the surrounding neighborhoods. 

After losing her husband, Josefina struggled with very little merchandise but had to fight hard because she was on her own. Little by little she grew her business and today she offers a wider variety of products and has a much better choice of stock to offer to her clients. 

Josefina is a responsible person and has the entrepreneurial spirit to improve her business. This coupled with a good attitude will surely help achieve her goals.

loans.use: Clothing for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen M. is currently in the business of selling food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food supplies.  Hellen is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house.

loans.use: Stock more supplies for the restaurant
